title: Watch These 4 Growth Sectors Thrive in 2025
text: Kind: captions Language: en 2024 was a great year for the stock market but could 2025 be even better here to talk about the year in review and a look ahead at what investors can expect in the new year is Market beat analyst Chris marot Chris how is 2024 coming to a close for the market even with the slight pullback that we're seeing here in these last few trading days of the year the S&P 500 is still up about 23% for the year uh the Dow and the NASDAQ are both positive so it's been a good year for stocks despite this volatility that we're seeing at the end of the year what were some of the reasons for all of the growth in 2024 what it really come down to as far as I was concerned is it came down to earnings growth companies in 2023 uh reacted to the interest rate hikes by the Federal Reserve and they made tactical decisions such as layoffs and other cost cutting measures and so many companies beat earnings estimates for the year the companies that beat the earnings estimates their stocks generally went up the stocks that didn't be thurning estimates their stocks generally were flat or went slightly down well two industries in particular had a really great 2024 one of course AI the other the gp1s AI performed in 20124 a lot like it did in 2023 um investors were a little bit more selective about these stocks but still generally anything that had an AI theme Associated to it did very well and as far as the gop1 drugs we've SE seen a little bit of weakness kind of coming towards the end of the year as um analysts are starting to look at the data that these companies are putting out on how effective these drugs are you're starting to see maybe a clear leader in Eli Lily but Nova nordics is still a strong Contender of this category and the reason why I think it still might be a strong sector going into 2025 is that you still see a lot of these biofarma companies making commitments to have gop1 drugs on the market so certainly they don't think this Market's going away well that's a look back at 2024 which again a very strong year for the market but many analysts are expecting 2025 to be perhaps an even stronger year for investors since 1926 the S&P 500 has delivered a positive Return 73% of the time so that basically tells you 34s of the time you can bet that the S&P 500 is going to have a a positive year um and over that time the index delivered a double digit return 60% of the time so again just based on that probability you would think the Market's probably going to have a pretty good year next year but that math is also supported by the trend in the macroeconomic environment and that is instead of seeing inflation tick higher you're seeing the rate of inflation generally speaking moving lower and you're seeing interest rates move lower although maybe not as fast as some investors would like there's some indicators and some analysts are expecting maybe inflation and the economic factors to even improve more with a new Administration starting next year we don't know specifically what the policies from the Trump Administration are going to be but we do have the broad strokes and the broad Strokes is going to be lowering corporate taxes which would be bullish for stocks they're going to be pushing for Less regulation which will be bullish for stocks and also potentially for m&a activity and you know we you've also got this Doge committee which is again we don't exactly know what the specifics of that committee are going to be but any steps that could be taken to reduce government spending would be bullish for stocks yeah Chris you've put together a list of four sectors you expect to take off in 2025 before we get to your list take a look at this free report that lists 10 specific stocks expected to take off in 2025 scan the QR code or check out the link in the description to take a look at that free report on 10 stocks expected to take off in 2025 now Chris let's get to your list of four sectors you expect to see a lot of growth this year so not surprisingly um technology stocks are going to I think still be very strong in 2025 AI is going to remain a hot theme although we may be starting to see a transition ition more into what I call AI 2.0 and that is you're going to start seeing it move maybe a little bit away from the hardware side like Nvidia and towards the software side to companies that can actually show how to monetize AI however I also do think this is going to be a strong year for semiconductors because the build out of AI is still happening in terms of data centers and um just companies needing the hardware to do their own AI applications speaking of AI build outs I think that's another sector that you said to watch for and that's what it takes to run those centers you know utility stocks tend to be pretty boring Investments for a lot of investors 2025 can be an exception that because we we're going to need a lot of power for these data centers and that just one reason to believe in addition to updating our own electrical grid and other factors that 2025 could be a strong year for utility stocks what are some other sectors that you're looking ahead for in 2025 two other picks be Industrials now this is one that has a little bit of nuance to it because much of the infrastructure spending has gone out from the infrastructure Bill signed in 2022 I believe however there are contracts that are in place and that those contracts run through 2025 so even though there might be a a push to curb government spending some of that money is contractually obligated I believe so I think 2025 is still going to be a good year for some of those industrial companies I that are tasked with rebuilding our nation's infrastructure so that might be one area for investors to look and another area would be energy uh the Trump Administration has made us energy Independence a priority we talked about it being a strong sector in 20124 that didn't work out that way but I believe in 2025 um oil stocks energy stocks in general are going to be a strong part of the trade some good information for people to think about as they look towards their investment plans for 202 5 and looking back at celebrating a good year in 2024 thanks again for your time Chris and we are hoping that all of you have a wonderful year in the stock market coming up in 2025 thanks again for joining us here on Market beat we hope you'll stick with us throughout the new year as well as always happy investing [Music] oh

title: 3 Stocks that Wall Street Insiders Can't Stop Buying
text: Kind: captions Language: en Wall Street insiders are buying these stocks going into the new year here with his list of three stocks insiders can't stop buying is Market Beed analyst Thomas Hughes Thomas there are quite a few inside buys happening right now let's first talk about what are inside buys Insider buys are buys by any person individual or institution that qualifies under SEC rules that typically means Executives CEO CFO vice presidents anybody with inside knowledge of the business's operations that might not be made public also institutions and analysts and even to a degree uh Congress people because they do have some insight or knowledge not necessarily of the business but of conditions that the businesses are operating in but what we're looking at are the buys of people who have Insider knowledge or knowledge that is not readily available to other portions of the investment community and how are you finding this information is there a tool on Market beat that can help Market beat has tons of tools to find information about these things uh the tool that I use specifically today was um The Insider buying tracker and uh the tracking the tracking page will track um stocks that are being bought by insiders but also specifically stocks that are being bought just by CEOs now that tool can also help you track which stocks insiders are abandoning we have a free Special Report right now that shows 12 stocks corporate insiders are abandoning scan the QR code or click the link in the description to check out that free report and see which 12 stocks corporate insiders are abandoning most right now let's start out with your first pick of 2025 which is the biggest Insider by stock that you have right now vesus is the most bought by insiders for the last year vesus is a spin-off from Aramark it's their uniform business um now it's a standalone company it's competing with UniFirst and Centos it's about the same size as UniFirst it's about a sixth size of Centos um one of the opportunities here is that it's a potential takeover candidate so what does that mean for the growth of the stock price some the chatter is that the stock is about 15 to 25% undervalued relative to a potential takeover price not counting that potential for takeover uh this company this industry is well positioned for cash and cash flow if you look at Centos it's been producing really awesome cash flow for about three decades uses that money to pay dividends buy back shares that stock price has been going just pretty much straight up as as straight up as it possibly can be invest is in that that that group it's been improving its balance sheet and preparing itself for Capital returns it already pays a nice dividend but what I see here is the potential for share BuyBacks to begin sometime soon if it's not taken over or taken private and what kind of Insider buys are we seeing with vesus so vesus has nine insiders that have been buying for the last year they've made more than a dozen purchases they've been pretty regular throughout the year and they're pretty widespread it shows a pretty good amount of conviction within this group that the stock is worth buying I think you have put vesus as a pretty solid buy for investors right now but your second pick of a stock that insiders are buying is a little bit more of a wild card yeah it is opco Health it has quite a few potential catalysts coming up one of them is potential for takeover it's also got a couple of candidates or um drug therapies that have been gaining traction they're making some Revenue uh but the real problem with this stock is that it's not making money and even with these new positive developments it's going to be a while before it's profitable its balance sheet is not in the greatest Condition it's had to sell a lot of shares over the last year to raise Capital so ution is a real threat so in this case the Insiders buying is a vote of confidence but it could also just be them trying to support the stock price in the interim until one of these other catalysts can start taking control of the market yeah that's definitely a risk sometime with these Insider buys is is it just trying to support the stock more who are the Insiders buying the stock well like with vest it's it's a wide range of insiders we're tracking seven insiders whove made 24 purchases in the last year so they've all made more than one buy they are certainly showing a high amount of conviction in the stock but there are some significant risks that investors need to keep in mind yeah let's talk about what kind of growth potential this stock could have what are analysts saying the analysts see um quite a bit of upside potential the stock could rise 30 to 40% if we get one of those catalysts uh but as I said it just depends on if it gains enough traction to start making money soon enough for the market to stay interested let's move on to your third pick of Insider buys this is a company we haven't covered before no this is gri uh they're an indust Industrial Packaging company so they make things like Jerry cans and plastic barrels and oil cans and other services involved with storing Industrial Products so who are the Insiders buying this stock and why are they buying it a wide variety of insiders making numerous purchases over the past year um they are certainly helping to support the stock price um if you look at the chart you can see it's been range Bound for about two years but it's got a pretty solid floor and that floor is put in place by the Insiders but also by the institutions and the analyst who can be considered insiders uh they've both been buying the stock the analysts are pretty bullish on it and they see it Rising about 30% uh that aligns with the trading range so it looks like this stock could hit a bottom fairly soon and start rebounding how can investors time this kind of a stock buy well you're going to want to watch the charts you're going to want to pick out some pretty good technical entry points and then wait for the market to reach those points and to start showing a signal that signal will be shown in the price action and the indicators and it should align with a bottom and a bit of a rebound you're going to want to see some volume also in this move to help solidify the the bottom and to help add some strength to the market and provide some more upside momentum once the the price starts to move higher and you've already mentioned some of the risk but let's talk to investors any of these three picks or looking at any stocks that insiders are buying right now what are the potential risks or benefits so there certainly are a lot of benefits to following The Insider trades uh there's not a lot lot of reasons for an executive to want to buy a stock if the company's doing badly so even in the case where the Insiders might be trying to support the price action there's is still a bit of a um an affirmation in the company's outlook for them to be buying uh so the real risk is that you look at companies with insiders buying that don't really have the fundamental outlook for growth or for business strength that uh that a good investment would have so like any indicator you're going to want to use The Insider buying as a starting off point for your investment research but then go from there and look at the other fundamental factors that make a good investment and if those things um align then it's probably going to be a pretty good buy some good advice for investors as always Thomas thank you so much for your time today and for sharing these three picks of big Insider buy stocks right now thanks again for joining us here on Market beat as always happy investing especially in the new year [Music]

is worth buying I think you have put vesus as a pretty solid buy for investors right now but your second pick of a stock that insiders are buying is a little bit more of a wild card yeah it is opco Health it has quite a few potential catalysts coming up one of them is potential for takeover it's also got a couple of candidates or um drug therapies that have been gaining traction they're making some Revenue uh but the real problem with this stock is that it's not making money and even with these new positive developments it's going to be a while before it's profitable its balance sheet is title: 3 Underrated AI Stocks Set to Surge in 2025
text: Kind: captions Language: en AI stocks are seeing a big boom this week as 2024 comes to a close where could they go from here here to break it down for us is Market beat analyst Chris marot Chris you are looking at some AI stocks that maybe aren't the big semiconductor stocks but this week we're really looking at some of these smaller AI related stocks that really serve a purpose you know we're getting into that area of the market where investors are moving beyond um just generative AI applications they're looking for companies that are going to be using Ai and applications that are going to actually be things that businesses and individuals are looking for specifically because of those AI capabilities and I think there are a few companies especially in the Robotics and automation area that are going to be interesting because they're putting AI on devices and that's where consumers are really going to be looking for that you know we've seen that in the market this week with SoundHound an AI application that's been incredibly popular for different businesses joining in on this application um and that is really taking off but your list of three Robotics and automation stocks are maybe a little bit newer that have some room for some big gains so let's go ahead and start off with your first pick so the first one is uip path uh this is a midcap stock market cap somewhere around I think 7 billion as I'm as as you and I are talking here Bridget so uipath is probably closest to SoundHound for people that want to put it in a bucket although it's not it doesn't do exactly what soundtown does but what it does it's a software company and it specializes is in what's known as robotic process automation technology RPA and what they do is they work with Enterprise level customers to do your chatbots and other sorts of automated tasks some of the bigger Nam clients that they have would be mongodb and flutter entertainment but one of the key things for investors to know is they work throughout a variety of sectors you're talking about banking you're talking about Healthcare you're talking about Manufacturing I mean they cover the gamut and right now the stock is down 44% for the year so there does look like there's room for some upside yeah that's the upside that a lot of investors are interested in what are analysts saying about how far this stock could grow in the next year the consensus uh price for the stock is about $17.50 that's from the analyst covered by market beat some of that is um from a couple of different analysts JP Morgan Chase being one of that gave it a price target of $18 um I'm seeing a lot of analysts looking at that $16 range but still when you look at a stock that's trading for around $13.86 as you and I are talking right now that's significant upside for a stock like this and what I've noticed is in the last month the Stock's up about 11% short interest is up about 8% so I don't know how much of the price movement up is some short sellers trying to cover their positions or if this is organic interest in the stock but either either way now might be a really interesting time for investors to get in on the stock yeah any other factors that this company could see some more growth in the next year are there more businesses buying into what they offer I think that's that's what we're going to have to watch out for but certainly that's what analysts would seem to be dictating again this is not a this isn't a company that's that's super Niche their their products uh the software that they have is useful for a variety of Industries a variety of applications you're going to want to watch for strong growth in not only Revenue but also in earnings the company now looks like there's um consistently turning a profit that's good that needs to continue a and you also want to be seeing that year-over-year Revenue growth all right let's move on to your second pick and this is a stock we've talked about before on this channel yeah it's intuitive surgical the U ticker symbol is isrg this is a this is a large cap company that a lot of investors are familiar with in the area of robotics specifically the company's known for their Da Vinci system which is a robotic surgical assistant it's a variety of products that are make that that are used to make up this da Vinci system the stock has not been a poor performer this year whatsoever the Stock's up about 61.6% and the stock trades for over $500 a share so some people might say boy there's very little room for the stock to go up but that doesn't seem to be the case yeah so what can make this company see even more growth in in 2025 and what are the analysts expecting for this one the Catalyst uh for growth is just simply the fact that the company is always expanding on the da Vinci system so they're always fine-tuning it making it better it's sort of like a flywheel type of thing the more hospitals and and Physicians start to use it the more there's other hospitals and Physicians that want to use it so it becomes sort of that one of the other things that might help is the fact that interest rates are going down so it may be something that might fit into more budgets uh that maybe it didn't fit into when interest rates were going up and isrg at that time actually the stock suffered a little bit in 2022 and 2023 as interest rates were going up but that's pivoting a little bit sounds good well you can watch our other video if you want to learn a little bit more about this company what's behind it and why isrg continues to be a strong pick here on this channel all right let's move on to your final pick of the day Chris this is what I haven't heard of before this is a company called Rhythm Technologies uh the stock the ticker symbol here is irtc now this is a company that it's got a market cap of just over about $2 billion as we're talking about this today so technically it's not a small cap company but I think it's small enough that we can still consider it in the small cap realm interesting thing about this company is they are designing mobile heart monitoring systems there's a huge market for it in terms of just checking for heart arhythmia now and the whole like idea is patients wear this the information is sent directly to their physician and it gives their physician actionable data to act on one of the things about the stock that's kept it sort of suppressed is the fact that currently it only tests for arhythmia and it's only in the United States but both of those things are changing in the coming years uh the company is trying to expand into International markets and they see potentially a $1 billion total addressable Market overseas they're also trying to get their products certified to test for other conditions such as sleep apnea such as um hypertension and heart failure so if they can expand the useful indications for the product and also increase their the addressable Market that should have a potentially strong impact on the stock yeah that's really really interesting company and exactly what you talked about in this article and in this video is taking Ai and making it useful and making it accessible to everyone and so a mobile app that helps with a Health Solution uh sounds like a really great idea and I know you just mentioned a lot of different growth factors for the stock uh how much are analysts expecting this company to grow in 2025 the stock already trades for over $90 a share for a small cast stock that's pretty impressive but analysts still believe that it it's got about 19% growth ahead of it the consensus Price is Right Around 107 and one of the things that I noted in my article uh because it was something that blew me away was just last week it got a price Target increase from analysts at canic cord genuity group they raised their price Target which was already at 125 and they raised it all the way up to 152 so that just shows that there are some analysts that believe that this stock has a much higher potential to move higher thank you for bringing it to our radar Chris we really appreciate the analysis today uh again you can check out Chris's full article to read a little bit more about these companies and check out our free Special Report on 10 AI stocks set to take off in 2025 to find more of the list of AI stocks maybe you haven't heard of that could find a lot of success for your Investment Portfolio in the new year thanks again for watching everyone and as always happy investing [Music]

title: Why Energy Stocks Are Poised for Explosive Growth in 2025
text: Kind: captions Language: en analysts are expecting a big year for energy stocks in 2025 as these companies work to keep up with all the growth in AI here to break down which three stocks to watch in this sector is Market beat guest Mark lickfeld he is the chief income strategist at the Oxford Club thank you so much for joining us today mark my pleasure thanks for having me so you just released a new report really talking about the one factor that could slow down all of the explosive growth we've been seeing in Ai and that is energy and the demand on the system will you share a little bit about the research that you've done as you may know AI just requires enormous amounts of energy for example a simple chat GPT query requires 10 to 25 times more energy than a simple Google search the draw on energy the requirements for energy from AI are astronomical Elon Musk has said that the next shortage in the United States is going to be electricity Donald Trump has said that because of AI we need twice the amount of electricity that we have in order to have electricity you need something to fuel it so uh so to me energy is is the very obvious story for 2025 yeah that's such a great point and you know we've been talking so much about all these AI stocks that are seeing tremendous growth but just recently we've started to have more analysts and more people talking about these kind of secondary groups that are really supporting Ai and secondary Industries supporting AI energy like you said an obvious one how much uh growth would you expect for some of these energy sector stocks in 2025 I think it's going to be tremendous I mean if you look at things like nuclear energy there are 444 nuclear reactors in the world right now that are operating there are plans for another 110 and those are just the the big reactors there are something called uh small modular reactors which are are just like it sounds smaller nuclear rea actors they take less time to to construct uh those are starting to to go up you've got major major industry major companies like Microsoft and Amazon uh Google that are getting involved with these SMR small modular reactors but that's a long-term solution I'm also looking at natural gas because that's a shorter term solution the United States has loads and loads of natural gas it's cheap it's cleaner than oil and to me that's the short to intermediate term solution for our energy needs whereas nuclear is going to be the intermediate to longer term solution yeah you've already mentioned a couple of sectors there energy is so widespread there's so many different forms of energy and new clean energy coming out as well are there any specific sectors you see supporting the AI growth more than others and I know again you just mentioned nuclear and natural gas but any other sectors to watch in the year ahead yeah data storage which also requires tremendous amounts of energy so this is an amazing statistic I just recently came across 90% of all the world's data throughout history has been created in the last 2 years so and that's only going to increase with AI so there needs to be a place to store all this data so you've got these data centers uh popping up all over the world there's a large concentration of them in Northern Virginia because it's close to Washington and but but there it's happening all over the world and so these data centers require tremendous amount of electricity run the servers to cool the servers that's obviously very very important you know what I like about the the data center REITs and and energy is you know these are the picks and shovels of the new Gold Rush uh you know when you you think back to the gold rush in the 1800s sure some people found a couple of nuggets in the river but really the the ones who made a lot of money were the ones who sold the tools the the shovels the piics the Levi's jeans I want to be involved in the companies that are going to to make money no matter who wins so you know we may or may not be able to pick the next big AI winner just like some people may have gotten Amazon right but a lot of people might have gone with pets.com back 25 years ago I want to be the in the companies that are serving all of them so that no matter who wins these companies that are providing all the tools are making money and that's definitely energy and it's definitely the data center rates that is such a great Point thank you for sharing that with our viewers another thing our viewers love to see and some specific stock picks I know in your special report you have some really great picks and we're gonna share more about that in just a little bit but first let's start out with just some specific energy stocks that you can see doing really really well in 2025 so in the natural gas space I have I have two one is you're not supposed to have favorite stocks but this is is kind of one of my favorites it's been for a long time Enterprise Products Partners ticker symbol is epd this is a master limited partnership and they transport uh natural gas throughout the country as long as companies are transporting natural gas uh much of it will have to go through Enterprises pipelines and they just collect a fee along the way there's not a lot of uh you know Capital that's required to uh to run the business uh basically they just have to maintain these pipelines and it pays uh almost a 7% yield they've been raising the dividend every year for I think about 24 25 years now uh and it's just a a real steady performer year after year the other natural gas company I really like is shenir Energy Partners so not shenir energy shenir energy is the ticker symbol is LNG this is shener Energy Partners also uh master limited partnership and the ticker symbol is cqp and the reason I like it is they have one of the largest uh natural gas terminals in the country uh they stored gas they transport gas and they and they have uh shipping Maritime terminals where they can export the gas which is going to be a bigger and bigger part of the natural gas business in the US going forward Donald Trump is is very much in favor of exporting gas and let's not forget Europe has been importing a lot of gas from Russia and I think they're kind of getting over that they they don't want to be held hostage by Russia be able to import uh American natural gas is going to become more and more attractive to Europe and and that should definitely Benefit shenir Partners shener Partners also has about a 6% yield versus the regular shenir energy which has a much much lower yield uh and with a master limited partnership your Dividends are tax deferred so uh you have the tax advantage along with the higher yield great now your third pick is not natural gas this is more of an ETF what kind of stocks are included on the ETF that's one of your picks for today it holds physical uranium if nuclear power progresses the way I and a lot of other people expected to there's going to be a huge amount of demand for physical uranium I expect uranium prices to rise strongly over the long term right now uh it actually has been coming down a little bit so you have the opportunity to buy it perhaps on the cheap but I think longterm it's a great investment so I really like the Sprat physical uranium trust ETF and the ticker symbol is Sr uuf uh and uh this is one I think you you hold for a while and three five years from now I think uranium prices are going to be much much higher and so will this ETF some great advice for our investors uh with either of these stock picks and really this whole industry do you expect to see the big returns coming in 2025 or are all of these gains potentially more long term as AI really starts to take hold across the country I'm extremely bullish on natural gas in the short term so definitely for 2025 and and Beyond uh nuclear power I think the fundamentals um are a little bit further out I think it's going to take a little longer for for all the nuclear power plants to start getting operational for some of the the uranium and and nuclear related stocks to start seeing an increase in Revenue that being said I do think nuclear is going to become a much bigger story so I think as we often see in the stock market the stocks will start to appreciate even before the businesses start to improve their fundamentals so I do think nuclear is is going to be a a a really good sector to be in in 2025 I think natural gas you you'll see those fundamentals in the companies uh really start to ramp a little bit sooner though Mark you have a wealth of information and knowledge on this sector and you share even more of that on your special report that just came out tell folks a little bit more about what to expect in this new report and where they can find it we really dive into the the nuclear story because uh again that that's the long-term solution here for the United States and really for the world it's not just the US that's that's boosting its nuclear capabilities Japan Germany a lot of other countries are as well so this is a long-term story uh to me it's almost the lwh hanging fruit here for the market in 2025 you can click that link right here to watch that full report I watched it myself very interesting again Mark you are a wealth of knowledge thank you so much for sharing some of it with us today here at Market beads my pleasure thanks so much for having me yes and thank you for watching everyone again check out the link in the description to check out Mark's full report and check out other videos just like this one here on Market beat as always happy investing [Music]

title: From Landfills to Profits: Opal Fuels CEO Shares How the Company Turns Trash into Cash
text: Kind: captions Language: en today we are excited to have opal fuels co-ceo John Moore with us today thank you so much for joining us today John thank you I'm really pleased to be here and uh excited about sharing our business with you yeah opal fuels is an interesting industry one that's been growing quite a bit and that's really all about renewable fuels right yes what we do is we collect biofuels naturally occurring biofuel uh principally at landfills but it can be done with dairy manure or it be done with Wastewater uh and other uh agricultural products as well we then upgrade that gas which is maybe 50% methane to a full methane product just like your fossil natural gas that uh is transported in the pipeline we'll we'll put that into the pipeline system and then that's our Upstream business on the downstream side we build CNG fueling stations so we take the gas we generate out of the pipeline and we use it to fuel heavyduty trucks that run on CNG instead of on diesel so it's this kind of virtuous circle like many of our uh clients who fuel on cngg or renewable natural gas are garbage trucks and so the garbage trucks go around and collect the trash deposit in the landfills creates the biog gas that we collect we upgrade it to a pure RNG product and then we put it back into vehicles at stations that we build and operate across the country yeah that's a great little circle of life of really truly being renewable and trying to help uh have less of a footprint as a company I love that you mentioned one of your customers and that's garbage trucks and those companies you have some other really bigname clients out there that use your services so on the Upstream side of our business our partners are landfill um owners like Republic Services or gfl environmental some Municipal landfills like um New River Solid Waste Authority or P County down in Florida or Prince William County in Virginia and other places so we have private companies and Municipal counterparties who we work with on producing this gas we put it into pipelines so we work with large pipeline companies as well and then on the downstream side when we fuel one of our largest customers is UPS uh and we also UPS has converted a very large part of their heavyduty Fleet to renewable natural gas and they're saving substantial amounts of money by using this renewable natural gas interestingly it's a lowc carbon product that is less expensive than diesel so uh they're saving money and saving um carbon as well so uh it's really a win-win for them and typical customers would be a fleet of trucks that return to base and when I say heavy duty or Class 8 I'm talking about like semi trucks or large garbage trucks or cement mixers or other heavyduty equipment that it's really not practical to put batteries onto these uh Vehicles batteries are very heavy and so um you would add to the weight of these trucks which might either limit their payload or limit their range depending on the total weight in the US we have weight restrictions on our roads and so uh this is really a technology that's available to decarbonize heavyduty trucking today uh and it's not the other Technologies like battery or hydrogen are really not available today so this is really a great solution for heavyduty uh trucking companies and is a great um use for the biog gas that comes from landfills and other uh waste yeah I want to talk about this this option for companies I know you mentioned uh several large companies like ups are already converting a large portion of their Fleet into RNG renewable gases like like youell um let's talk about how much more room for growth is there where are we at in that adoption stage of kind of switching over fleets to this kind of fuel well there's a substantial growth right now in the renewable natural gas production and there's a little bit of a um let's say a slower growth in the adoption on the fleet side because there's a conversion now from a medium heavyduty engine a 12 L engine produced by cumins who is the only manufacturer in the US for engines for heavy duty trucks to a new 15 L truck uh engine I should say which will be uh competitive with the most heavyduty diesel engines out there so as the fleet starts converting over and adopting the 15 liter I think we'll see the curve Bend back upwards we think that there's probably 40 billion gallons of diesel fuel and other fuels utilized in heavy duty Trucking and uh we generate around a billion gallons or so so we're a little bit less than 2% or or or or 1% one and a half% somewhere in there and uh so we think that that could grow to four five 6 7 8X um but it'll take a lot of adoption for it to grow that way and it'll take growth um on the Upstream side landfills manure waste other agricultural waste Wastewater all going into this renewable natural gas product talk about some factors whether it's in the economy or regulatory issues that might help factor into that adoption um of more of these kinds of fuels this whole Renewable Fuel industry was created in 2005 2006 with the Renewable Fuel standard Congress passed a law uh at that time that mandated the use of these renewable fuels we're familiar with ethanol when we go to fuel our gas tanks on our cars at home uh and ethanol uh made from corn principally is one of those renewable fuels there's other renewable fuels like renewable diesel uh that's made from soy beans and other fats oils and greases uh and and then we have our version of it which is called cellulosic one of the highest value because it really is a nonf food crop uh this waste uh in place whether it's from manure or whether it's from uh the landfills Etc that creates this gas very interesting well let's talk about your company a little bit more when did you get into the Renewable Fuel seed Bridget I've been doing this for 35 years wow and uh I would say we started in the mid90s and um back then it was purely taking the gas from landfills and using them in engines to create electricity we still have as a company 15 projects that create renewable electricity you're were talking a little bit about policy before we think one policy that could really help adoption is for the EPA to um finalize rules on uh using renewable electricity from landfill gas to Power electric vehicles so instead of creating gas that goes into a pipeline to fuel a truck we create electricity from the same landfill gas put it out over a power line and use that in vehicles you know the amount of electricity that electric vehicles use is tracked by all of the OEM manufacturers of these uh cars and so the pathway is set up and ready to go and we think that the EPA could really promote adoption uh through that mechanism interestingly you know landfills create this methane gas which is very harmful to the environment if not collected and burnt larger landfills are required by the EPA to collect that gas and destroy it whether they destroy it just by burning it or making electricity or making renewable natural gas um you know is up to the landfills to do but it's being destroyed at the larger landfills smaller landfills are not necessarily destroying this gas or using it economically because it costs a lot of money to put that infrastructure in place right now electric prices don't really promote creating small electric projects but if the EPA was to um put in place this renewable electric pathway um called erins then that would really um increase the amount of landfills that could be utilized in this manner very interesting you obviously know so much about this industry you've been in it for 35 years let's just go into some details about this stock and where how long you've been a public company and where your stock is right now we went public about two and a half years ago in July of 2022 uh and at that time um you know we were putting projects in place kind of one at a time and we are looking to supercharge our growth today we have a 11 projects in operation another six in construction and a good healthy pipeline of additional opportunities that we're uh developing so we see a lot of growth we've been guiding the market to 2 million mmbt per year of additional capacity we'll have uh right now somewhere around 9 million mmbt of capacity and uh and adding 2 million a year we combined kind of that renewable electricity business the RNG fuel business and the downstream fueling infrastructure business into a single entity and uh launch that as opal fuels we're traded on the NASDAQ and um uh you know we look for opportunities to continue to grow this business and our investor base as well excited about where we are excited about where we're headed um I personally believe we're a very cheap stock given uh the amount of gas that we have and the amount of growth that we have but uh it's for investors to determine for themselves obviously yeah I think analysts right now are especially bullish on oil and gas as an industry as a whole seeing a lot of growth in the future do you see some of that growth and are you expecting that as a company preparing for just more demand in this overall industry because you can get the carbon reduction on the fleet side at a discount to diesel it's a win-win scenario for trucking companies that have significant volumes of fuel and so we do see increased adoption particularly with this new uh engine that cumins is um now starting to um sell the 15 liter engine so we see growth there on the Upstream side I think all the land fill owners Now understand the inherent value of this biog gas that they have the bio gas is a naturally occurring um uh uh gas from waste in place that is going to generate uh energy uh and it's just a matter of how you capture and utilize that energy so uh yeah we see a lot of growth opal fuels has been um probably growing as fast as any company out there some of our competitors that are doing this are uh BP has a number of projects that they're building and waste management uh is a company who developed most of their projects internally themselves gfl our partner is a 5050 owner of the projects that we develop with them uh so they're getting um both the value into their garbage trucks as well is coming out of their landfills um Republic Services as in the past uh just entered into um contracts to give the biofuels or sell the biofuel to developers such as Opel so you have different models across the board of companies that own generation of RNG and dispensing like was management people who are 5050 like gfl or 0 100 uh um on the upper opposite side of the spectrum with Republic Services almost all of the municipal counterparties who do this really uh just enter into a contract to sell the biogas and uh then look for the private developer to be a long-term partner these projects have um very long-term lives to them they involve um no real um uh unpro in technology so the technology that we utilize on the Upstream side is really um pumps compressors and blowers standard technology use across American and World Industries um and then we push the gas through a membrane that physically separates the CO2 from the methane uh product so it's it's a very straightforward um technology on the downstream side again all we're doing is compressing gas into a fuel tank um so again compressors is uh our our main technology so we have about 350 people as a company uh divided into our Upstream renewable natural gas development construction and operations our Downstream uh fueling infrastructure construction and service we have uh over 70 service personnel servicing stations across the country every day and then our um um call it headquarters finance and uh other staff uh kind of rounds out that 350 figure wonderful well thank you so much for the breakdown on your company today John it's something uh I think our investors will be interested in learning about we are providing the link if you want to follow this stock and learn more about the company right here on on this channel as well thanks again for your time today John and thank you everyone for joining us here on Market beat as always happy investing [Music]

title: From Landfills to Profits: Opal Fuels CEO Shares How the Company Turns Trash into Cash
text: Kind: captions Language: en today we are excited to have opal fuels co-ceo John Moore with us today thank you so much for joining us today John thank you I'm really pleased to be here and uh excited about sharing our business with you yeah opal fuels is an interesting industry one that's been growing quite a bit and that's really all about renewable fuels right yes what we do is we collect biofuels naturally occurring biofuel uh principally at landfills but it can be done with dairy manure or it be done with Wastewater uh and other uh agricultural products as well we then upgrade that gas which is maybe 50% methane to a full methane product just like your fossil natural gas that uh is transported in the pipeline we'll we'll put that into the pipeline system and then that's our Upstream business on the downstream side we build CNG fueling stations so we take the gas we generate out of the pipeline and we use it to fuel heavyduty trucks that run on CNG instead of on diesel so it's this kind of virtuous circle like many of our uh clients who fuel on cngg or renewable natural gas are garbage trucks and so the garbage trucks go around and collect the trash deposit in the landfills creates the biog gas that we collect we upgrade it to a pure RNG product and then we put it back into vehicles at stations that we build and operate across the country yeah that's a great little circle of life of really truly being renewable and trying to help uh have less of a footprint as a company I love that you mentioned one of your customers and that's garbage trucks and those companies you have some other really bigname clients out there that use your services so on the Upstream side of our business our partners are landfill um owners like Republic Services or gfl environmental some Municipal landfills like um New River Solid Waste Authority or P County down in Florida or Prince William County in Virginia and other places so we have private companies and Municipal counterparties who we work with on producing this gas we put it into pipelines so we work with large pipeline companies as well and then on the downstream side when we fuel one of our largest customers is UPS uh and we also UPS has converted a very large part of their heavyduty Fleet to renewable natural gas and they're saving substantial amounts of money by using this renewable natural gas interestingly it's a lowc carbon product that is less expensive than diesel so uh they're saving money and saving um carbon as well so uh it's really a win-win for them and typical customers would be a fleet of trucks that return to base and when I say heavy duty or Class 8 I'm talking about like semi trucks or large garbage trucks or cement mixers or other heavyduty equipment that it's really not practical to put batteries onto these uh Vehicles batteries are very heavy and so um you would add to the weight of these trucks which might either limit their payload or limit their range depending on the total weight in the US we have weight restrictions on our roads and so uh this is really a technology that's available to decarbonize heavyduty trucking today uh and it's not the other Technologies like battery or hydrogen are really not available today so this is really a great solution for heavyduty uh trucking companies and is a great um use for the biog gas that comes from landfills and other uh waste yeah I want to talk about this this option for companies I know you mentioned uh several large companies like ups are already converting a large portion of their Fleet into RNG renewable gases like like youell um let's talk about how much more room for growth is there where are we at in that adoption stage of kind of switching over fleets to this kind of fuel well there's a substantial growth right now in the renewable natural gas production and there's a little bit of a um let's say a slower growth in the adoption on the fleet side because there's a conversion now from a medium heavyduty engine a 12 L engine produced by cumins who is the only manufacturer in the US for engines for heavy duty trucks to a new 15 L truck uh engine I should say which will be uh competitive with the most heavyduty diesel engines out there so as the fleet starts converting over and adopting the 15 liter I think we'll see the curve Bend back upwards we think that there's probably 40 billion gallons of diesel fuel and other fuels utilized in heavy duty Trucking and uh we generate around a billion gallons or so so we're a little bit less than 2% or or or or 1% one and a half% somewhere in there and uh so we think that that could grow to four five 6 7 8X um but it'll take a lot of adoption for it to grow that way and it'll take growth um on the Upstream side landfills manure waste other agricultural waste Wastewater all going into this renewable natural gas product talk about some factors whether it's in the economy or regulatory issues that might help factor into that adoption um of more of these kinds of fuels this whole Renewable Fuel industry was created in 2005 2006 with the Renewable Fuel standard Congress passed a law uh at that time that mandated the use of these renewable fuels we're familiar with ethanol when we go to fuel our gas tanks on our cars at home uh and ethanol uh made from corn principally is one of those renewable fuels there's other renewable fuels like renewable diesel uh that's made from soy beans and other fats oils and greases uh and and then we have our version of it which is called cellulosic one of the highest value because it really is a nonf food crop uh this waste uh in place whether it's from manure or whether it's from uh the landfills Etc that creates this gas very interesting well let's talk about your company a little bit more when did you get into the Renewable Fuel seed Bridget I've been doing this for 35 years wow and uh I would say we started in the mid90s and um back then it was purely taking the gas from landfills and using them in engines to create electricity we still have as a company 15 projects that create renewable electricity you're were talking a little bit about policy before we think one policy that could really help adoption is for the EPA to um finalize rules on uh using renewable electricity from landfill gas to Power electric vehicles so instead of creating gas that goes into a pipeline to fuel a truck we create electricity from the same landfill gas put it out over a power line and use that in vehicles you know the amount of electricity that electric vehicles use is tracked by all of the OEM manufacturers of these uh cars and so the pathway is set up and ready to go and we think that the EPA could really promote adoption uh through that mechanism interestingly you know landfills create this methane gas which is very harmful to the environment if not collected and burnt larger landfills are required by the EPA to collect that gas and destroy it whether they destroy it just by burning it or making electricity or making renewable natural gas um you know is up to the landfills to do but it's being destroyed at the larger landfills smaller landfills are not necessarily destroying this gas or using it economically because it costs a lot of money to put that infrastructure in place right now electric prices don't really promote creating small electric projects but if the EPA was to um put in place this renewable electric pathway um called erins then that would really um increase the amount of landfills that could be utilized in this manner very interesting you obviously know so much about this industry you've been in it for 35 years let's just go into some details about this stock and where how long you've been a public company and where your stock is right now we went public about two and a half years ago in July of 2022 uh and at that time um you know we were putting projects in place kind of one at a time and we are looking to supercharge our growth today we have a 11 projects in operation another six in construction and a good healthy pipeline of additional opportunities that we're uh developing so we see a lot of growth we've been guiding the market to 2 million mmbt per year of additional capacity we'll have uh right now somewhere around 9 million mmbt of capacity and uh and adding 2 million a year we combined kind of that renewable electricity business the RNG fuel business and the downstream fueling infrastructure business into a single entity and uh launch that as opal fuels we're traded on the NASDAQ and um uh you know we look for opportunities to continue to grow this business and our investor base as well excited about where we are excited about where we're headed um I personally believe we're a very cheap stock given uh the amount of gas that we have and the amount of growth that we have but uh it's for investors to determine for themselves obviously yeah I think analysts right now are especially bullish on oil and gas as an industry as a whole seeing a lot of growth in the future do you see some of that growth and are you expecting that as a company preparing for just more demand in this overall industry because you can get the carbon reduction on the fleet side at a discount to diesel it's a win-win scenario for trucking companies that have significant volumes of fuel and so we do see increased adoption particularly with this new uh engine that cumins is um now starting to um sell the 15 liter engine so we see growth there on the Upstream side I think all the land fill owners Now understand the inherent value of this biog gas that they have the bio gas is a naturally occurring um uh uh gas from waste in place that is going to generate uh energy uh and it's just a matter of how you capture and utilize that energy so uh yeah we see a lot of growth opal fuels has been um probably growing as fast as any company out there some of our competitors that are doing this are uh BP has a number of projects that they're building and waste management uh is a company who developed most of their projects internally themselves gfl our partner is a 5050 owner of the projects that we develop with them uh so they're getting um both the value into their garbage trucks as well is coming out of their landfills um Republic Services as in the past uh just entered into um contracts to give the biofuels or sell the biofuel to developers such as Opel so you have different models across the board of companies that own generation of RNG and dispensing like was management people who are 5050 like gfl or 0 100 uh um on the upper opposite side of the spectrum with Republic Services almost all of the municipal counterparties who do this really uh just enter into a contract to sell the biogas and uh then look for the private developer to be a long-term partner these projects have um very long-term lives to them they involve um no real um uh unpro in technology so the technology that we utilize on the Upstream side is really um pumps compressors and blowers standard technology use across American and World Industries um and then we push the gas through a membrane that physically separates the CO2 from the methane uh product so it's it's a very straightforward um technology on the downstream side again all we're doing is compressing gas into a fuel tank um so again compressors is uh our our main technology so we have about 350 people as a company uh divided into our Upstream renewable natural gas development construction and operations our Downstream uh fueling infrastructure construction and service we have uh over 70 service personnel servicing stations across the country every day and then our um um call it headquarters finance and uh other staff uh kind of rounds out that 350 figure wonderful well thank you so much for the breakdown on your company today John it's something uh I think our investors will be interested in learning about we are providing the link if you want to follow this stock and learn more about the company right here on on this channel as well thanks again for your time today John and thank you everyone for joining us here on Market beat as always happy investing [Music]

call it headquarters finance and uh other staff uh kind of rounds out that 350 figure wonderful well thank you so much for the breakdown on your company today John it's something uh I think our title: From Landfills to Profits: Opal Fuels CEO Shares How the Company Turns Trash into Cash
text: Kind: captions Language: en today we are excited to have opal fuels co-ceo John Moore with us today thank you so much for joining us today John thank you I'm really pleased to be here and uh excited about sharing our business with you yeah opal fuels is an interesting industry one that's been growing quite a bit and that's really all about renewable fuels right yes what we do is we collect biofuels naturally occurring biofuel uh principally at landfills but it can be done with dairy manure or it be done with Wastewater uh and other uh agricultural products as well we then upgrade that gas which is maybe 50% methane to a full methane product just like your fossil natural gas that uh is transported in the pipeline we'll we'll put that into the pipeline system and then that's our Upstream business on the downstream side we build CNG fueling stations so we take the gas we generate out of the pipeline and we use it to fuel heavyduty trucks that run on CNG instead of on diesel so it's this kind of virtuous circle like many of our uh clients who fuel on cngg or renewable natural gas are garbage trucks and so the garbage trucks go around and collect the trash deposit in the landfills creates the biog gas that we collect we upgrade it to a pure RNG product and then we put it back into vehicles at stations that we build and operate across the country yeah that's a great little circle of life of really truly being renewable and trying to help uh have less of a footprint as a company I love that you mentioned one of your customers and that's garbage trucks and those companies you have some other really bigname clients out there that use your services so on the Upstream side of our business our partners are landfill um owners like Republic Services or gfl environmental some Municipal landfills like um New River Solid Waste Authority or P County down in Florida or Prince William County in Virginia and other places so we have private companies and Municipal counterparties who we work with on producing this gas we put it into pipelines so we work with large pipeline companies as well and then on the downstream side when we fuel one of our largest customers is UPS uh and we also UPS has converted a very large part of their heavyduty Fleet to renewable natural gas and they're saving substantial amounts of money by using this renewable natural gas interestingly it's a lowc carbon product that is less expensive than diesel so uh they're saving money and saving um carbon as well so uh it's really a win-win for them and typical customers would be a fleet of trucks that return to base and when I say heavy duty or Class 8 I'm talking about like semi trucks or large garbage trucks or cement mixers or other heavyduty equipment that it's really not practical to put batteries onto these uh Vehicles batteries are very heavy and so um you would add to the weight of these trucks which might either limit their payload or limit their range depending on the total weight in the US we have weight restrictions on our roads and so uh this is really a technology that's available to decarbonize heavyduty trucking today uh and it's not the other Technologies like battery or hydrogen are really not available today so this is really a great solution for heavyduty uh trucking companies and is a great um use for the biog gas that comes from landfills and other uh waste yeah I want to talk about this this option for companies I know you mentioned uh several large companies like ups are already converting a large portion of their Fleet into RNG renewable gases like like youell um let's talk about how much more room for growth is there where are we at in that adoption stage of kind of switching over fleets to this kind of fuel well there's a substantial growth right now in the renewable natural gas production and there's a little bit of a um let's say a slower growth in the adoption on the fleet side because there's a conversion now from a medium heavyduty engine a 12 L engine produced by cumins who is the only manufacturer in the US for engines for heavy duty trucks to a new 15 L truck uh engine I should say which will be uh competitive with the most heavyduty diesel engines out there so as the fleet starts converting over and adopting the 15 liter I think we'll see the curve Bend back upwards we think that there's probably 40 billion gallons of diesel fuel and other fuels utilized in heavy duty Trucking and uh we generate around a billion gallons or so so we're a little bit less than 2% or or or or 1% one and a half% somewhere in there and uh so we think that that could grow to four five 6 7 8X um but it'll take a lot of adoption for it to grow that way and it'll take growth um on the Upstream side landfills manure waste other agricultural waste Wastewater all going into this renewable natural gas product talk about some factors whether it's in the economy or regulatory issues that might help factor into that adoption um of more of these kinds of fuels this whole Renewable Fuel industry was created in 2005 2006 with the Renewable Fuel standard Congress passed a law uh at that time that mandated the use of these renewable fuels we're familiar with ethanol when we go to fuel our gas tanks on our cars at home uh and ethanol uh made from corn principally is one of those renewable fuels there's other renewable fuels like renewable diesel uh that's made from soy beans and other fats oils and greases uh and and then we have our version of it which is called cellulosic one of the highest value because it really is a nonf food crop uh this waste uh in place whether it's from manure or whether it's from uh the landfills Etc that creates this gas very interesting well let's talk about your company a little bit more when did you get into the Renewable Fuel seed Bridget I've been doing this for 35 years wow and uh I would say we started in the mid90s and um back then it was purely taking the gas from landfills and using them in engines to create electricity we still have as a company 15 projects that create renewable electricity you're were talking a little bit about policy before we think one policy that could really help adoption is for the EPA to um finalize rules on uh using renewable electricity from landfill gas to Power electric vehicles so instead of creating gas that goes into a pipeline to fuel a truck we create electricity from the same landfill gas put it out over a power line and use that in vehicles you know the amount of electricity that electric vehicles use is tracked by all of the OEM manufacturers of these uh cars and so the pathway is set up and ready to go and we think that the EPA could really promote adoption uh through that mechanism interestingly you know landfills create this methane gas which is very harmful to the environment if not collected and burnt larger landfills are required by the EPA to collect that gas and destroy it whether they destroy it just by burning it or making electricity or making renewable natural gas um you know is up to the landfills to do but it's being destroyed at the larger landfills smaller landfills are not necessarily destroying this gas or using it economically because it costs a lot of money to put that infrastructure in place right now electric prices don't really promote creating small electric projects but if the EPA was to um put in place this renewable electric pathway um called erins then that would really um increase the amount of landfills that could be utilized in this manner very interesting you obviously know so much about this industry you've been in it for 35 years let's just go into some details about this stock and where how long you've been a public company and where your stock is right now we went public about two and a half years ago in July of 2022 uh and at that time um you know we were putting projects in place kind of one at a time and we are looking to supercharge our growth today we have a 11 projects in operation another six in construction and a good healthy pipeline of additional opportunities that we're uh developing so we see a lot of growth we've been guiding the market to 2 million mmbt per year of additional capacity we'll have uh right now somewhere around 9 million mmbt of capacity and uh and adding 2 million a year we combined kind of that renewable electricity business the RNG fuel business and the downstream fueling infrastructure business into a single entity and uh launch that as opal fuels we're traded on the NASDAQ and um uh you know we look for opportunities to continue to grow this business and our investor base as well excited about where we are excited about where we're headed um I personally believe we're a very cheap stock given uh the amount of gas that we have and the amount of growth that we have but uh it's for investors to determine for themselves obviously yeah I think analysts right now are especially bullish on oil and gas as an industry as a whole seeing a lot of growth in the future do you see some of that growth and are you expecting that as a company preparing for just more demand in this overall industry because you can get the carbon reduction on the fleet side at a discount to diesel it's a win-win scenario for trucking companies that have significant volumes of fuel and so we do see increased adoption particularly with this new uh engine that cumins is um now starting to um sell the 15 liter engine so we see growth there on the Upstream side I think all the land fill owners Now understand the inherent value of this biog gas that they have the bio gas is a naturally occurring um uh uh gas from waste in place that is going to generate uh energy uh and it's just a matter of how you capture and utilize that energy so uh yeah we see a lot of growth opal fuels has been um probably growing as fast as any company out there some of our competitors that are doing this are uh BP has a number of projects that they're building and waste management uh is a company who developed most of their projects internally themselves gfl our partner is a 5050 owner of the projects that we develop with them uh so they're getting um both the value into their garbage trucks as well is coming out of their landfills um Republic Services as in the past uh just entered into um contracts to give the biofuels or sell the biofuel to developers such as Opel so you have different models across the board of companies that own generation of RNG and dispensing like was management people who are 5050 like gfl or 0 100 uh um on the upper opposite side of the spectrum with Republic Services almost all of the municipal counterparties who do this really uh just enter into a contract to sell the biogas and uh then look for the private developer to be a long-term partner these projects have um very long-term lives to them they involve um no real um uh unpro in technology so the technology that we utilize on the Upstream side is really um pumps compressors and blowers standard technology use across American and World Industries um and then we push the gas through a membrane that physically separates the CO2 from the methane uh product so it's it's a very straightforward um technology on the downstream side again all we're doing is compressing gas into a fuel tank um so again compressors is uh our our main technology so we have about 350 people as a company uh divided into our Upstream renewable natural gas development construction and operations our Downstream uh fueling infrastructure construction and service we have uh over 70 service personnel servicing stations across the country every day and then our um um call it headquarters finance and uh other staff uh kind of rounds out that 350 figure wonderful well thank you so much for the breakdown on your company today John it's something uh I think our investors will be interested in learning about we are providing the link if you want to follow this stock and learn more about the company right here on on this channel as well thanks again for your time today John and thank you everyone for joining us here on Market beat as always happy investing [Music]
