that's our Upstream business on the downstream side we build CNG fueling stations so we take the gas we generate out of the pipeline and we use it to fuel heavyduty trucks that run on CNG instead of on diesel so it's this kind of virtuous circle like many of our uh clients who fuel on cngg or renewable natural gas are garbage trucks and so the garbage trucks go around and collect the trash deposit in the landfills creates the biog gas that we collect we upgrade it to a pure RNG product and then we put it back into vehicles at stations that we build and operate across the country yeah that's a great little circle of life of really truly being renewable and trying to help uh have less of a footprint as a company I love that you mentioned one of your customers and that's garbage trucks and those companies you have some other really bigname clients out there that use your services so on the Upstream side of our business our partners are landfill um owners like Republic Services or gfl environmental some Municipal landfills like um New River Solid Waste Authority or P County down in Florida or Prince William County in Virginia and other places so we have private companies and Municipal counterparties who we work with on producing this gas we put it into pipelines so we work with large pipeline companies as well and then on the downstream side when we fuel one of our largest customers is UPS uh and we also UPS has converted a very large part of their heavyduty Fleet to renewable natural gas and they're saving substantial amounts of money by using this renewable natural gas interestingly it's a lowc carbon product that is less expensive than diesel so uh they're saving money and saving um carbon as well so uh it's really a win-win for them and typical customers would be a fleet of trucks that return to base and when I say heavy duty or Class 8 I'm talking about like semi trucks or large garbage trucks or cement mixers or other heavyduty equipment that it's really not practical to put batteries onto these uh Vehicles batteries are very heavy and so um you would add to the weight of these trucks which might either limit their payload or limit their range depending on the total weight in the US we have weight restrictions on our roads and so uh this is really a technology that's available to decarbonize heavyduty trucking today uh and it's not the other Technologies like battery or hydrogen are really not available today so this is really a great solution for heavyduty uh trucking companies and is a great um use for the biog gas that comes from landfills and other uh waste yeah I want to talk about this this option for companies I know you mentioned uh several large companies like ups are already converting a large portion of their Fleet into RNG renewable gases like like youell um let's talk about how much more room for growth is there where are we at in that adoption stage of kind of switching over fleets to this kind of fuel well there's a substantial growth right now in the renewable natural gas production and there's a little bit of a um let's say a slower growth in the adoption on the fleet side because there's a conversion now from a medium heavyduty engine a 12 L engine produced by cumins who is the only manufacturer in the US for engines for heavy duty trucks to a new 15 L truck uh engine I should say which will be uh competitive with the most heavyduty diesel engines out there so as the fleet starts converting over and adopting the 15 liter I think we'll see the curve Bend back upwards we think that there's probably 40 billion gallons of diesel fuel and other fuels utilized in heavy duty Trucking and uh we generate around a billion gallons or so so we're a little bit less than 2% or or or or 1% one and a half% somewhere in there and uh so we think that that could grow to four five 6 7 8X um but it'll take a lot of adoption for it to grow that way and it'll take growth um on the Upstream side landfills manure waste other agricultural waste Wastewater all going into this renewable natural gas product talk about some factors whether it's in the economy or regulatory issues that might help factor into that adoption um of more of these kinds of fuels this whole Renewable Fuel industry was created in 2005 2006 with the Renewable Fuel standard Congress passed a law uh at that time that mandated the use of these renewable fuels we're familiar with ethanol when we go to fuel our gas tanks on our cars at home uh and ethanol uh made from corn principally is one of those renewable fuels there's other renewable fuels like renewable diesel uh that's made from soy beans and other fats oils and greases uh and and then we have our version of it which is called cellulosic one of the highest value because it really is a nonf food crop uh this waste uh in place whether it's from manure or whether it's from uh the landfills Etc that creates this gas very interesting well let's talk about your company a little bit more when did you get into the Renewable Fuel seed Bridget I've been doing this for 35 years wow and uh I would say we started in the mid90s and um back then it was purely taking the gas from landfills and using them in engines to create electricity we still have as a company 15 projects that create renewable electricity you're were talking a little bit about policy before we think one policy that could really help adoption is for the EPA to um finalize rules on uh using renewable electricity from landfill gas to Power electric vehicles so instead of creating gas that goes into a pipeline to fuel a truck we create electricity from the same landfill gas put it out over a power line and use that in vehicles you know the amount of electricity that electric vehicles use is tracked by all of the OEM manufacturers of these uh cars and so the pathway is set up and ready to go and we think that the EPA could really promote adoption uh through that mechanism interestingly you know landfills create this methane gas which is very harmful to the environment if not collected and burnt larger landfills are required by the EPA to collect that gas and destroy it whether they destroy it just by burning it or making electricity or making renewable natural gas um you know is up to the landfills to do but it's being destroyed at the larger landfills smaller landfills are not necessarily destroying this gas or using it economically because it costs a lot of money to put that infrastructure in place right now electric prices don't really promote creating small electric projects but if the EPA was to um put in place this renewable electric pathway um called erins then that would really um increase the amount of landfills that could be utilized in this manner very interesting you obviously know so much about this industry you've been in it for 35 years let's just go into some details about this stock and where how long you've been a public company and where your stock is right now we went public about two and a half years ago in July of 2022 uh and at that time um you know we were putting projects in place kind of one at a time and we are looking to supercharge our growth today we have a 11 projects in operation another six in construction and a good healthy pipeline of additional opportunities that we're uh developing so we see a lot of growth we've been guiding the market to 2 million mmbt per year of additional capacity we'll have uh right now somewhere around 9 million mmbt of capacity and uh and adding 2 million a year we combined kind of that renewable electricity business the RNG fuel business and the downstream fueling infrastructure business into a single entity and uh launch that as opal fuels we're traded on the NASDAQ and um uh you know we look for opportunities to continue to grow this business and our investor base as well excited about where we are excited about where we're headed um I personally believe we're a very cheap stock given uh the amount of gas that we have and the amount of growth that we have but uh it's for investors to determine for themselves obviously yeah I think analysts right now are especially bullish on oil and gas as an industry as a whole seeing a lot of growth in the future do you see some of that growth and are you expecting that as a company preparing for just more demand in this overall industry because you can get the carbon reduction on the fleet side at a discount to diesel it's a win-win scenario for trucking companies that have significant volumes of fuel and so we do see increased adoption particularly with this new uh engine that cumins is um now starting to um sell the 15 liter engine so we see growth there on the Upstream side I think all the land fill owners Now understand the inherent value of this biog gas that they have the bio gas is a naturally occurring um uh uh gas from waste in place that is going to generate uh energy uh and it's just a matter of how you capture and utilize that energy so uh yeah we see a lot of growth opal fuels has been um probably growing as fast as any company out there some of our competitors that are doing this are uh BP has a number of projects that they're building and waste management uh is a company who developed most of their projects internally themselves gfl our partner is a 5050 owner of the projects that we develop with them uh so they're getting um both the value into their garbage trucks as well is coming out of their landfills um Republic Services as in the past uh just entered into um contracts to give the biofuels or sell the biofuel to developers such as Opel so you have different models across the board of companies that own generation of RNG and dispensing like was management people who are 5050 like gfl or 0 100 uh um on the upper opposite side of the spectrum with Republic Services almost all of the municipal counterparties who do this really uh just enter into a contract to sell the biogas and uh then look for the private developer to be a long-term partner these projects have um very long-term lives to them they involve um no real um uh unpro in technology so the technology that we utilize on the Upstream side is really um pumps compressors and blowers standard technology use across American and World Industries um and then we push the gas through a membrane that physically separates the CO2 from the methane uh product so it's it's a very straightforward um technology on the downstream side again all we're doing is compressing gas into a fuel tank um so again compressors is uh our our main technology so we have about 350 people as a company uh divided into our Upstream renewable natural gas development construction and operations our Downstream uh fueling infrastructure construction and service we have uh over 70 service personnel servicing stations across the country every day and then our um um call it headquarters finance and uh other staff uh kind of rounds out that 350 figure wonderful well thank you so much for the breakdown on your company today John it's something uh I think our investors will be interested in learning about we are providing the link if you want to follow this stock and learn more about the company right here on on this channel as well thanks again for your time today John and thank you everyone for joining us here on Market beat as always happy investing [Music]

of our largest customers is UPS uh and we also UPS has converted a very large part of their heavyduty Fleet to renewable natural gas and they're saving substantial amounts of money by using this renewable natural gas interestingly it's a lowc carbon product that is less expensive than diesel so uh they're saving money and saving um carbon as well so uh it's really a win-win for them and typical customers would be a fleet of trucks that return to base and when I say heavy duty or Class 8 I'm talking about like semi trucks or large garbage trucks or cement mixers or other heavyduty equipment that it's really not practical to put batteries onto these uh Vehicles batteries are very heavy and so um you would add to the weight of these trucks which might either limit their payload or limit their range depending on the total weight in the US we have weight restrictions on our roads and so uh this is really a technology that's available to decarbonize heavyduty trucking today uh and it's not the other Technologies like battery or hydrogen are really not available today so this is really a great solution for heavyduty uh trucking companies and is a great um use for the biog gas that comes from landfills and other uh waste yeah I want to talk about this this option for companies I know you mentioned uh several large companies like ups are already converting a large portion of their Fleet into RNG renewable gases like like youell um let's talk about how much more room for growth is there where are we at in that adoption stage of kind of switching over fleets to this kind of fuel well there's a substantial growth right now in the renewable natural gas production and there's a little bit of a um let's say a slower growth in the adoption on the fleet side because there's a conversion now from a medium heavyduty engine a 12 L engine produced by cumins who is the only manufacturer in the US for engines for heavy duty trucks to a new 15 L truck uh engine I should say which will be uh competitive with the most heavyduty diesel engines out there so as the fleet starts converting over and adopting the 15 liter I think we'll see the curve Bend back upwards we think that there's probably 40 billion gallons of diesel fuel and other fuels utilized in heavy duty Trucking and uh we generate around a billion gallons or so so we're a little bit less than 2% or or or or 1% one and a half% somewhere in there and uh so we think that that could grow to four five 6 7 8X um but it'll take a lot of adoption for it to grow that way and it'll take growth um on the Upstream side landfills manure waste other agricultural waste Wastewater all going into this renewable natural gas product talk about some factors whether it's in the economy or regulatory issues that might help factor into that adoption um of more of these kinds of fuels this whole Renewable Fuel industry was created in 2005 2006 with the Renewable Fuel standard Congress passed a law uh at that time that mandated the use of these renewable fuels we're familiar with ethanol when we go to fuel our gas tanks on our cars at home uh and ethanol uh made from corn principally is one of those renewable fuels there's other renewable fuels like renewable diesel uh that's made from soy beans and other fats oils and greases uh and and then we have our version of it which is called cellulosic one of the highest value because it really is a nonf food crop uh this waste uh in place whether it's from manure or whether it's from uh the landfills Etc that creates this gas very interesting well let's talk about your company a little bit more when did you get into the Renewable Fuel seed Bridget I've been doing this for 35 years wow and uh I would say we started in the mid90s and um back then it was purely taking the gas from landfills and using them in engines to create electricity we still have as a company 15 projects that create renewable electricity you're were talking a little bit about policy before we think one policy that could really help adoption is for the EPA to um finalize rules on uh using renewable electricity from landfill gas to Power electric vehicles so instead of creating gas that goes into a pipeline to fuel a truck we create electricity from the same landfill gas put it out over a power line and use that in vehicles you know the amount of electricity that electric vehicles use is tracked by all of the OEM manufacturers of these uh cars and so the pathway is set up and ready to go and we think that the EPA could really promote adoption uh through that mechanism interestingly you know landfills create this methane gas which is very harmful to the environment if not collected and burnt larger landfills are required by the EPA to collect that gas and destroy it whether they destroy it just by burning it or making electricity or making renewable natural gas um you know is up to the landfills to do but it's being destroyed at the larger landfills smaller landfills are not necessarily destroying this gas or using it economically because it costs a lot of money to put that infrastructure in place right now electric prices don't really promote creating small electric projects but if the EPA was to um put in place this renewable electric pathway um called erins then that would really um increase the amount of landfills that could be utilized in this manner very interesting you obviously know so much about this industry you've been in it for 35 years let's just go into some details about this stock and where how long you've been a public company and where your stock is right now we went public about two and a half years ago in July of 2022 uh and at that time um you know we were putting projects in place kind of one at a time and we are looking to supercharge our growth today we have a 11 projects in operation another six in construction and a good healthy pipeline of additional opportunities that we're uh developing so we see a lot of growth we've been guiding the market to 2 million mmbt per year of additional capacity we'll have uh right now somewhere around 9 million mmbt of capacity and uh and adding 2 million a year we combined kind of that renewable electricity business the RNG fuel business and the downstream fueling infrastructure business into a single entity and uh launch that as opal fuels we're traded on the NASDAQ and um uh you know we look for opportunities to continue to grow this business and our investor base as well excited about where we are excited about where we're headed um I personally believe we're a very cheap stock given uh the amount of gas that we have and the amount of growth that we have but uh it's for investors to determine for themselves obviously yeah I think analysts right now are especially bullish on oil and gas as an industry as a whole seeing a lot of growth in the future do you see some of that growth and are you expecting that as a company preparing for just more demand in this overall industry because you can get the carbon reduction on the fleet side at a discount to diesel it's a win-win scenario for trucking companies that have significant volumes of fuel and so we do see increased adoption particularly with this new uh engine that cumins is um now starting to um sell the 15 liter engine so we see growth there on the Upstream side I think all the land fill owners Now understand the inherent value of this biog gas that they have the bio gas is a naturally occurring um uh uh gas from waste in place that is going to generate uh energy uh and it's just a matter of how you capture and utilize that energy so uh yeah we see a lot of growth opal fuels has been um probably growing as fast as any company out there some of our competitors that are doing this are uh BP has a number of projects that they're building and waste management uh is a company who developed most of their projects internally themselves gfl our partner is a 5050 owner of the projects that we develop with them uh so they're getting um both the value into their garbage trucks as well is coming out of their landfills um Republic Services as in the past uh just entered into um contracts to give the biofuels or sell the biofuel to developers such as Opel so you have different models across the board of companies that own generation of RNG and dispensing like was management people who are 5050 like gfl or 0 100 uh um on the upper opposite side of the spectrum with Republic Services almost all of the municipal counterparties who do this really uh just enter into a contract to sell the biogas and uh then look for the private developer to be a long-term partner these projects have um very long-term lives to them they involve um no real um uh unpro in technology so the technology that we utilize on the Upstream side is really um pumps compressors and blowers standard technology use across American and World Industries um and then we push the gas through a membrane that physically separates the CO2 from the methane uh product so it's it's a very straightforward um technology on the downstream side again all we're doing is compressing gas into a fuel tank um so again compressors is uh our our main technology so we have about 350 people as a company uh divided into our Upstream renewable natural gas development construction and operations our Downstream uh fueling infrastructure construction and service we have uh over 70 service personnel servicing stations across the country every day and then our um um call it headquarters finance and uh other staff uh kind of rounds out that 350 figure wonderful well thank you so much for the breakdown on your company today John it's something uh I think our investors will be interested in learning about we are providing the link if you want to follow this stock and learn more about the company right here on on this channel as well thanks again for your time today John and thank you everyone for joining us here on Market beat as always happy investing [Music]

title: The Real Reason Tesla Stock Is Soaring  and Why Tech Expert Says It Wont Stop
text: Kind: captions Language: en Tesla stock is taking off yet again here to talk about what's behind this recent runup is a special guest this week we have Jeff Brown with Brownstone research with us today so glad that you could be here you have been a big supporter and fan of Tesla for quite a few years now that's right I uh you know I first uh formerly recommended Tesla back in April of 2018 and if you think back to that time it was a very very contentious stock some people were claiming it was a fraud that the accounting was off that they were uh losing money on every car that they sold that it was destined to go bankrupt I mean it was there was so much negativity about Tesla back at that time and the reason was the the framework that they were looking at Tesla the the general thought was this is a car company and so they were trying to measure the performance of Tesla in the same way that they were looking at you know Ford or General Motors it it was just the wrong framework and to you know to me Tesla at that time had some material advantages over the rest of the industry you know they completely designed new manufacturing processes their efficiencies were very different than the traditional automotive industry but the architecture of their cars their vehicles was different you know they they designed a software system around which which they built essentially a robot actually it was a car or you know now it's actually a truck but you know it was a computer architecture and it was one that could be updated just like we update our PCS or laptops today with with regular software updates you didn't have to bring them into the dealer anymore Tesla also had um some real breakthroughs in terms of their lithium ion uh battery chemistries in particular which gave them also another advantage over the rest of the electric vehicle makers so not just the automotive the rest of the automotive industry but EV makers but really the center at the very center of my investment thesis around Tesla was all about artificial intelligence and the point I made back in 2018 which no one was talking about was that Tesla was at that time one of the world's most successful artificial intelligence companies and that AI development was going to be the secret to its future growth and that was April 2018 well it's certainly paying off today they are like you said a major AI leader and their stock price is absolutely going through the roof right now ever since the election Tesla has seen incredible growth yeah uh what's behind some of this recent growth and this Resurgence in their stock price well you you know it's really interesting because up until I would say six weeks ago uh generally speaking the industry Wall Street was really looking at Tesla as still an EV manufacturer and they actually quite negative because on as a whole uh electric vehicle sales were declining so not not Tesla in particular but there was this sentiment in the market that the electric vehicle industry was kind of suffering and slowing down a bit and and they were kind of projecting that would continue over the next few years and then um we really turned a corner I think a lot of people are suggesting that it was because of what the outcome of the elections and because of mus role in uh the Trump Administration that's why the Stock's running but that's not really what's happening what's happening is this series of announcements that Tesla's had regarding its artificial intelligence so specifically it's autonomous driving technology which is an artificial neural netor nwor that they've been developing over a number of years and what's been extraordinary is what's uh happened in the next or in the last I would say three or four months so uh Tesla had been releasing a series of new uh full self-driving they call it full self-driving it's uh autonomous driving technology FSD new versions of its FSD software on his Teslas and I have a Tesla which I uh have just to test every new software release so I can track these things very closely anyway what happened was um there were very uh rapid improvements in the self-driving software over these three or four months and in fact on November 30th it released its latest version which is uh version 13.2 and 13 was the version that um uh had been spoken of as the solution to essentially fully autonomous software so level five which has the capability of what we would refer to as unsupervised self-driving so what does unsupervised mean it means literally you can get into the car sit back take a nap and basically be transported to your destination without having to do a thing and so you know what's happened since version 13 came out is it is is phenomenal its performance is really unbelievable I mean it was fabulous 3 months ago but where version 13 is is truly remarkable it's it's incredibly human in terms of the way that it drives you know it's just aggressive enough it's can get through very complex situations very naturally it's extremely smooth and anyone any analyst who has actually experienced it can know when they experience what that looks like that something very special is happening and so the the kind of importance the importance of this particular event is that um you know Tesla is planning on getting approval for unsupervised self-driving technology in at least two states next year and the Front Runners are Texas and California and once that happens he's planning on announcing his Robo tax Network and so any Tesla unit any Tesla owner or even someone that's leads to Tesla can opt in their car into Tesla's future Robo taxi Network so when you're not using your car you hit your smartphone you tell your Tesla to go out and work for you and it generates income every day if your Tesla is generating enough income for you on a monthly basis to pay for your monthly car loan or monthly lease do you think more Teslas will be sold it it's pretty simple it pays for itself and so that's what's happening with this stock right now they've recognized more broadly what the implications of this technology are for Tesla as a company not only will this increase sales of its own EVS by the way not other companies EVS but Tesla EVS right because they have both the hardware and software to enable this level five unsupervised driving but it's also the foundation for what it recently announced I'm sure you saw the Cyber cab announcement right pretty futuristic absolutely looking car self-driving car no brake no accelerator no steering wheel just a screen two seats that's it phenomenal right but now that you see how version 13 is working you can see that those cars will in fact work people are starting to really see what the long-term strategy is for Tesla and now that they can see that technology is very real the rest the future revenues that are forecasted from things like the Cyber cab you can also believe are coming as well and that's why the stock is running so high yeah this seems like just the beginning of the move for Tesla with all of this future growth on the horizon I think this is such an interesting point about AI in general where the first versions of AI were not good on on any part whether it was image Generation video generation the first versions everyone almost laughed at is this is never going to be good and now we're seeing it's phenomenal and I think that's the same thing with this Tesla's version of AI and using it to make these self-driving Vehicles you have really found some other companies that are really going to start taking off thanks to the self-driving technology correct yes so you know one of the things that I specialize in my own research and Analysis is identifying these large technological Trends and then of course uh the companies that will benefit from it um you know the Tailwind here in this case is the ability to enable fully autonomous driving so you know where I spend my time researching is first understanding the technology like I said that's why I have a Tesla uh and what was really interesting in um with with that technology is it it it wasn't a state of the technology at any given point in time it was the rate of improvement and that's what I think most people missed over the last few years you know yes it wasn't perfect to the point that you made but how rapidly was it improving so if you're watching that you could see that the rate of improvements was accelerating which is why I knew this was happening this year and so understanding the impact that um Tesla is going to have on the industry and then understanding those other companies that contribute to this trend that might even enable Tesla for example companies that provide specialized components into Tesla vehicles and potentially future Tesla products like the Cyber cab or like Optimus their humanoid robot which has uh generated so much excitement as well you clearly speak from a place of knowledge on so much of this what's your background a little bit and give us a background on your company as well uh well um I I uh am a technologist uh at heart uh my uh undergraduate degree was in aeronautical and astronautical Engineering from Pur University so I have a very technical engineering background I worked in industry for about um 25 years as a corporate high-tech executive uh for a variety of companies that were in Wireless and Wireline Communications internet technology routers switches I work for a couple major uh semiconductor companies like Qualcomm and nxp semiconductors uh have a lot of experience in software and cyber security as well and so a wide range of experience through many different uh technology verticals um as a business executive as a technologist and um uh really managing running uh large uh operating businesses for technology companies and I you know did that up until about uh 2014 and then made a change in my career um to become uh an investment analyst a technology analyst uh to focus on high-tech and biotechnology uh which is what I've been doing for about uh the last 10 years so all that time in the field uh customer facing understanding how products are bought and sold uh you know what makes a product compelling in terms of uh market adoption uh is a really important part of my analysis and I bring all that to Brownstone research which is one of the uh largest and most successful uh investment research U companies in the world over the last 10 years and uh all I can say is um I can't imagine a more exciting time to be doing this kind of work uh with what's coming around the corner over the next few years it's really a remarkable period in history it really is and it's paying off in huge ways in the stock market as well we continue to see company after company anything to do with AI seeing some major payoffs and I think understanding that technology is why you have such a advantage in understanding how to invest in that as well um your latest video is a wealth of information again talking a lot about Tesla and also talking about the companies that can benefit alongside Tesla and so we have that link here if you want to check out Jeff's latest video uh while watch the full thing because it's very very very interesting and informative you again so much knowledge thank you for sharing that with us and with our viewers here on Market beads thank you so much for joining us today everyone again check out the description for that link to Jeff's latest video thanks again for watching everyone and as always happy investing [Music] m

title: The Real Reason Tesla Stock Is Soaring  and Why Tech Expert Says It Wont Stop

us today so glad that you could be here you have been a big supporter and fan of Tesla for quite a few years now that's right I uh you know I first uh formerly recommended Tesla back in April of 2018 and if you think back to that time it was a very very contentious stock some people were claiming it was a fraud that the accounting was off that they were uh losing money on every car that they sold that it was destined to go bankrupt I mean it was there was so much negativity about Tesla back at that time and the reason was the the framework that they were looking at Tesla the the general thought was this is a car company and so they were trying to measure the performance of Tesla in the same way that they were looking at you know Ford or General Motors it it was just the wrong framework and to you know to me Tesla at that time had some material advantages over the rest of the industry you know they completely designed new manufacturing processes their efficiencies were very different than the traditional automotive industry but the architecture of their cars their vehicles was different you know they they designed a software system around which which they built essentially a robot actually it was a car or you know now it's actually a truck but you know it was a computer architecture and it was one that could be updated just like we update our PCS or laptops today with with regular software updates you didn't have to bring them into the dealer anymore Tesla also had um some real breakthroughs in terms of their lithium ion uh battery chemistries in particular which gave them also another advantage over the rest of the electric vehicle makers so not just the automotive the rest of the automotive industry but EV makers but really the center at the very center of my investment thesis around Tesla was all about artificial intelligence and the point I made back in 2018 which no one was talking about was that Tesla was at that time one of the world's most successful artificial intelligence companies and that AI development was going to be the secret to its future growth and that was April 2018 well it's certainly paying off today they are like you said a major AI leader and their stock price is absolutely going through the roof right now ever since the election Tesla has seen incredible growth yeah uh what's behind some of this recent growth and this Resurgence in their stock price well you you know it's really interesting because up until I would say six weeks ago uh generally speaking the industry Wall Street was really looking at Tesla as still an EV manufacturer and they actually quite negative because on as a whole uh electric vehicle sales were declining so not not Tesla in particular but there was this sentiment in the market that the electric vehicle industry was kind of suffering and slowing down a bit and and they were kind of projecting that would continue over the next few years and then um we really turned a corner I think a lot of people are suggesting that it was because of what the outcome of the elections and because of mus role in uh the Trump Administration that's why the Stock's running but that's not really what's happening what's happening is this series of announcements that Tesla's had regarding its artificial intelligence so specifically it's autonomous driving technology which is an artificial neural netor nwor that they've been developing over a number of years and what's been extraordinary is what's uh happened in the next or in the last I would say three or four months so uh Tesla had been releasing a series of new uh full self-driving they call it full self-driving it's uh autonomous driving technology FSD new versions of its FSD software on his Teslas and I have a Tesla which I uh have just to test every new software release so I can track these things very closely anyway what happened was um there were very uh rapid improvements in the self-driving software over these three or four months and in fact on November 30th it released its latest version which is uh version 13.2 and 13 was the version that um uh had been spoken of as the solution to essentially fully autonomous software so level five which has the capability of what we would refer to as unsupervised self-driving so what does unsupervised mean it means literally you can get into the car sit back take a nap and basically be transported to your destination without having to do a thing and so you know what's happened since version 13 came out is it is is phenomenal its performance is really unbelievable I mean it was fabulous 3 months ago but where version 13 is is truly remarkable it's it's incredibly human in terms of the way that it drives you know it's just aggressive enough it's can get through very complex situations very naturally it's extremely smooth and anyone any analyst who has actually experienced it can know when they experience what that looks like that something very special is happening and so the the kind of importance the importance of this particular event is that um you know Tesla is planning on getting approval for unsupervised self-driving technology in at least two states next year and the Front Runners are Texas and California and once that happens he's planning on announcing his Robo tax Network and so any Tesla unit any Tesla owner or even someone that's leads to Tesla can opt in their car into Tesla's future Robo taxi Network so when you're not using your car you hit your smartphone you tell your Tesla to go out and work for you and it generates income every day if your Tesla is generating enough income for you on a monthly basis to pay for your monthly car loan or monthly lease do you think more Teslas will be sold it it's pretty simple it pays for itself and so that's what's happening with this stock right now they've recognized more broadly what the implications of this technology are for Tesla as a company not only will this increase sales of its own EVS by the way not other companies EVS but Tesla EVS right because they have both the hardware and software to enable this level five unsupervised driving but it's also the foundation for what it recently announced I'm sure you saw the Cyber cab announcement right pretty futuristic absolutely looking car self-driving car no brake no accelerator no steering wheel just a screen two seats that's it phenomenal right but now that you see how version 13 is working you can see that those cars will in fact work people are starting to really see what the long-term strategy is for Tesla and now that they can see that technology is very real the rest the future revenues that are forecasted from things like the Cyber cab you can also believe are coming as well and that's why the stock is running so high yeah this seems like just the beginning of the move for Tesla with all of this future growth on the horizon I think this is such an interesting point about AI in general where the first versions of AI were not good on on any part whether it was image Generation video generation the first versions everyone almost laughed at is this is never going to be good and spend my time researching is first understanding the technology like I said that's why I have a Tesla uh and what was really interesting in um with with that technology is it it it wasn't a state of title: Best ETFs for 2025: Growth, Stability, and AI-Driven Investing
text: Kind: captions Language: en looking to invest in ETFs in 2025 here's three picks that are set to take off this year here to break it all down for us is Market beat analyst Chris marut Chris there are so many ETFs out there it feels like there's new ones coming onto the market every day how do you narrow down which ETFs to to invest in for many investors it might come down to whoever their fund manager is of choice whether that's Vanguard or Fidelity or whatever but even once you get into a specific company your choice of ETF is largely going to depend on what your investment goal is so for many investors you could invest in an ETF like the Spy ETF that tracks the S&P 500 and call it a day and say okay well you know what it's going to the performance of that going to closely approximate the S&P 500 and this year you would have come out with a gain of around you know 28% and you're doing really well and that's great some investors however like to use ETFs to supplement individual stocks and so maybe they say Well I'm I'm really happy with the performance of my portfolio overall but I'm hearing about a theme like AI I really think I want to get exposure to that but I really don't want to pick individual stocks an ETF is a great way of getting involved in that and as you said there's more and more coming up almost every day it seems like there's almost as many ETFs right now as there are individual stocks that you can choose from well you have been looking through some different ETFs out there and have three picks for us today that you think are going to be really successful F in the new year let's start out with your first pick okay so my first one um it's it's probably the the the one that's got the funnest name to say it's called the the Pacer us cash cows 100 ETF and the ticker symbol is cows CZ um so the thing about this ETF Bridget is the fund selects it's holding based on a company's free cash flow yield and so free cash flow is how much money a company has left after paying out all of their expenses including dividends and share BuyBacks and the companies in the cow's ETF have more than double the market average FCF yield another reason why investors may want to get involved with this aside from just choosing companies that have a great cash position is that this fund specifically targets a lot of midcap stocks and if you look at a lot of investing portfolios they may cover large caps very well recently a lot of investors have been very interested in small caps but the midcap area that's I'm talking between 2 billion and 10 billion in market cap those aren't covered very well by most portfolios this ETF does that so you're getting companies that have a strong cap position but are also in that midcap sector that are expected to do well in 2025 yeah I think this is an interesting uh ETF out there because it's not like a specific industry this could be a company in any industry that just has this specific area of their books that's doing really really well what is the potential Advantage for growth when you pick just companies that have such a good cash flow I would say you're probably going to be looking at performance that might be a little bit less than the market average because again these the companies in the cow's ETF are not necessarily all Heavy growth oriented companies but what you're lacking in that growth you're getting back in companies that are rock solid they're probably paying dividends and you're going to be getting probably a a very solid total return over time all right so your first pick is the safe bet uh what is your second ETF pick like okay so the second one um is the global X us infrastructure development ETF the ticker symbol is pave p a the focus of this ETF is as the name implies it's looking at us manufacturing companies that are involved in building up the infrastructure of the country uh you'll recall that back in 2021 the US infrastructure Act was signed into law that was followed up by the chips act in 2022 and so all of that money is starting to flow into the economy there's been some concern that infrastructure spending is going to slow as the incoming Administration looks to maybe curb government spending a little bit but some of the spending in most of the spending in the infrastructure bill is already committed contractually into 2026 so 2025 looks like a year when it's still going to be very good for infrastructure spending and I think that's really what makes the bull case for the pavf in 2025 yeah this feels like it HS um a number of different Industries and companies that could be impacted by helping to build up infrastructure right you're looking at um not just manufacturing companies but you're looking at utility companies you're looking at even probably some technology companies building out data centers in addition to things like roads and bridges and things like that so what kind of growth can investors expect from this ETF the fund is up over 26% in 2024 and that's in line with the return from the S&P 500 um again considering that the money for a lot of these projects is contractually obligated through 2025 I think that investors should expect performance that's pretty much in line with the S&P 500 for next year and it's expected to be a good year for the S&P 500 yeah I think everyone's excited about this good year ahead there's a lot of ETFs you can pick with just a a good year anticipating ahead that are going to see some success but I'm excited to see your third pick and see if we have a little bit more of a growth ETF in our picks absolutely so my last pick um is the ishar semiconductor ETF and the ticker symbol is socks uh that's sxx we're still in the early stages of AI and I know that there's some investors that are kind of getting to the point of well maybe maybe AI is a bubble and all this but I I really don't believe that I think we're still in the very early stages of it in fact we're probably getting ready to Pivot from what we would call AI 1.0 to maybe a 2.0 which is going to be focusing more on software and things no matter where we are though it we're going to need semiconductors 2024 has been a uneven year let's just say for Semiconductor stocks some have done well some haven't done as well but I think you could say all of them even companies like Nvidia and Advanced Micro Devices the performance has been choppy it's been up and down that's expected to change in 201 25 we're supposed to be seeing more significant growth and more consistent growth the socks ETF is a good way to play that you don't have to worry about picking any one individual stock it's a basket of stocks and it's all focused on the chip sector yeah the chip sector especially with the news that we might bring some of that chip manufacturing to the US yes constant demand and growth in this industry um does that make this a really high growth ETF and how much growth are they expecting in 2025 it's actually underperformed the the S&P 500 this year the growth in this fund's only been 11% but that's consistent with what I was saying it's it's been kind of an uneven year for chip stocks I would expect next year with chip stocks taking off I would expect this fund to outperform the S&P 500 especially since stocks in this sector are supposed to be growing their earnings per share by 32% next year earnings growth is the biggest predictor of stock price growth so I think right now you want to front run this growth and that's why you want to get on the socks ETF now yeah what's another potential benefit of choosing the ETF over individual semiconductor stocks out there is the price point of entry a little bit less using the ETF you know is it easier to get into some different pieces of these companies through the ETF style for a lot of investors the best benefit of an ETF is it Smooths out your risk tolerance so instead of worrying about what Nvidia might be doing doing or AMD might be doing or Qualcomm might be doing or Micron might be doing for any one individual quarter you're spreading your risk out and over time you're going to find that everything balances out and you should be getting a return that's close to what the industry averages now again last year that was a little bit down compared to the S&P 500 but I believe next year you're going to see that outpace the S&P 500 awesome well thank you so much for three great ETF picks for 2025 always appreciate having you on the channel Chris and thank you for watching everyone you can find many more videos just like this one that share some great stock picks ahead for 2025 we hope you've had a great 2024 and happy investing in the new year [Music]

chip stocks I would expect next year with chip stocks taking off I would expect this fund to outperform the S&P 500 especially since stocks in this sector are supposed to be growing their earnings per share by 32% next year earnings growth is the biggest predictor of stock price growth so I think right now you want to front run this growth and that's why you want to get on the socks ETF now yeah what's another potential benefit of choosing the ETF over individual semiconductor stocks out there is the price point of entry a little bit less using the ETF you know is it easier to get into some different pieces of these companies through the ETF style for a lot of investors the best benefit of an ETF is it Smooths out your risk tolerance so instead of worrying about what Nvidia might be doing doing or AMD might be doing or Qualcomm might be doing or Micron might be doing for any one individual quarter you're spreading your risk out and over time you're going to find that everything balances out and you should be getting a return that's close to what the industry averages now again last year that was a little bit down compared to the S&P 500 but I believe next year you're going to see that outpace the S&P 500 awesome well thank you so much for three great ETF picks for 2025 always appreciate having you on the channel Chris and thank you for watching everyone you can find many more videos just like this one that share some great stock picks ahead for 2025 we hope you've had a great 2024 and happy investing in the new year [Music]

title: Broadcoms Stock Surge: AI Growth and Custom Chips Drive 30% Gains
text: Kind: captions Language: en broadcom up 30% since last week's earnings report here to break it all down for us is Market beat analyst Thomas Hughes Thomas this is a really exciting time for broadcom fans yeah it is um the earnings report was pretty good it was mixed relative to the analyst sentiment or the analyst expectations but they set the bar very high and despite having mixed results Revenue grew 50% that's pretty big that's pretty good and earnings grew by 30% earnings growth lagged a little bit but there are some one-off factors that were impacting this this quarter's earnings um but really what it is is the forward Outlook the forward outlook for Revenue growth is pretty robust and margins are expected to rewi yeah I think that is what we're seeing in this stock surge right now is people just excited investors excited about the future of this company right so the results kind of gave us some more confidence in the existing growth Outlook and then the company compounded that by giving a growth Outlook or um a forecast for an addressable maret market growth for custom chips so that's just one small part of their business but the forecast for custom chips is that the addressable Market might reach 75 billion within the next three years now if that's true and they capture that market they're going to more than double their business in the next three years which is a pretty good driver for stock prices yeah absolutely we like to hear doubling I think every investor likes that Thomas it's been a couple of months since we've even covered broadcom on this channel uh why has this stock been kind kind of quiet for the past few months it's in position to capture some AI business but it was kind of slow to get traction um unlike Nvidia which has been the real story for the last couple years but right now what we're seeing is the the AI spending AI traction is starting to move outside from Nvidia where you need nvidia's chips in your data centers but you need broadcom's chips and broadcom's software to run the data centers and to help scale your AI so the two things kind of go hand inand now that companies have secured their supply or their future supplies of Nvidia chips now they're securing their supplies of broadcom products to make those chips work and we talk a lot about competition in this AI field where everyone is growing so so fast is broadcom becoming a real competitor um as much as Nvidia right so part of the broadcom story is their purchase of VMware last year uh VMware is a software company they specialize in the cloud they're important for cloud infrastructure and for scaling Ai and for implementing Ai and so that's where a lot of the growth is coming from and that's where a lot of the forward Outlook is coming from and you've said a lot of different factors about AI where just investing in AI can be a little confusing but Market be has a free Special Report out there right now it's called seven AI stocks to invest in and really how to invest in the whole AI industry check out our free Special Report by scanning the QR code or look in the comment for the link to that free report right now uh Thomas you talk about AI stocks and AI investing all the time we talk about it quite a bit on this channel and broadcom is no exception this is a company that we are going to continue to see a lot of growth but I want to know just how much growth are analysts expecting for broadcom well we're looking at a sustained High double digigit growth rate for the next couple years I think the forecast for next year is for another 50% growth and one of the things that's really got the market excited with this long-term outlook for custom chip growth is that right now broadcom only sells to like two or three of the five or six major hyperscalers so that's about half the hyperscale half the data center market and they could acquire the others over the next couple years and if they did that that would significantly increase what is already a very robust Market Outlook yeah absolutely and you just wrote an article talking about could The Magnificent Seven really become a magnificent eight do you think broadcom has the capacity to potentially get to that major level yeah I think it did that on Monday I think it gained another five or six% just that day and has now reached the trillion dollar Mark I think that uh the acquisition of VMware and the lean into the software side of AI along with the semiconductors kind of establishes it along the lines of Nvidia which is also a full stack AI company I think that broadcom has established itself as Central to AI important to AI infrastructure and a major player that will be significant for the next 5 10 15 years yeah well broadcom might already already be trading at a new premium just how high are analysts expecting this stock to go well the analyst response has been pretty robust since the report came out we've tracked at least a dozen revisions on Market beats website uh the consensus price Target right now is lagging the market but the revisions lifted the consensus by 15% overnight and the high-end range is pointed to 250 255 which is another 10 to 15% upside and I think that the way that momentum is building with the business and the expectation for future results we should expect the revision Trend to remain positive through next year and continue lifting the stock uh because one of the things that I've taken from the analyst chatter is that they're expecting more of the good news to come out in the second half of next year which just sets us up for a really long and sustained analyst upgrade cycle that could last well into 2026 and when we're talking about so much excitement over future outlook and future growth for this company does that mean a lot of the moves behind the stock price surge right now are really those long-term investors jumping in or is there still some short-term gains coming in on this stock right now I would say it's some of both it's there's definitely an uptrend in play that short-term Traders were able to capture they're probably going to start taking profits pretty soon um the long-term investors are also in this stock I would assume that the long-term investors would wait for the stock price to pull back a little bit from these new highs before they start putting in more money do you think that pullback is really just inevitable when we see a surge this big well well yeah it's part of Market mechanics um when it happens where it happens how deep it gets is the question in in that regard but a pullback will happen it's just a matter of uh when it happens what causes it and if you're ready for it when it happens all right thanks so much for the analysis today Thomas and thank you for watching Market beat you can find out more about broadcom on our Channel here's a look at a previous video we've done let us know what you think in the comments we'd love to hear what your play is on this stock or maybe what plays you've made on this stock in the past too thanks again for watching Market beat and as always happy investing [Music]

title: SoundHound Stock Explodes Again  Is a Major Breakout Coming?
text: Kind: captions Language: en Soundhound surging yet again, but could this stock be at a turning point? Here to break it down for us is Marketbeat analyst Thomas Hughes. Thomas, we were talking about this stock just one week ago, but then it started surging yet again on Friday. It did. This market is is really um almost out of control. It's really surging to to new high levels. And I see it right now on Monday. It's opened up. It gapped open to trade just below the previous all-time high. And I see the market at a pretty important turning point. And when you say turning point, where do you think this stock could go? Well, that's kind of the question right now. Um, if we can get above the previous all-time high and set a new all-time high, I see the stock moving up to $36, doubling from 18. That's very possible. However, there's a chance that it could be Cath at $18 and remain rangebound for the next few weeks, months, or quarters. Let's talk about some of those factors that could keep this stock rangebound. I know one of them is all that short interest the stock has seen over the past few months, right? Uh we just got the short report for the end of November and short interest at the end of November was 25%. So that's more than doubled the previous month. Short interest ramped higher over the course of the last few months to a new high. So part of the uh the stock surge is short covering and the question right now is if the shorts are going to stay out of the market or if they're going to reposition now that the stock is back at those all-time highs. Yeah, that is very high short interest for this stock right now. And if you are new to figuring out how to trade these kinds of high short interest stocks, check out this free report from Marketbeat. You can scan the QR code or click the link in the description to read our report, how to play high short interest stocks. Do you think there's real value behind the big growth in this stock price right now? Or is it really a lot of that short interest? I think a lot of it is a short interest. That's why the stock price got up so high so quickly. You can see in the analyst sentiment they've been upgrading the stock and lifting their price targets, but their prices had this stock pegged around eight or nine $10. Now, very recently, we've gotten an upgrade, an update from Wed Bush. That's Dan Ies. He's big in tech. We like to follow him. He more than doubled his price target to $22. That puts us at a new all-time high. So, it looks like the analysts are leading us to to new highs. Uh the question is if the market will cooperate. Yeah, I think that really is the question, Thomas. the stock up 80% in the past month, up almost 200% just in the last quarter. That attracts a lot of traders looking to to make a profit off of such a big surge that it's hard to know if the surge is really going to be sustainable. Do you think there's enough long-term fans of this stock to keep this stock rising? I think that the long-term fans are growing. You can also see that in the stock price action. If you look on the chart, especially the weekly bars, you can see that over the course of the last year, 18 months, we've had two major stock price upswings. Both of them marked by wickedly high volume. That high volume is in part short covering, but it's also new interest, new investors getting into the market. Uh, and one of the things you kind of alluded to this that might also cap the gains. People have made a lot of money the last few weeks in the last few months. And so, it's possible that profit taking will also cap gains. And again, the question is, what is the long-term outlook and if it can continue to lift the stock price? And I think that answer is yes. Yeah, we heard that from some of our viewers this last week when you and I were talking about Soundtown again just one week ago when the stock had surged and now it's doing it again. But we had a few people, a few viewers thinking this stock would easily hit 36 in the next year. Do you think that's a reasonable price target? I think it is because right now the stock is in a hyperrowth phase. It's a revenues about a hundred million a year I think. Um hyper growth growth phase where it's supposed to grow by 100% next year. Um it is one of the leading implementers of AI services. It's been gaining traction. Its voice recognition and automation services are really helping businesses. So I think that it's really going to start uh to build on its on its traction and to gain momentum with the business over the next year. All right. So is there any chance in a week we're going to be talking about another surge with this stock? Oh, I think it's totally possible. Yeah, I think plenty of our viewers would love to see that happen. Thanks, Thomas, again for breaking down this stock for us this week. We'd love to hear what you think. Are you in Sound for the long term, and how high do you think it could go? Or are you more of those short-term investors looking to make some profit off of Sound's big surge right now? Let us know your thoughts in the comments. And if you're wondering more about this company, we've talked about it plenty on this channel. Check out some of our previous videos on Sound Hound and why this company is growing so much right now and some of the reasons behind this current stock surge. Thanks again for watching Marketbeat and as always, happy investing. [Music]

title: How Fintech Strategy at FinWise Bancorp and CEO Vision Are Driving 78% Gains
text: Kind: captions Language: en a financial technology company up 78% in the last 6 months let's dive into this week's CEO [Music] series today we are excited to have Kent landvatter the CEO of finwise borp with us today thank you so much for coming on our channel it's great to be here Bridget um I'm excited to do this podcast and I've been watching your stuff for a while and it's it's really fun to be here today oh wonderful F Love That Let's talk about what is finwise and how long have you guys been around well the company actually started in 2000 I came in 2010 and I have always been interested in the Nexus between technology and Banking and I thought there would be a real interesting play for this company to move in more of a fintech side of the business and that's what we did standing it up fully in 2016 and been doing it for eight years now yeah that's great and you went public just a couple of years ago is that right three years ago uh last month actually your stock has seen quite a lot of success in the last year we're going to get to that in just a little bit but first let's talk more about uh what your company does so who are some of the customers that you serve one of our primary focuses as I mentioned is fintech business where we provide fintechs with banking solutions they could be lending payments deposits what have you and uh we also have traditional lines of business SBA we have a National SBA 7A program we have National Commercial leasing point of sell but our main focus right now is on the fintech side there seems to be a lot of uh growing competitors in this space too uh talk about that a little bit like what's the market like for fintech financing that's a really good question there have been a few banks in the space that have fallen out lately because of regulatory oversight uh concerns that they may have seen uh it's quite difficult to stand up a bank in this environment uh to appropriately manage the fintech uh in a way that's safe for the customers and compliant with all the regulations and so forth so we started in 2016 building out a real strong system and a scalable apid driven infrastructure that collects all the data that we need to properly oversee these partners and we have a significant staff in fact about 40% of our staff is devoted Focus completely focused on the management of these relation ship when I think of the competitor space out there I really think of those banks that are really doing a significant focus and dedicating the appropriate resources the exciting thing for us is there isn't a lot of competition right now because this is a difficult uh product to stand up so competition for us um we actually almost look more at some of the other banks in the space as collegial uh participants in the space because we're trying to all do it right and make certain um we're providing the right services in the right way yeah let's talk about that a little bit more what about finwise uh makes you really proud to be the CEO of this company what kind of sets your business practices apart from others in this field from a strategic positioning I think it was our early focus on let's make certain if we're getting into space to invest appropriately and make certain that the tools are in um in place and working to oversee these fintech Partnerships in a way that makes the banking Regulators happy and serves the customer well for us that's been a strategic thing that's uh contributed to this success that I'm very proud of but I think what I'm most proud of is the team that we've been able to assemble we've got I would say hundreds of years of experience in this space from people all over the country who are part of the finwise team and it's their success really that has stood up these strategies and visions of the company and uh done so in a very very profitable way for us yeah absolutely and it's been profitable for your investors too especially this past year your stock price went from trading around $8 earlier in the year to now up around $18 uh really good payoffs again a good investment for investors out there what's behind the success in your stock price there are a few things and I I can't pretend to guess them all but I think what it is is we've been telling the same story for uh since we've been public and uh we continue to execute on that story so we do what we say uh we're going to do and I think um because of some of the uncertainty around the regulatory oversights of the the some of the banks that have not um been able to navigate the waters uh as well you know there there's been some uncertainty but as you know we've been in the space for eight years now and uh we we kind of know we're doing and we're very very focused and on on Regulatory Compliance I think that message is getting out to stockholders another thing too that we're very excited about so over the last couple years we have been building out infrastructure to uh further expand our fintech offerings you know offering basically a payment we've developed a payments Hub which uh we call Money rails but it basically will move money on all the different platforms AC fed now RTP and so forth it will move money for our fintech partners and it's apid driven so that they can customize things on their side to optimize it so we think that's going to be uh an exciting ad for 2025 we've also added card sponsorships where we do debit cards credit cards and so forth for our fintech partners and finally we're expanding our balance sheet by adding what we call Credit enhanced balance sheet but it's basically a way for us to provide some of our balance sheet or more of our balance sheet to some of our fintech partners that want to put loans or deposits here in a safe way let's talk about the books just a little bit more still considered I guess a small cap company but doing well in Revenue let's talk about some of those Logistics that our investors care about so much since we've gone public the tangible Book value has grown significantly every year and um when compared to our bank peers and when compared to fintech Brands we've uh done really well and so our tangible Book value continues to grow even over the last year or two where we've been focused on building out these additional products and and the people to support those products we've been uh very profitable we have very respectable return on assets compared to other Banks and and uh net interest margins so those key factors I think are really building some excitement around the the stock yeah and I think uh economically as well it feels like right now is a time when people are really into the financial sector I think we saw right after the election um that whole industry the financial industry kind of see a little bit of a boost in the market as well does that make you excited about the future in any way oh yes well even with uh before the change in the administration I I felt very excited about the future because there are really two sides of banking there's a traditional that you everybody knows about and have TR have done a great job of serving communities and so forth but there's been this Evolution I believe over the last 10 15 years where people have moved more and more to online banking to be part of that wave is very exciting and so I think as people investors look more and more at Banks you know they can almost put them in two categories or traditional banks that they are used to seeing but then these new fintech or technology enabled banks that are delivering products to Consumers and businesses um in a much more convenient way a much more useful way and actually providing greater access to banking services I think we've had a really good conversation about your company but I do want to end today by just talking about what are you most excited about in the next year ahead and the future of your company even beyond the next year uh do you see the growth trajectory still continuing for finwise I am so excited about it you know these new products that we're adding are going to um add different profit drivers that diversify the C revenue streams we have and uh build our balance sheet out so we can grow more effectively on the balance sheet but once again just writing the wave of this Innovative uh space to me right now is is very exciting and when you consider going back to our your earlier question about the competitive landscape it's hard to get in this barrier there's a big moat around our business and other Banks like ours and so there's a huge addressable market and I think being able to be first in line for those markets is very exciting plus it's just fun to see the way products evolve and and create more access and convenience for people we definitely appreciate the convenience for sure well thank you so much Kent it's been great talking to you and thank you for joining us for the conversation today we hope you'll check out more of our CEO series right here on Market Beats channel thanks again for watching everyone and as always happy investing [Music]
