title: GameStops Cash Pile Grows: Will This Be Enough to Save the Company?
text: Kind: captions Language: en GameStop stock is rising again after last night's earnings report what's behind these numbers let's break it down with our Market beat analyst Thomas Hughes and Chris marut guys great to have you both back on the channel today let's start off with what's happening with gamestock stock price today you're right the stock is moving up it's about you know 5 and a half percent right now I think it was up about 7% a little while ago um on this earnings report it's showing some support at a fairly critical level in on the charts and it could be setting up for a bigger move yeah Chris let's give a little context we've been following GameStop really since 2020 where does the price today compared to that all-time high that stock hit a few years ago so I mean if you're looking at the all-time high back in I think it was 2021 it was all the way up to around $80 a share so the the price at around $28 this morning is still well below that all-time high but GameStop's had a good year it's up 50% in 2024 so it's been having a strong year this is a stock we really been following on this channel uh for a while that this really the whole stock market's been following since 2020 so let's break down a little bit about did we think we'd still be covering this stock in 2024 the way we are today I really didn't think so I mean you can go back and look at the history of my articles I've not been very fond of the company not because it's a bad company per se but just because it's losing money and it's it's in contraction it's burning its cash it's eating itself to death there's just not a lot of reasons to expect it's value to go up yeah I kind of suspected we might still be talking about it it's it's one of these stocks that's become um you're going to get out of the report whatever you want to get out of the report if you are if you're bullish on the company there's reasons why you're going to still be bullish on the company after the report and if you're bearish on the company there's nothing that the report gave you that would change your opinion one way or the other yeah let's dive into the report a little bit uh what came out of the earnings report this week well so the good news is that it produced a surprising profit all right it hasn't been able to produce much profits for a while so profit is good and profit is helping to support the stock price it also increased its cash balance by 500% so it's pretty well capitalized right now and that's part of why um the Bulls are still so encouraged because they believe this cash pile will lead to some business transformation that we really haven't seen any glimmers of yet one of the problems in the report is that revenue is declining in every category of the business so Hardware is down software is down uh their their Collectibles businesses down I think that's something that should be more concerning if you're um if you're a retail investor that's actually thinking about getting involved in the stock is the company's business is in the gaming sector which is exploding at this time and GameStops losing money in that sector right and kind of in between those two opinions you know they made this surprising profit the business is Contracting the profit is only because of the cash balance it's because interest income the operating results are negative it burned money and its operations and the business is Contracting there's really no expectations for that to change so right now the company's kind of in a holding pattern so given all those details why do you think the stock price is still Rising this morning people want to believe you know and and the 4.5 billion in cash is a big number you know people think that even if the stock were to you know go out of business or whatever there's still going to be some value there and there's also hope for the turnaround but there's just there's no evidence of it yet and right now what we're looking at is just a persistent continual burning of cash eventually that cash balance will get Whitted down and then where will the market be left the retail investors love the CEO they believe that there's a plan everybody seems to have an opinion about what that plan might be but the company itself hasn't really outlined a plan and that's what makes me very dubious I mean you don't even have an earnings call after your report that doesn't give me a lot of confidence as investor that there's a bigger plan going forward it tells me that there's no plan I mean if they had a plan they hey we've got a plan they should be beating the the drunk we have a plan you know right but there there's no plan so that leads me to wonder how long will we be talking about GameStop what do you think will take to kind of get those uh hopeful people to finally get out of this stock or is this something that we're going to be talking about for years to come yet I think that we could be talking about this stock for years to come yet um one of the takeaways from this report is that with the interest income and producing profits they really have entered a holding pattern so technically speaking they can sustain operations indefinitely while the business slowly turns into nothing they'll be left over with some money but there'll be no business left and then what do they do so gamestock stock is still Rising which means people are buying it who are the people buying the stock right now I mean I think for the most part it's it's retail investors but there is a that's got me scratching my head and that's the institutional activity the institutions have been buying this stock on balance all year um the Holdings are still pretty low they don't own more than 50% it's like 25 or 30% I think not very much but they're buying on balance and that provides a Tailwind for the market you can see it in the stock price and I'm just wondering what it is that they're buying into are they speculating on this cash balance or a turnaround um are they just buying some shares so they can have them lend them out for being shorted um it's just it's a question I want to have answered do you feel that the movement in this stock is a true investment in this company or is it just an investment in a hope to make some money off of a short squeeze again GameStop's certainly a trade more than it is an investment and you can look at that in the options chain um I mean there's just a ton of option contracts out on the stock this is an option Traders dream right now I'm not so sure though that it's a short play because the short interest on the stock is really down something else I'm concerned about is the the the valuation and you my math could be wrong reported balance sheet shareholder equity and the number of shares outstanding puts the book value at like $11 so that's more than 50% lower than where it's trading right now to me that means sooner or later there will be a detail that comes out that just causes the bottom to fall right out of the market this stock certainly has a strong following so I know there's got to be some viewers out there that strongly disagree with this point what do you say to the the Believers on GameStop you could be right I could wrong good luck yeah I mean it's it's a trade it's it's to me it's not a it's not a long-term investment but there's probably money to be made guys thank you so much for the time today and breaking down this stock that again we're still talking about four years later and will still be talking about for a few years to come thank you for watching Market beat we hope that you can check out some of our other videos on other content including some past videos we've done on GameStop stock as well have a great day everyone and as always happy investing [Music]

updated every day and you can see which stocks have um a high percentage of short interest in terms of percent of total shares shorted or the percent of the float or days to cover however people might want to look at that now I know you've picked three stocks off of that list first let's take a look at why investors would want to look at the short interest of a stock if you were interested in shorting a stock those stocks would be good candidates the ones that have high short interest but you would also might want to be looking at stocks that might be a candidate for a short squeeze that means you might want to be buying a stock that a lot of people are shorting you've got three picks where Traders are doing just that with and these are some pretty popular names start with your first pick so the first one um I have on my list is SoundHound and I know we've covered that extensively on this channel it popped up on the screener and I was interested because this is a stock that's shot higher over the last couple of months and and one of the reasons for that is what we just talked about Bridget it's been a short squeeze stock trades about maybe a 38 million share average volume that's not a whole lot and what investors saw especially those mem stock investors is high short interest possibility of a short squeeze that's exactly what they've gotten I like SoundHound I'd expect the stock to pull back a little bit and that's when buyers might want to be looking to jump in absolutely yeah talk about longterm for this stock do you think there some growth potential here taking that short interest out this is a company that's on sort of the Forefront of where AI is pushing things especially in terms of sound recognition has contracts already with a lot of major companies and a lot of Major Brands it's just right now the Stock's been squeezed a little bit it's trading again at a at a very high premium I would expect the stock to pull back a little bit and that's what investors should look to get in all right so let's talk about the cycle of this short squeeze what this really start going up you know you'd probably say right after the election when a lot of this bare Market rally started that's when you started seeing the the significant movement here on on SoundHound as far as the when it might fizzle out my guess would be it might happen sometime this month as investors look to take profit before the end of the year and that might be a good time for investors to maybe go looking to shop during the Santa Claus rally between Christmas and New Year's or even after the New Year itself if you are looking looking to start trading with some high short interest stocks Market bead has a free premium report out there right now that can help walk you through move on to your second pick and again this is a stock a lot of people been talking about especially recently yeah that would be rocket lab and we talked about it on the channel just a couple weeks ago it's got even lower average daily volume than SoundHound which surprised me a little bit but good news about rocket lab this is a company that has a billion dollar backlog in total business that's not just their launch business but it's also their space Services business it's been in the middle of this short squeeze over the last month or so I would expect investors to see a pullback on this stock and again that would be a good entry point for for investors if you're already holding on to Rocket lab uh is this a time where you could takes some profit share you know nobody ever got broke taking a profit and right now again rocket Labs just shot up so much higher in the past few months it might be a very good opportunity to sell some of your stock take a little bit of profit for the holidays and then buy back in when the Stock's a little bit lower yeah with the stock like this one that's seen such a backlog of orders and that's seeing this kind of growth how much of a pullback do you think a rocket lab could see you could easily see it it pulling back about 10% from where it is right now it's it's not hard to see that at all again this is just a stock that's it's again it's it's not a bad stock it and it's got a lot of growth ahead of it but the Market's just gotten a little ahead of itself we're in a very uh bullish Market in general right now the Market's moving higher you've got a big name stock like this one is it possible that the bull market could just prevent any future pullbacks the Market's just in one of those Cycles right now where it wants to run higher there's no question about that that's why it's difficult to be a person that's trying to short a stock especially a stock like rocket lab right now because there could be just a lot of bulls that just keep jumping in and pushing the stock higher and so if you're looking at Rocket lab as a trade that's something you want to consider if you're looking at it as a long-term investment I would still strongly recommend you look for just a little bit of a pullback on the stock for a better entry point some good advice for investors there Chris all right let's get on to your third and final pick of high short interest stocks right now that would be Sofi Technologies this is a stock brid just that I boy it's been on my watch list for a long time um I just haven't been able to pull the trigger on it but I'm really I I'm interested in this company this is a company that uh most investors may know it as the company that started out as they did student loans they were the student loan company and they've become so much more especially over the past couple of years they got their banking license the company was basically starting at zero in terms of an asset base for being a bank two years ago and they've grown significantly since then but there's always been a high short interest on the stock a lot of investors who just don't believe that this company is um is going to deliver on their promises there is reason to believe that the stock maybe a little bit expensive right now um expensive doesn't necessarily mean it's overvalued but it is expensive right now this is another one I think the company's got a bright future I also think the Stock's a little bit overextended yeah some good point especially with this list that we've had so far all three of these companies seem to have good future potential but just a little bit higher sentiment than maybe what the true value is right now right and that happens with short interest stocks it's just it's very easy for these stocks to kind of take on a life of their own during one of these little squeezes the trick for investors is you have to know when to get out of that trade before it drops rapidly unless you're planning on really holding on for a long time in which case this doesn't really matter but if you're looking to trade in and out of the stock it's really important to watch when these stocks get a little bit toppy because the because the pullback can be sharp and it can be quick and you don't want to be on the wrong side of that trade well thanks for putting these three stocks on the watch list for some high short interest right now and you can find more information about all of these stocks we've covered them right here on this channel thanks again for watching and as always happy investing [Music]

title: SoundHound: The AI Stock Thats Up 100%  Could It Double Again Soon?
text: Kind: captions Language: en soundtown up 100% since last month's earnings reports but now the volatility is already underway here to break it all down for us is Market beat analyst Thomas Hughes Thomas this has been a great month for SoundHound yeah it really has been and what we have here is kind of a perfect storm of factors driving the stock price it starts with the results the company's uh growing and it's accelerating it's gaining traction the forecasts for next year are for this hyper growth to accelerate and continue again so another 100 % growth in the in the revenue next year uh the forecast may be cautious because of the investor day conference the investor day conference left the market feeling very confident about the future also revealed some new deals in a deal pipeline that kind of reinforces all this outlook for how good the next year is going to be and on top of that there's the short interest the short interest was nearly 30% at the beginning of the month and so a lot of this upward movement in the stock price is short covering let's talk about that movement in the stock price what have we seen this stock to since earnings last month well like you said it's it's up more than 100% but technically speaking what we're looking at is a break above um a significant resistance point so it suggests the upward momentum can continue uh the last week's big surge was also on pretty high volume Again part of that was short covering but the high volume kind of shows a lot of Market support for the stock at the price level that it's at now so uh we're looking at higher prices to come over over the next year now we've talked about SoundHound on this channel before what came out during earnings report and that investor call this month that has investors even more excited about the future of sound hounds well it just shows that the company is gaining traction it technology really is good it works the investor day conference you know the market walked away thinking wow this stuff really does work it sounds good it's kind of seamless providing a good service for businesses uh this new deal that they announc is with torches tacos that's for 130 stores it's not a lot of stores they've got about 10,000 restaurants using the software but they're talking about for torches the software is handling 100% of their calls it's taking orders it can take more than one order at a time it's answering questions so it's really helping the the the business uh become more efficient and that just plays into the outlook for not only for Revenue growth but for earnings potential yeah it's really one of the great usage of AI is to really take away something that's timeconsuming that takes a lot of human power and make it faster and I think that's why the idea behind SoundHound is taking off so quickly well right broadly speaking the services and automation is what um the current you know evolution of AI is best for handling data writing the data where it needs to go and then responding to queries and requests let's talk about uh what are analysts saying about sound Hound's future well so the analysts are pretty bullish but I would say the stock price has uh kind of front run their sentiment they're lifting their price targets but I think right now the stock price is about 40% overvalued relative to consensus uh so that plus the short covering element leads me to think that there could be some volatility we might expect a pretty sharp price pullback before we see new high set but ultimately the trend is positive and I would expect the analyst to catch up with the market given time and sometimes it can be hard to play these short interest stocks but if you want to learn more about how to play high short interest stocks check out this free market Bait Report it'll break down everything you need to know about playing stocks just like this one that have a lot of high short interest right now so Thomas what would be a really good trading play on a stock like SoundHound that's seen such a big runup so quickly well right so looking at this from the bull case and you know assuming that this this bull fundamental situation scenario really is playing out the way that I've described um you would want to wait for some price pullbacks and the price pullbacks will probably result in pretty clear U demarcations of support levels and then use those for entry points um if you have an opposite Viewpoint you're probably going to want to look for some of these um recognizable resistance points and use those as possible places to short the stock with rapid growth stocks like this one you always wonder about what kind of factors could potentially slow down all of these really quick gains is it competition are there competitors out there that might come take away some of sound Hound's market share um are there other economic factors are just things that could impact this growth trajectory for this company well right now SoundHound is is the leader in its field but I would say that most other AI companies are working towards similar ends um Salesforce in particular is a company that's going to want to use AI to automate its its workflows for businesses um and it is a potential you know buyer for SoundHound but again we got to remember that SoundHound is being backed by Nvidia so it's a good chance that SoundHound will remain a standalone company for a very long time that was a question question for the Bears that might be out there but for the Bulls what could lead to even more growth for SoundHound I'm sure there's plenty of companies that are really just starting to explore how AI applications like this one could help their business well I think that the growth trajectory for this company is is pretty robust businesses in general need to be efficient they need automation um so the the more businesses within one industry take on software like this the more the competition will need to follow suit so I think that this story is one that could continue to gain traction over the next couple of years um and right now sound hounds revenue is it's less than 100 million a year this company is going to be worth billions pretty soon so I would expect to see it grow by 100% or more over the next few years like each year annually um AI services are going to be the largest and fastest growing segment of the AI market so right now if you think that the Nvidia bubble is a is a big bubble wait until the services bubble gets inflated and we'll see how how big the market gets then yeah the rapid growth we're seeing in the whole AI sector is really incredible and SoundHound is absolutely a part of that story thank you so much Thomas for the breakdown on what's happening with SoundHound right now and thank you for joining us check out some of our other videos we've done on SoundHound in the past if you want to learn a little bit more about this company as always thank you so much for joining us and happy investing [Music] m

I'm sure there's plenty of companies that are really just starting to explore how AI applications like this one could help their business well I think that the growth trajectory for this company is is pretty robust businesses in general need to be efficient they need automation um so the the more businesses within one industry take on software like this the more the competition will need to follow suit so I think that this story is one that could continue to gain traction over the next couple of years um and right now sound hounds revenue is it's less than 100 million a year this company is going to be worth billions pretty soon so I would expect to see it grow by 100% or more over the next few years like each year annually um AI services are going to be the largest and fastest growing segment of the AI market so right now if you think that the Nvidia bubble is a is a big bubble wait until the services bubble gets inflated and we'll see how how big the market gets then yeah the title: Trinity Capital: The Dividend Stock Built for Growth
text: Kind: captions Language: en from data centers to Aerospace and biotech this private Credit Company can help you invest in all of them let's dive [Music] in today we are excited to have Trinity Capital CEO Kyle brown with us thank you so much for joining us today Kyle thanks Bridget thanks for having me well let's start with uh a little bit about what Trinity capital is sure so we are an internally managed business development company that is is a uh fancy way of saying we are a really an income play for investors we lend money to growth oriented businesses I think uh kind of late stage VCB companies into the lower Middle Market private Equity back companies we provide kind of an array of products to those companies but generally speaking we're looking for companies that are growing at a 20 to 100% annual growth rate who can utilize our Capital to extend their their Runway as they achieve milestones and head towards a larger valuation but we are private credit very Diversified across Industries been at it since 2008 and providing great returns and really steady dividends uh during that time frame yeah let's talk about the growth of private credit over the past few years there's really been an uptick in usage yeah and we've uh we've always been private credit the the term private credit certainly has become more popular over the last few years uh companies are staying private longer uh you have that Dynamic that exists you have banking volatility that really started a couple years ago has led Banks to lend less there's more regulation forcing their kind of Max check sizes to reduce along with just less deposits overall so you see Banks lending less companies staying private longer the relevance of private credit is certainly uh increased because the demand for capital is there and so um you know we we think that uh this is a really exciting time to be in private credit we find ourselves in a really interesting Niche uh that is different than I'd say the majority of private credit and alternative lenders out there who are focused on Upper Middle Market kind of larger profile companies um we think the lower Middle Market is a is a really exciting place to be we think that Baby Boomers and that transfer of wealth and businesses that's occurring right now and over the next five years is going to create a lot of opportunities uh for investments in that space so it's strong uh certainly you know very exciting right now but the future is pretty bright I think for investors looking to invest in Trinity Capital it's a chance to invest in the future of many many different companies and industries looking at your portfolio like you said you have a lot of high growth potential companies from AI to Aerospace uh to some uh medical companies as well talk about what kind of growth you're looking for and the people and companies that you're lending to sure so we come in really kind of late stage preo uh Prema that's where we begin and uh these companies have raised tens of millions if not hundreds of millions of dollars to develop a really inter interesting new product to attack an old archaic industry and uh they have real technology real IP patents Enterprise Value what they're doing is is really fundamentally kind of changing it's either they're able to create that product uh for Less uh and it's twice as effective um and so we're coming in and typically you mentioned AI I that's a really exciting space too right now uh we're not really taking gambl or taking risks on AI or the operating companies that are trying to uh to build and create revenues in that space we do more of the pick and shovel financing so we started as an equipment financing business it's still a big part of what we do right now and so in the AI space what we're doing is we're going into the data centers we're providing financing for the gpus um the Nvidia servers the AMD servers uh we're providing uh financing for the other capex needs they have power generation CPUs Etc so we really kind of stay in the peripheral we don't take that direct uh risk associated with the industry but really focus on more the Pix and shovel financing um space you mentioned that that's obviously uh you know very exciting right now we do a lot in um kind of that low lower orbit satellite um launching rocket lab is a big uh customer of ours borrow of ours and we're mostly providing equipment financing those Industries as you can imagine have significant capex needs uh they're building things that require large tools machines manufacturing l lines and so we're doing a lot there and then you know I think the other thing that I'm I'm really excited about is just Manufacturing in general um we're seeing a lot more manufacturing come back to the US this has been a trend for multiple years you have a lot of investment going into capex heavy companies and they require a lot of financing and so we're positioned really well to help build out manufacturing capacity here in the US let's talk about um the potential risk or benefits for investors who might be interested in investing in capital what's the risk of uh repayment and and how have you worked as a company to kind of lower and mitigate the risk on that so a couple things we we really do limit our exposure to any one credits uh less I don't think we have a credit right now over 3% of the uh portfolio we keep industry concentration uh limited we are senior secured on the vast majority of all of our our loans uh we're secured against all assets so we are PR prity in payment to those uh to those companies uh they've raised significant amount of equity they're sponsor backed either late stage VC or significant private Equity backing we only lend money to companies that have uh sponsors around the table with capacity to continue supporting them uh these are short-term loans so anywhere from 24 to 48 month uh terms typically so we're getting off of off risk quickly from a company perspective we we sit at pretty low leverage we have cover around 1:1 leverage we have continued to over earn the dividends so for investors we have 19 straight quarters of keeping the dividend steady or growing while continuing to earn above and beyond rate exposure I think that we're really positioned well right now in the event that rates drop uh the majority of our debt is is floating and so we actually see some benefits if rates decrease our cost of capital will go down and then 90 plus% of our portfolio this is all you can find this in the schedule Investments has floor rates that are above 12% so we we think we've positioned ourselves really well right now to continue to be a real consistent uh dividend and income play for investors I think right now the dividend yield is pretty high 14 15% that's really more of a reflection of just the stock being low and uh we think it's a great entry point for investors who are interested in in real consistent income and then and then maybe one of just kind of risk mitigator since 2008 we've continued to see uh 26 basis points annual loss rate that's a very low loss rate it's since 2008 and then we get warrants in more than half of the loans that we issue those warrants since 2008 have actually created realized gains that have offset losses and created some upside for investors so we actually have a net negative loss rate since 2008 so something else investors can look to and point to just to say Hey you know of course the future is is not set based on what's happened in the past but we have a pretty good history of keeping losses very low in fact uh negative that's very good to hear and I think um your portfolio itself speaks for that success rate you have a lot of really bigname clients you've mentioned a few and also of keep increasing the the um amount of money that you're lending every year can you go through just a few of the stats U from your recent report of just how many uh loans you've got out there so we sit uh we've got a portfolio 100 companies a little over two billion in assets uh that continues to grow uh earnings have grown ever since we Consolidated our business into a BDC in 2020 since then we've continued to increase earnings each quarter uh 19 straight quarters of of growing or keeping that dividend steady we saw net investment income continue to rise yet again uh we feel pretty good about where the portfolio is at right now we continue to see our portfolio strength uh we we do value the portfolio from a third party valuation perspective quarterly and that's continued to stay steady one of the main things I think I you know investors should know with our our company is we're not just a pool of assets when you're looking at bdcs business development companies the majority of them are a a pool of assets that trades publicly uh we are actually a management company and a pool of assets so we do not have a manage there's no management fee that's charged there's no incentive fee uh that's charged I own the same shares as any one of our shareholders and that makes us pretty unique we uh sought SEC approval last year to get uh to have the ability to own an RA and so what that means for investors is we have this public company it's continued to perform very well uh we also have a an R where we can go out and we can raise thirdparty Capital which we've done so we now our public company manages third party private capital and we can charge management fees and C fees so one of the reasons why you're seeing earnings grow while you're seeing our ability to increase uh earnings above and beyond the loans that we issue is that we actually are an asset management company as well and 100% of those management fee streams are owned by our public shareholders and so this is new this is newer for us over the last couple years you're starting to see the benefits of it flow to our shareholders most of the market doesn't get it yet they don't quite understand it there's not a lot of other bdcs doing it but what it does for us is it gives us the ability to not just be a consistent dividend play for investors but also to be a growth story in the stock as well so that's our goal long term we want to keep increasing the earnings for investors we want to be really steady yes but we actually want to continue to increase now we want to we want to continue to increase the dividend in earnings over time that's certainly helps to differentiate your company from other competitors out there Kyle this has been a really great conversation is there anything else that you'd like to share about what makes you excited about the future of Trinity capital I know you came on as CEO this year but you've been with the company for a long time again you've explained a lot of it already but anything else that just gets you excited about the future and where this company is headed yeah I mentioned it but you know our ability to continue to raise private capital and really grow the asset management side of our business is me it's meant to be a huge Boom for investors who can get into a stock who can expect that great holy dividend and who can see their returns grow over time and that's going to be really unique to us uh and a big differentiator for us relative to our other BDC peers and so I hope investors see that I hope they get excited about that and I think the future is really bright the opportunity for growth is there and we're doing it in a way that's really creative and good for investors and so yeah thanks Bridget appreciate you having me and uh to all your other stakeholders and investors out there we'd love your support thank you again Kyle for your time today and thank you for watching Market beat you can find more videos just like this one on our Channel thanks again for watching and as always happy investing [Music]

internally managed business development company that is is a uh fancy way of saying we are a really an income play for investors we lend money to growth oriented businesses I think uh kind of late stage VCB companies into the lower Middle Market private Equity back companies we provide kind of an array of products to those companies but generally speaking we're looking for companies that are growing at a 20 to 100% annual growth rate who can utilize our Capital to extend their their Runway as they achieve milestones and head towards a larger valuation but we are private credit very Diversified across Industries been at it since 2008 and providing great returns and really steady dividends uh during that time frame yeah let's talk about the growth of private credit over the past few years there's really been an uptick in usage yeah and we've uh we've always been private credit the the term private credit certainly has become more popular over the last few years uh companies are staying private longer uh you have that Dynamic that exists you have banking volatility that really started a couple years ago has led Banks to lend less there's more regulation forcing their kind of Max check sizes to reduce along with just less deposits overall so you see Banks lending less companies staying private longer the relevance of private credit is certainly uh increased because the demand for capital is there and so um you know we we think that uh this is a really exciting time to be in private credit we find ourselves in a really interesting Niche uh that is different than I'd say the majority of private credit and alternative lenders out there who are focused on Upper Middle Market kind of larger profile companies um we think the lower Middle Market is a is a really exciting place to be we think that Baby Boomers and that transfer of wealth and businesses that's occurring right now and over the next five years is going to create a lot of opportunities uh for investments in that space so it's strong uh certainly you know very exciting right now but the future is pretty bright I think for investors looking to invest in Trinity Capital it's a chance to invest in the future of many many different companies and industries looking at your portfolio like you said you have a lot of high growth potential companies from AI to Aerospace uh to some uh medical companies as well talk about what kind of growth you're looking for and the people and companies that you're lending to sure so we come in really kind of late stage preo uh Prema that's where we begin and uh these companies have raised tens of millions if not hundreds of millions of dollars to develop a really inter interesting new product to attack an old archaic industry and uh they have real technology real IP patents Enterprise Value what they're doing is is really fundamentally kind of changing it's either they're able to create that product uh for Less uh and it's twice as effective um and so we're coming in and typically you mentioned AI I that's a really exciting space too right now uh we're not really taking gambl or taking risks on AI or the operating companies that are trying to uh to build and create revenues in that space we do more of the pick and shovel financing so we started as an equipment financing business it's still a big part of what we do right now and so in the AI space what we're doing is we're going into the data centers we're providing financing for the gpus um the Nvidia servers the AMD servers uh we're providing uh financing for the other capex needs they have power generation CPUs Etc so we really kind of stay in the peripheral we don't take that direct uh risk associated with the industry but really focus on more the Pix and shovel financing um space you mentioned that that's obviously uh you know very exciting right now we do a lot in um kind of that low lower orbit satellite um launching rocket lab is a big uh customer of ours borrow of ours and we're mostly providing equipment financing those Industries as you can imagine have significant capex needs uh they're building things that require large tools machines manufacturing l lines and so we're doing a lot there and then you know I think the other thing that I'm I'm really excited about is just Manufacturing in general um we're seeing a lot more manufacturing come back to the US this has been a trend for multiple years you have a lot of investment going into capex heavy companies and they require a lot of financing and so we're positioned really well to help build out manufacturing capacity here in the US let's talk about um the potential risk or benefits for investors who might be interested in investing in capital what's the risk of uh repayment and and how have you worked as a company to kind of lower and mitigate the risk on that so a couple things we we really do limit our exposure to any one credits uh less I don't think we have a credit right now over 3% of the uh portfolio we keep industry concentration uh limited we are senior secured on the vast majority of all of our our loans uh we're secured against all assets so we are PR prity in payment to those uh to those companies uh they've raised significant amount of equity they're sponsor backed either late stage VC or significant private Equity backing we only lend money to companies that have uh sponsors around the table with capacity to continue supporting them uh these are short-term loans so anywhere from 24 to 48 month uh terms typically so we're getting off of off risk quickly from a company perspective we we sit at pretty low leverage we have cover around 1:1 leverage we have continued to over earn the dividends so for investors we have 19 straight quarters of keeping the dividend steady or growing while continuing to earn above and beyond rate exposure I think that we're really positioned well right now in the event that rates drop uh the majority of our debt is is floating and so we actually see some benefits if rates decrease our cost of capital will go down and then 90 plus% of our portfolio this is all you can find this in the schedule Investments has floor rates that are above 12% so we we think we've positioned ourselves really well right now to continue to be a real consistent uh dividend and income play for investors I think right now the dividend yield is pretty high 14 15% that's really more of a reflection of just the stock being low and uh we think it's a great entry point for investors who are interested in in real consistent income and then and then maybe one of just kind of risk mitigator since 2008 we've continued to see uh 26 basis points annual loss rate that's a very low loss rate it's since 2008 and then we get warrants in more than half of the loans that we issue those warrants since 2008 have actually created realized gains that have offset losses and created some upside for investors so we actually have a net negative loss rate since 2008 so something else investors can look to and point to just to say Hey you know of course the future is is not set based on what's happened in the past but we have a pretty good history of keeping losses very low in fact uh negative that's very good to hear and I think um your portfolio itself speaks for that success rate you have a lot of really bigname clients you've mentioned a few and also of keep increasing the the um amount of money that you're lending every year can you go through just a few of the stats U from your recent report of just how many uh loans you've got out there so we sit uh we've got a portfolio 100 companies a little over two billion in assets uh that continues to grow uh earnings have grown ever since we Consolidated our business into a BDC in 2020 since then we've continued to increase earnings each quarter uh 19 straight quarters of of growing or keeping that dividend steady we saw net investment income continue to rise yet again uh we feel pretty good about where the portfolio is at right now we continue to see our portfolio strength uh we we do value the portfolio from a third party valuation perspective quarterly and that's continued to stay steady one of the main things I think I you know investors should know with our our company is we're not just a pool of assets when you're looking at bdcs business development companies the majority of them are a a pool of assets that trades publicly uh we are actually a management company and a pool of assets so we do not have a manage there's no management fee that's charged there's no incentive fee uh that's charged I own the same shares as any one of our shareholders and that makes us pretty unique we uh sought SEC approval last year to get uh to have the ability to own an RA and so what that means for investors is we have this public company it's continued to perform very well uh we also have a an R where we can go out and we can raise thirdparty Capital which we've done so we now our public company manages third party private capital and we can charge management fees and C fees so one of the reasons why you're seeing earnings grow while you're seeing our ability to increase uh earnings above and beyond the loans that we issue is that we actually are an asset management company as well and 100% of those management fee streams are owned by our public shareholders and so this is new this is newer for us over the last couple years you're starting to see the benefits of it flow to our shareholders most of the market doesn't get it yet they don't quite understand it there's not a lot of other bdcs doing it but what it does for us is it gives us the ability to not just be a consistent dividend play for investors but also to be a growth story in the stock as well so that's our goal long term we want to keep increasing the earnings for investors we want to be really steady yes but we actually want to continue to increase now we want to we want to continue to increase the dividend in earnings over time that's certainly helps to differentiate your company from other competitors out there Kyle this has been a really great conversation is there anything else that you'd like to share about what makes you excited about the future of Trinity capital I know you came on as CEO this year but you've been with the company for a long time again you've explained a lot of it already but anything else that just gets you excited about the future and where this company is headed yeah I mentioned it but you know our ability to continue to raise private capital and really grow the asset management side of our business is me it's meant to be a huge Boom for investors who can get into a stock who can expect that great holy dividend and who can see their returns grow over time and that's going to be really unique to us uh and a big differentiator for us relative to our other BDC peers and so I hope investors see that I hope they get excited about that and I think the future is really bright the opportunity for growth is there and we're doing it in a way that's really creative and good for investors and so yeah thanks Bridget appreciate you having me and uh to all your other stakeholders and investors out there we'd love your support thank you again Kyle for your time today and thank you for watching Market beat you can find more videos just like this one on our Channel thanks again for watching and as always happy investing [Music]

Blackwell for months now is just to really speed up that production so there's so much demand for this new chip out there this should at least help with that and that should help Nvidia share prices as well right I I would think so if they can get that production to start going early next year they can improve the production outlook for next year and thereby meet the the unmet demand like you said the news today unconfirmed reports from Reuters um let's talk about how the stock price is reacting for NVIDIA but also Taiwan semiconductors well really both stocks are moving higher today um if you look at the charts they're kind of tied together I mean nvidia's growth is equal to Taiwan semiconductor's growth because Taiwan semiconductor makes most of the chips right now they're both moving higher they're both looking good showing support and it looks like their uptrends are intact yeah analysts have been excited about Nvidia all this year and have really good reports and good trajectory title: 2025 Gold Forecast: A Perfect Storm for Demand and New Highs

is Market beat analyst Thomas Hughes Thomas the price of gold is really starting to climb back up yeah it's uh it corrected since the election um I think that correction was just some volatility associated with policy anticipation and monetary policy anticipation for next year with the FED but uh the trends are bullish and I think think the trends will support the gold price rise well through 2025 yeah gold prices this year have really reached new highs this Market's been incredible this year uh yeah it is it really is I think that there's really a couple of factors in play one of it is Market normalization in the wake of the pandemic all the pandemic stimulus and spending really increased the monetary Supply so where the value of gold really Remains the Same and the amount of money is increasing so it takes more money to buy gold that's really a fundamental supporter of the price but also demand for gold from all of its major demand sectors is positive and pushing uh the price higher and those Trends should sustain through the end of next year why do you think gold prices will continue to rise through 2025 well because demand is growing so the estimates for how much gold is left kind of vary but we're pretty sure that there's only about 20 to 30% of the world's gold Supply left um two-thirds of all gold was mined since 1950 they think that gold supplies are going to run out 2050 not too much later than that as far as uh being able to go and mind new gold so decreasing Supply limited Supply and increasing demand um it's the it's the base case it's the recipe for higher prices when uh demand outstrips Supply prices go higher yeah that definitely makes sense oh let's talk about who is into the gold market and and who as investors should get into this Market if you're not yet well so as far as who's in the market right now and who's driving it there are four main vectors for demand that's jewelry retail investors central banks and Industrial demand and right now all those are on the rise when it comes to jewelry and Retail demand we have a growing world population and a growing middle class and so it's been proven that demand for gold increases as wealth increases and so with the population growing in the middle class also growing within that population we have a dual Tailwind for demand from that sector and jewelry is the largest demand Vector for gold on top of that we have central banks central banks particularly in the Emerging Markets have been buying gold for years they're expected to continue to buy gold because they're Shoring up their balance sheets they're creating a back stop for their own currencies they're reducing Market volatility and their own economies and they're hedging against geopolitical risk and there is ample risk in the market today and then the final Vector is industrial it's really the smallest sector of demand but it's growing and it's tied to technology uh some technologies that are really dependent on gold include solar but also a lot of the microchip Technologies that's tied to Ai and the iot rely on gold gold doesn't corrode it's a good conductor so it's very very well suited to a wide range of industrial applications as far as individual retail investors I obviously you mentioned the big players in this industry but are more and more retail investors looking to invest in gold well based on the ETF inflows I would say yes ETF flows had been bearish for several years until 2024 but this year the inflows uh reverted to positive and now that there is actual retail demand flowing into the title: Former Trump Advisor: Expect REITs to Soar Under Trump's Next Presidency
text: Kind: captions Language: en Trump built his fortune on investing in real estate now many investors are wondering what a more real estate friendly presidency could mean for the future of investing in this sector over the next four years Trump's former advisor Brad Thomas is here to share his insights on the future of REITs Brad we are so glad to have you with us today Brad is also the founder of WID mode research Brad let's Dive Right into what you think this next Trump presidency could mean for the next four years of investing in real estate sure well since we're talking about you know new presidential regime I'll you know we obviously have to discuss politics I will tell you for the record uh I was on Trump president Trump's Advisory Board in his last uh Administration and also wrote a book uh before he was um elected in 2016 called the Trump Factor so I spent two years analyzing um all of his properties which uh was a great way of saying I got to visit and play golf every golf course that that Donald Trump owns so I know it pretty well I'm not a great golfer for the record in full disclosure but um but I will say I know a lot about President Trump and his business mindset and how he created his wealth and I'm really looking forward with this new uh with this new president uh coming in this year in January really looking forward to to how he's going to help create wealth for average you know average uh American and so I think there are a number of ways that I think are going to benefit um real estate in specifically reachs there are certain sectors that I'm that we're more cautious in for example we'll start with kind of the caution flag and again not to say this is going to be a bad place to invest but I think the tariffs are really a question mark and what you know how those tariffs are going to impact um you know the US uh investor and and companies in the US now in general um I think I think this is going to be a good thing I think Trump has always done a pretty good job of negotiating you know um uh for us uh we saw that in his first Administration but again the tariffs could have an impa impact on inflation which of course is going to be could be problematic for some of the warehousing companies um I'm more specifically concerned about the risk in markets like California for example I think those are states um that I'm really more concerned about um than than some of the others but I think overall just broadly speaking in real estate I think the corporate ta extending the corporate taxes lowering corporate tax rate think it's going to have a significant impact on a lot of the tenants and a lot of the customers uh for for in reefs for example you kind of go sector by sector but if you look at the retail sector and we cover the shopping centers as well as the malls in addition to the outlet sector and I'm really excited because I think those companies are because of that lower tax rate are going to you know deliver more profits which is going to make their their certainly is is is they pay rent more sustainable business models for the landlords of companies like uh you know the shopping center re to the mall re and so forth so I think I think that's going to have a huge impact I think president Trump will be able to generate more jobs I think that's going to be the really the foundation to the success of his business of of his administration is to deliver more jobs you know more American jobs and I think that's going to really help increase manufacturing um and really help strengthen the overall you know broader economy you know in terms of kind of more real estate Focus you know within uh real estate investing we have this this we've had these laws on the books for a long time called 1031 exchanges that allows you to defer capital gains from one asset to another um that's survived many different um you know political uh changes over the years uh President Biden actually did remove some of the 1031 laws as it relates to to non-real estate but I think that's going to really continue to to create value because those laws are not just for corporations they're more for individual investors as well so I think I think we'll see that the other thing I'll tell you with with President Trump and again having analyzed his businesses pretty well I me he's actually a partner with uh one of the REITs has a very large Port of his part of his net worth uh tied to ownership being in partnership with with a very large re and he's actually owned shares in in Reit as well uh so I know he's very bullish with with the Reit sector he knows the sector pretty well and I think having some of the key people in place the new secretary of Commerce uh who came you know the founder of caner Fitzgerald Howard lutnick I think that's going to be extremely important for the re industry uh going forward and again I think overall that the tax the tax laws are going to be extremely favorable lowering those corporate taxes and again trying to strengthen the um individual investor so he has more disposable he or she has more disposable income uh to invest in in re so I think I I do think that it's going to be a very good good four years for for president Trump and again he's got a lot of work to do but I'm I'm certain he'll be able to perform this is definitely one sector a lot of investors are going to be looking at closely over the next few years of this next Trump presidency thanks for sharing your insights today Brad we'll be sharing more from Brad over the coming weeks here on Market beat he again is an expert in real estate investment and REITs he has a lot of knowledge to share and we'll hear back from him on this channel again soon thank you for joining us today on Market beat and as always happy investing [Music]

price right now there are some risks still ahead but I think provided they're able to finalize their reports in a satisfactory manner this rebound will not only continue but it could turn into a sustained rally for next year yes we'll break down some of those delayed reports in a minute but first let's kind of back up and talk about where this stock has been even though it might be trading over 30 right now it's still a far cry from where this stock peaked earlier this year so last year there was a quite a bubble formed with AI that bubble Peak well above $120 earlier this year now we're down around 40 um that big implosion is the AI bubble bursting but also compounded by those filing issues the market really lost its confidence in the stock uh right now what I see is the stock price is really disconnected from reality because trading in the mid-30s it's really in alignment to where it was at the end of last year before the bubble formed but we know that the business is more than 150% bigger so the stock certainly deserves more premium that the market is giving it right now right with that AI bubble bursting earlier this year investors might be a little bit wey about uh break down a little bit about what happened with earnings reports and financials for this company well it just started with some whistle blower testimony um earlier this year just kind of raising some questions about their practices and highlighting a problem they had in the past that was compounded by a short sale report kind of hit on the same the same subjects uh the company has since been unable to finalize its last year's fiscal year year-end report it lost its auditor because there was some misunderstanding in the numbers they couldn't get they couldn't get P um there has been a risk of delisting uh but the recent news is that they got a new auditor a trusted auditor BDO with the top five accounting firm globally um it's kind of restored some confidence in the market um the risk is that they won't be able to finalize their results but uh the general opinion right now is that boo will be able to do this in an expedited manner um and so whether it's good or bad we should know pretty soon I'm sure the new auditing firm is a part of the reason for the Boost in stock price but why do you think the stock is starting to rise again after are voling so low partially it's the rebuilding of confidence but also over the holiday week they announced that they've uh prepaid some debt they closed out two different lines of credit they had which is really a big deal because they're reducing uh debt risk they're freeing up cash flow they're improving the balance sheet and again they're just instilling some more confidence in the company's ability to uh to progress as a going concern yeah and I think that's what a lot of uh investors are wondering right now is how far can this company progress the stock price has certainly seen a lot of movement but let's talk about the company itself how successful is this business well the business is pretty successful they're one of the leaders with uh direct liquid cooled servers which is really important for AI the AI microchips uh use so much power they create so much heat um that cooling them and keeping the data centers functioning is a big cost for the data center operators so these liquid cooled server racks are really important for not only the efficiency of the chips but for the efficiency of the operation the forecasts for next year are still pretty good the company's 150% bigger this year than last year the forecast for next year are for another 20% growth uh those maybe cautious estimates just given um the way things have gone this year the analysts certainly have not a lot of reasons to be really aggressive with those targets absolutely so there's demand for their services uh they expect to see growth for that continue they're also working with Nvidia which has some consumer confidence as well correct indeed indeed one of the things that helped build the confidence over the last couple of weeks is that during nvidia's earnings report and conference call they gave super micro a shout out which just kind of um affirms the fact that Nvidia is still working with them and that it's still important to the AI infrastructure great well let's move on to the stock price itself this is what investors are really wondering how far do we think this rebound could possibly go well I think the stock could gain a good 50 to 100% from these current levels just based on the way that the revenue and earnings are GR um but where it goes soon and how long it stays there really depends on the new cycle and and how quickly they're able to get these these results finalized now let's dive into the analyst uh predictions a little bit more uh where are the most recent analyst targets at for this stock right so the most recent targets have it fairly valued near its current levels in the mid-30s the consensus is down significantly from its peak and we expect the stock to trade below the consensus because the new the new revision trend is is low but even at consensus we're looking at more than 100% upside so I think that uh we're looking at a floor for the market and the low3s with a potential for a 50 to 100% upside over the next 12 months oh let's talk about any trading plays for this stock with all of the volatility happening with smci right now the best trading plays would be to wait for a price dip because we know it's going to happen there's still a lot of uncertainty and is a volatile market so price dips would be a good time to get in in a small speculative Manner and anytime that it would rip or move higher would be a good time to get out well as we close out this video today Thomas the final question for investors out there is do you think that the stock is fairly valued of where it's at right now I really don't I mean and there is a lot of um concern with the reports so we could be I could be proven wrong this stock could go to zero but I think that trading at 11 times earnings is fairly undervalued compared to its peers which are trading at you know 20 30 and 40 times their earnings so I think that provided a positive outcome this stock will rocket higher and could easily see a 50 to 100% upside that's some good news if people are looking for a stock with some big potential growth thank you again for breaking down everything going on with this stock right now Thomas and thank you for watching check out more of our videos for more info just like this on Market beat thanks again for joining us and as always happy investing [Music]

title: Why Meta Is Still a Top Stock Pick for 2025
text: Kind: captions Language: en your second stock pick it's a good pick that was a winner this year and it's going to be a winner next year is a name many of us already know right meta platforms it's been a winner for the last couple years um I expect to see this stock also continue winning for the next couple of years the big concern over in the last earnings report which is kind of causing the price pullback now forecast for increased R&D spending on AI meta like Amazon has already proven as with Microsoft Google Oracle whoever spends money on AI I makes money on AI so they're spending money right now margins are going to be a little bit tighter than what analysts had expected for next year still solid but this investment should pay off in in accelerated growth over the coming years let's talk about where meta stock price is right now pulling back from an all-time high it's still above a critical support Target we're just waiting for the market to show a clear bottom but when it does I expect it to be fairly soon I would also expect to see this Market continue trending higher and setting a new alltime high this year before the end of the year what are analysts saying about meta's future analysts like meta in 2024 they've been raising their price targets and lifting sentiment they're uh leading this stock to new all-time highs uh because the company has persistently outperformed its own forecast and the consensus forecast I expect that to continue again in 2025 and that will add fuel for analysts to continue lifting their own their own targets so what we're in is an analyst upgrade cycle that should continue for the next few Quarters at least and drive this stock to new highs well there's a lot of brights side on the future for meta platforms especially as they integrate AI like you said let's talk about some economic political factors out there around the globe some countries are starting to come up with some restrictions on social media especially for younger audiences do you think any of this conversation around the the pros and cons of social media could impact meta's future of course but there's nothing new with this and those have been concerns from the very beginning um they always been part of meta's Outlook um as I mentioned before they're bricks on the wall of worry um they may cause meta to have some some price corrections but those Corrections will be buying opportunities so as you've said before meta a very fundamentally strong company just like Amazon so much of the conversation around AI investing right now is looking for those companies that are having incredibly accelerated growth going from a small company to very very large almost overnight what is kind of the the argument for investing in more sound long-established stocks like the two that you've just mentioned here you have better total returns over the long term investing is about buying and holding it's been proven time and time again that trying to chase stocks is a good way to lose your money that buying and holding is the way to go companies that are fundamentally sound are able to sustain long-term growth and long-term share price increases these companies that are small and seeing this really rapid growth are flashing the pan names their stock prices are being Rock it higher by sentiment not fundamentals um and they'll come crashing back to Earth [Music]

title: MicroStrategy Stock: Riding Bitcoins Wave to New Highs
text: Kind: captions Language: en Bitcoin has surged new highs since the election and now all eyes are on crypto here to break down what's going on in this world of investing is Market beat analyst Thomas Hughes Thomas there is quite a bit of movement in the crypto market right now yeah it's been pretty phenomenal bitcoin's up like 60% in the last couple of weeks um and a lot of this is just due to the election it was tickling new highs before the election it broke out right after the election and that's because Trump and the Republicans are cryptocurrency friendly his pick for treasury Scott bessent is cryptocurrency friendly so the market is just taking this as a uh a go-ahead to start investing in crypto again to start investing in crypto businesses for those businesses to start investing in in themselves so it's kind of Unleashed a new cryptocurrency summer and Bitcoin is the one that everyone's heard of but there's a lot of different altcoins out there are they seeing a lot of movement right now too they really are too but I think the movement and the altcoins is more of a risk-on mentality in the market now that the cryptocurrency um Outlook is a lot brighter there's going to be a lot more risky investors going into those coins um if you look at the data Bitcoin is still the dominant coin and it's actually gaining in dominance its market cap has reached a multi-year high it's been rising steadily it's at an all-time high and the hash rate which is the measure of the amount of computing power that's going into Bitcoin is also continuing to rise also at all-time high so Bitcoin is just as popular as it has ever been and is gaining popularity within the crypto currency Universe well for some investors who maybe aren't familiar or haven't yet gotten into cryptocurrency investing uh there's still ways to invest in this industry using the traditional stock market there are some companies that are either mining Bitcoin or investing in Bitcoin and micro strategy is one that stands out it used to be a software company but now it's pretty much just a bank of Bitcoin they've been leveraging their balance sheet to buy Bitcoin um for the last few quarters um the latest results show their Bitcoin stash growing by another 11% the value of that Bitcoin is up more than double in the last year because of the rise of bitcoin's prices um right now the outlook for this stock is that they're just going to continue to leverage their balance sheet and buy more Bitcoin and potentially become the world's first Reserve Bank of Bitcoin wow oh let's talk about their stock price right now where is it at and how much of a growth story is that in just this year well right the stock price shot up pretty solidly along with the price of Bitcoin um the Outlook is still pretty bullish but the market recently hit a top at 450 it's showing some pretty significant resistance I would expect to see shares of this stock uh Trend sideways and consolidate for the next few weeks maybe for a few months until uh Trump takes office and we see what's really going to happen but the long-term Outlook is pretty bullish for this for the stock it looks like uh analysts are raising their price targets quite a bit yes the trending analyst sentiment is very supportive for this market and they are leading it to New highs if you're new to investing especially in crypto you probably have a lot of questions about how to get started well we have a free premium report here at marketbeat called 10 best starter stocks for beginning investors click on the link or scan the QR code to get that free report and learn some of the best ways to get started Thomas if you are just getting started in crypto is it safer to really try and invest through the stock market in stocks like the one you just recommended or is it just as safe to really get into buying Bitcoin on your own well I want to say to start with that it is becoming safer to invest in Bitcoin but it's still a very risky asset and the stocks that invested it are still also very risky you have to be um very prepared for Vol volatility and you can see that in micro strategy price and in bitcoin's price it'll make some pretty wicked moves higher but it'll pull back just as quickly depending on uh which asset that you go for that's really going to be an individual risk preference whether you want to go into the stocks or into the coins themselves but the the big thing is just to be prepared for volatility long term though I think it is a good play cryptocurrencies is the future of finances um and eventually it will become a lot more mainstream than it is I know you mentioned it's getting safer and I think investors are realizing that simply in the number of investors that are starting to move toward investing in crypto right I can't really speak towards a specific number of investors that are doing it but there is some interesting data the inflows into Bitcoin tracking ETFs Jump by 100% the week after the election which I think is a pretty telling sign that retail investors are now interested in this market again and their support is present in the market well thanks for breaking down what's going on in the crypto Market again it's something everyone is talking about right now and I think we're going to be talking about this story for a long time to come thanks Thomas and thank you for joining us as always happy investing [Music] a
