title: How Abacus Life is Transforming Life Insurance into Assets | MarketBeat CEO Series
text: Kind: captions Language: en do you know the value of your life insurance policy a new public company is helping millions of people look at life insurance as an asset let's dive in today we are excited to have Jay Jackson the CEO of advocus life with us at Market beat thank you so much for taking the time to talk with us today Jay absolutely excited to be here well we're excited to hear your company's story in really a unique space share a little bit about what Abacus life does sure Abacus life is an alternative asset manager a global alternative asset manager that focuses primarily on purchasing assets that are predictable and consistent that might be traditionally uncorrelated through the market using our Actuarial data and our lifespan data to help set the value and that makes us a really unique business that investors today are really looking for how can they invest in assets that don't have the types of correlation that you see related to interest rate sensitivity and Market volatility and we're the company that originates those assets we're the market maker in those assets and we're also the asset manager in those assets you had a lot of big financial terms there so breaking it down to what what Amicus life provides it's really about life insurance talk about who your customers are and kind of your target group sure so what's really interesting is that in our name you see it's Abacus life which we thought we were being clever early on in the sense that Abacus being the first cou calculator and really the Life part was the idea of calculating your life knowing the value of your life and so we purchase life insurance policies we don't issue them and that is a really unique kind of twist because what happens is is that life insurance is used for a purpose a specific amount of time but then very rarely actually passed on to the airs and what I mean by that is life insurance is about a 13 trillion industry of the 13 trillion which by the way is two and a half times the US residential real estate market of that 90% of those policies or N9 out of 10 never pay a claim to the beneficiaries and it's not because the life insurance company has done something wrong it's because we don't treat it like an actual asset the Supreme Court ruled life insurance as personal property but we don't treat it like personal property we don't treat it like our home instead we just stop making payments on it because we think oh it's it served its purpose and what we do is educate all of our policy holders and clients to say hold on a minute you have an actual value just like your home and you have a choice to recognize what that value is in today's dollar and we're licensed all across the state it's very regulated and provide this service to those millions of policy holders that bought a life insurance policy and didn't know they had a liquidity on it yeah it's been around for a long time your company I believe 19 years old how has it grown and developed over that time and gained success in that time too it's done very very well so you know although many time for many people this is a newer idea or concept to them however we've been in in business for nearly well actually over 20 years now we've purchased over5 billion dollars of life insurance policies over that time period and here's what's really interesting we went public about 18 months ago that introduced us to a whole another set of not just investors but asset managers and lots of different investors who would look at this asset today much differently than they would have then and that's really broadened the audience to hear what's what's really happening in the underlying asset again you said your goal is educating people and you do that a lot through commercials if you watch CNBC or any other large Network out there you've probably seen an aboca's life commercial what's the goal of all of those commercials you're running right now Jay sure and you've probably seen me on them um and so we run we even ran on Monday Night Football um a few times last week and the goal is very simple we designed and built an easy to use calculator that somebody can quickly assess the value of that life insurance policy without having to speak to anyone they can just simply put in the size of their policy their age and gender and the policy type and and literally in just a few seconds it helps assess for them what the actual value of that policy might be based upon how they assess their own health that alone has driven tens of thousands of policy holders to us just searching for information and that then provides them a baseline to get an idea that says wow maybe I shouldn't laugh policy maybe I should keep it enforced for a little while longer because it might be worth 100,000 or 400,000 or even half a million dollars where they were just going to stop paying on it and think it was worth nothing and now with just 30 seconds they can actually find out so we've had a huge success with those with those commercials and and the response has been tremendous so part of your company is educating consumers out there about the value of their actual life insurance policies but there's another aspect to your company that's very interesting to people and that's how your calcul relating lifespan talk about that so we aggregate data related to lifespan and here's how we do it and and the reason why we do it is for someone to know what the current value of their life insurance policy is they need to know first how much longer you might continue to pay on it and and so what we do is help people solve and understand what's the today value if you're 75 years old and ideally you want to you know you're probably going to live to let's say to age 90 in 15 years if you have a million dollar life insurance policy assuming you keep paying on it then it will be worth to your estate a million dollars but what's it worth today and you have to deduct out those insurance premiums and you have to understand well okay what's my probability of living for the next 15 years what is my lifespan and the first thing we do with clients is that we get their updated medical files we reer write them in today's terms and help them have a better understanding of what their probabilistic lifespan is on a go forward basis that data is really really valuable and in in addition to just their life insurance policy we are also applying that data to their financial and estate plan so many times people are worried about gosh I'm going to run out of money in retirement we can help solve that by having people understand first and foremost how long are you going to be in retirement I think that should be the first question anyone asks themselves before they do a retirement or estate plan is okay well how long do I think I'm going to be here and we can provide that accurate data I think that's an concept A lot of our retail investors are interested in for themselves but I think they also want to hear about a lot of your company financials too before making an investment in a new stock our our viewers really care about the financials of your company so let's talk about kind of this steady Revenue growth that you've seen especially since going public it's interesting again we've been doing this for 20 years and these numbers have been relatively consistent um it's just that the investment public is just learning about us as a company that that so when they start to look at this analysis they're like wow where Where Have You Been there's three key things and we trade on the NASDAQ and we we ran this statistic and what we looked for were saying how many other companies have mid- teen year-over-year growth rates top and bottom line that have return on Equity greater than 18% and have an eida margin or profitability margin a profit margin of greater than 50% and I'll pause just so your your your audience can try to think about how many companies would meet that criteria consider all the companies that trade on the mag NASDAQ which include Microsoft it's just us we're the only company on all of NASDAQ that can state that so here you have a business that's been in existence for 20 years that is highly profitable with great margins and has been doing it consistently for the last two decades that's what's rare about our business and so so many times people today are looking for Investments or individual stocks that they invest in and they're concerned about oh hey is this just a gross stock or is this is do they actually make money should be the first and foremost question particularly you ask in today's kind of volatile Market absolutely and it sounds like you've got a good answer with your company for that question um let's move on to talking a little bit about growth where is your company going as far as expanding maybe adding additional assets or programs to what Amicus life provides what we're really starting to capitalize and monetize on is all of the data that we've aggregated over the last 20 years keep in mind understanding um lifespan and it's a very important and kind of a Hot Topic right several of the last New York Times Best Sellers are based on longevity lifespan and health span we have the data and we're actually providing that data starting to work with government agencies as well as informing people on how this lifespan can truly help monetize some of your other assets that you may have particularly your financial plan so some of the things we're very excited about we started rolling out our lifespan tracking to Pension funds so that they have a better understanding of of how they can best manage their pension and their unfunded liabilities and what their underlying pension needs actually look like we're also taking that data and applying it to Target dat funds Target date funds have raised nearly a trillion dollars in the United States where effectively you pick a Target date meaning 2035 some point in the future but you pick it without knowing what the actual Target date is those should be customized to each individual and when you start to think about how we apply our lifespan data it can be fundamentally applied to a lot of different Industries but specifically in financial planning all of a sudden now you will have the tools to be able to make really informed decisions as to whether you should be investing more heavily in equity or debt or depending on what your asset allocation may be based upon actually what the time is that you need to use it for let's talk about competition in this field are there other companies out there providing a similar service and how much of this space is amaka's Life currently occupying so we maintain a very large market share uh and part of that's due because we've earned that market share through 20 years of of of business support and relationships we partner with over 30,000 financial advisers across the United States we work with tens of thousands of consumers directly not just educating them on what the actual value of their life insurance or market value of the life insurance policy might be but also educating them on how this could potentially apply to their estate plan uh we are the only publicly traded uh company in our entire industry there are other companies in our business that that focus in different areas of of the origination piece but we're the only company that's taken gone the step further and said let's make this available and transparent uh and and validate what everybody can now look at our assets and our balance sheet and potentially invest in it so you know we're in a very fortunate position where we maintain over a quarter of the market share in our business and in addition to that we're the only publicly traded option for any investor to really get involved with and so we're thrilled uh and when you look at the growth prospects of everything we're doing think about the addressable Market we have in front of us we have an addressable Market that Google would blush over think about it it it effectively impacts nearly every American there's 13 trillion dollar of just the life insurance piece but when you start to roll that into other sides of financial planning it shouldn't be any surprise that we're having conversations with the largest in financial institutions in the country looking to apply and use some of these data sets that kind of leads to my next question which is investors are always curious about the risk and the future potential growth for this company are there any economic factors or changes in policy or things that could impact the future growth of your company or like you said is this a product that really truly will continue to impact everyone I think we're at the very early stages here which means that you're you're mitigating a lot of that what we would call compressed yield growth and in our case because you look at the overall size of the market is so large there are so many people that are just learning that this is a financial option to them and then applying this longevity piece to financial planning we have a lot of run room still left to go uh and frankly this is a proc consumer transaction so The Regulators it's heavily regulated already The Regulators really like this transaction right think about it we paid out just in 2023 $220 million to Consumers that $220 million on average went to people over the age of 70 think about how they're applying that maybe they're not having to go on Medicare or Medicaid even sooner right like we're putting a lot of liquidity into what might be deemed as a as a market that you know wants to maintain their dignity and integrity and now they have the resources to do so so where we sit today we are in a terrific position from both a regulatory as well as a market position to continue to maintain these growth well the last question I like to ask is as the CEO of this company what excites you most about abacus's life the way this company is run the products you offer what about running this company makes you most excited every day when people think of advocus what I really hope their takeaway is is that we are improving the quality of life for seniors for their families for their caregivers just on the insurance side and when you can change someone's quality of life uh and you can truly put wealth in a place that they didn't think that they have it that's what gets me up in the morning it's our purpose is about education and truly having an impact when you look at the underlying tagline of our company it's know the value of your life people don't place a value on their most important asset which is their lifespan and what we think we can do is help people better understand it and if they better understand it they can place a value on it and if they do that now they're going to be able to expand this into several other areas of their life so purpose and quality of life is super important that I think Abacus is providing thank you so much for your time today Jay and sharing more about your company with our viewers thank you for watching Market beat and learning more about this company and many others you can find lots of videos just like this one right here on our Channel leave us a comment let us know what you think about Abacus life and whether you might be adding it to your portfolio thanks again for watching and as always happy investing [Music]

two and a half times the US residential real estate market of that 90% of those policies or N9 out of 10 never pay a claim to the beneficiaries and it's not because the life insurance company has done something wrong it's because we don't treat it like an actual asset the Supreme Court ruled life insurance as personal property but we don't treat it like personal property we don't treat it like our home instead we just stop making payments on it because we think oh it's it served its purpose and what we do is educate all of our policy holders and clients to say hold on a minute you have an actual value just like your home and you have a choice to recognize what that value is in today's dollar and we're licensed all across the state it's very regulated and provide this service to those millions of policy holders that bought a life insurance policy and didn't know they had a liquidity on it yeah it's been around for a long time your company I believe 19 years old how has it grown and developed over that time and gained success in that time too it's done very very well so you know although many time for many people this is a newer idea or concept to them however we've been in in business for nearly well actually over 20 years now we've purchased over5 billion dollars of life insurance policies over that time period and here's what's really interesting we went public about 18 months ago that introduced us to a whole another set of not just investors but asset managers and lots of different investors who would look at this asset today much differently than they would have then and that's really broadened the audience to hear what's what's really happening in the underlying asset again you said your goal is educating people and you do that a lot through commercials if you watch CNBC or any other large Network out there you've probably seen an aboca's life commercial what's the goal of all of those commercials you're running right now Jay sure and you've probably seen me on them um and so we run we even ran on Monday Night Football um a few times last week and the goal is very simple we designed and built an easy to use calculator that somebody can quickly assess the value of that life insurance policy without having to speak to anyone they can just simply put in the size of their policy their age and gender and the policy type and and literally in just a few seconds it helps assess for them what the actual value of that policy might be based upon how they assess their own health that alone has driven tens of thousands of policy holders to us just searching for information and that then provides them a baseline to get an idea that says wow maybe I shouldn't laugh policy maybe I should keep it enforced for a little while longer because it might be worth 100,000 or 400,000 or even half a million dollars where they were just going to stop paying on it and think it was worth nothing and now with just 30 seconds they can actually find out so we've had a huge success with those with those commercials and and the response has been tremendous so part of your company is educating consumers out there about the value of their actual life insurance policies but there's another aspect to your company that's very interesting to people and that's how your calcul relating lifespan talk about that so we aggregate data related to lifespan and here's how we do it and and the reason why we do it is for someone to know what the current value of their life insurance policy is they need to know first how much longer you might continue to pay on it and and so what we do is help people solve and understand what's the today value if you're 75 years old and ideally you want to you know you're probably going to live to let's say to age 90 in 15 years if you have a million dollar life insurance policy assuming you keep paying on it then it will be worth to your estate a million dollars but what's it worth today and you have to deduct out those insurance premiums and you have to understand well okay what's my probability of living for the next 15 years what is my lifespan and the first thing we do with clients is that we get their updated medical files we reer write them in today's terms and help them have a better understanding of what their probabilistic lifespan is on a go forward basis that data is really really valuable and in in addition to just their life insurance policy we are also applying that data to their financial and estate plan so many times people are worried about gosh I'm going to run out of money in retirement we can help solve that by having people understand first and foremost how long are you going to be in retirement I think that should be the first question anyone asks themselves before they do a retirement or estate plan is okay well how long do I think I'm going to be here and we can provide that accurate data I think that's an concept A lot of our retail investors are interested in for themselves but I think they also want to hear about a lot of your company financials too before making an investment in a new stock our our viewers really care about the financials of your company so let's talk about kind of this steady Revenue growth that you've seen especially since going public it's interesting again we've been doing this for 20 years and these numbers have been relatively consistent um it's just that the investment public is just learning about us as a company that that so when they start to look at this analysis they're like wow where Where Have You Been there's three key things and we trade on the NASDAQ and we we ran this statistic and what we looked for were saying how many other companies have mid- teen year-over-year growth rates top and bottom line that have return on Equity greater than 18% and have an eida margin or profitability margin a profit margin of greater than 50% and I'll pause just so your your your audience can try to think about how many companies would meet that criteria consider all the companies that trade on the mag NASDAQ which include Microsoft it's just us we're the only company on all of NASDAQ that can state that so here you have a business that's been in existence for 20 years that is highly profitable with great margins and has been doing it consistently for the last two decades that's what's rare about our business and so so many times people today are looking for Investments or individual stocks that they invest in and they're concerned about oh hey is this just a gross stock or is this is do they actually make money should be the first and foremost question particularly you ask in today's kind of volatile Market absolutely and it sounds like you've got a good answer with your company for that question um let's move on to talking a little bit about growth where is your company going as far as expanding maybe adding additional assets or programs to what Amicus life provides what we're really starting to capitalize and monetize on is all of the data that we've aggregated over the last 20 years keep in mind understanding um lifespan and it's a very important and kind of a Hot Topic right several of the last New York Times Best Sellers are based on longevity lifespan and health span we have the data and we're actually providing that data starting to work with government agencies as well as informing people on how this lifespan can truly help monetize some of your other assets that you may have particularly your financial plan so some of the things we're very excited about we started rolling out our lifespan tracking to Pension funds so that they have a better understanding of of how they can best manage their pension and their unfunded liabilities and what their underlying pension needs actually look like we're also taking that data and applying it to Target dat funds Target date funds have raised nearly a trillion dollars in the United States where effectively you pick a Target date meaning 2035 some point in the future but you pick it without knowing what the actual Target date is those should be customized to each individual and when you start to think about how we apply our lifespan data it can be fundamentally applied to a lot of different Industries but specifically in financial planning all of a sudden now you will have the tools to be able to make really informed decisions as to whether you should be investing more heavily in equity or debt or depending on what your asset allocation may be based upon actually what the time is that you need to use it for let's talk about competition in this field are there other companies out there providing a similar service and how much of this space is amaka's Life currently occupying so we maintain a very large market share uh and part of that's due because we've earned that market share through 20 years of of of business support and relationships we partner with over 30,000 financial advisers across the United States we work with tens of thousands of consumers directly not just educating them on what the actual value of their life insurance or market value of the life insurance policy might be but also educating them on how this could potentially apply to their estate plan uh we are the only publicly traded uh company in our entire industry there are other companies in our business that that focus in different areas of of the origination piece but we're the only company that's taken gone the step further and said let's make this available and transparent uh and and validate what everybody can now look at our assets and our balance sheet and potentially invest in it so you know we're in a very fortunate position where we maintain over a quarter of the market share in our business and in addition to that we're the only publicly traded option for any investor to really get involved with and so we're thrilled uh and when you look at the growth prospects of everything we're doing think about the addressable Market we have in front of us we have an addressable Market that Google would blush over think about it it it effectively impacts nearly every American there's 13 trillion dollar of just the life insurance piece but when you start to roll that into other sides of financial planning it shouldn't be any surprise that we're having conversations with the largest in financial institutions in the country looking to apply and use some of these data sets that kind of leads to my next question which is investors are always curious about the risk and the future potential growth for this company are there any economic factors or changes in policy or things that could impact the future growth of your company or like you said is this a product that really truly will continue to impact everyone I think we're at the very early stages here which means that you're you're mitigating a lot of that what we would call compressed yield growth and in our case because you look at the overall size of the market is so large there are so many people that are just learning that this is a financial option to them and then applying this longevity piece to financial planning we have a lot of run room still left to go uh and frankly this is a proc consumer transaction so The Regulators it's heavily regulated already The Regulators really like this transaction right think about it we paid out just in 2023 $220 million to Consumers that $220 million on average went to people over the age of 70 think about how they're applying that maybe they're not having to go on Medicare or Medicaid even sooner right like we're putting a lot of liquidity into what might be deemed as a as a market that you know wants to maintain their dignity and integrity and now they have the resources to do so so where we sit today we are in a terrific position from both a regulatory as well as a market position to continue to maintain these growth well the last question I like to ask is as the CEO of this company what excites you most about abacus's life the way this company is run the products you offer what about running this company makes you most excited every day when people think of advocus what I really hope their takeaway is is that we are improving the quality of life for seniors for their families for their caregivers just on the insurance side and when you can change someone's quality of life uh and you can truly put wealth in a place that they didn't think that they have it that's what gets me up in the morning it's our purpose is about education and truly having an impact when you look at the underlying tagline of our company it's know the value of your life people don't place a value on their most important asset which is their lifespan and what we think we can do is help people better understand it and if they better understand it they can place a value on it and if they do that now they're going to be able to expand this into several other areas of their life so purpose and quality of life is super important that I think Abacus is providing thank you so much for your time today Jay and sharing more about your company with our viewers thank you for watching Market beat and learning more about this company and many others you can find lots of videos just like this one right here on our Channel leave us a comment let us know what you think about Abacus life and whether you might be adding it to your portfolio thanks again for watching and as always happy investing [Music]

meaning 2035 some point in the future but you pick it without knowing what the actual Target date is those should be customized to each individual and when you start to think about how we apply our lifespan data it can be fundamentally applied to a lot of different Industries but specifically in financial planning all of a sudden now you will have the tools to be able to make really informed decisions as to whether you should be investing more heavily in equity or debt or depending on what your asset allocation may be based upon actually what the time is that you need to use it for let's talk about competition in this field are there other companies out there providing a similar service and how much of this space is amaka's Life currently occupying so we maintain a very large market share uh and part of that's due because we've earned that market share through 20 years of of of business support and relationships we partner with over 30,000 financial advisers across the United States we work with tens of thousands of consumers directly not just educating them on what the actual value of their life insurance or market value of the life insurance policy might be but also educating them on how this could potentially apply to their estate plan uh we are the only publicly traded uh company in our entire industry there are other companies in our business that that focus in different areas of of the origination piece but we're the only company that's taken gone the step further and said let's make this available and transparent uh and and validate what everybody can now look at our assets and our balance sheet and potentially invest in it so you know we're in a very fortunate position where we maintain over a quarter of the market share in our business and in addition to that we're the only publicly traded option for any investor to really get involved with and so we're thrilled uh and when you look at the growth prospects of everything we're doing think about the addressable Market we have in front of us we have an addressable Market that Google would blush over think about it it it effectively impacts nearly every American there's 13 trillion dollar of just the life insurance piece but when you start to roll that into other sides of financial planning it shouldn't be any surprise that we're having conversations with the largest in financial institutions in the country looking to apply and use some of these data sets that kind of leads to my next question which is investors are always curious about the risk and the future potential growth for this company are there any economic factors or changes in policy or things that could impact the future growth of your company or like you said is this a product that really truly will continue to impact everyone I think we're at the very early stages here which means that you're you're mitigating a lot of that what we would call compressed yield growth and in our case because you look at the overall size of the market is so large there are so many people that are just learning that this is a financial option to them and then applying this longevity piece to financial planning we have a lot of run room still left to go uh and frankly this is a proc consumer transaction so The Regulators it's heavily regulated already The Regulators really like this transaction right think about it we paid out just in 2023 $220 million to Consumers that $220 million on average went to people over the age of 70 think about how they're applying that maybe they're not having to go on Medicare or Medicaid even sooner right like we're putting a lot of liquidity into what might be deemed as a as a market that you know wants to maintain their dignity and integrity and now they have the resources to do so so where we sit today we are in a terrific position from both a regulatory as well as a market position to continue to maintain these growth well the last question I like to ask is as the CEO of this company what excites you most about abacus's life the way this company is run the products you offer what about running this company makes you most excited every day when people think of advocus what I really hope their takeaway is is that we are improving the quality of life for seniors for their families for their caregivers just on the insurance side and when you can change someone's quality of life uh and you can truly put wealth in a place that they didn't think that they have it that's what gets me up in the morning it's our purpose is about education and truly having an impact when you look at the underlying tagline of our company it's know the value of your life people don't place a value on their most important asset which is their lifespan and what we think we can do is help people better understand it and if they better understand it they can place a value on it and if they do that now they're going to be able to expand this into several other areas of their life so purpose and quality of life is super important that I think Abacus is providing thank you so much for your time today Jay and sharing more about your company with our viewers thank you for watching Market beat and learning more about this company and many others you can find lots of videos just like this one right here on our Channel leave us a comment let us know what you think about Abacus life and whether you might be adding it to your portfolio thanks again for watching and as always happy investing [Music]

title: How Abacus Life is Transforming Life Insurance into Assets | MarketBeat CEO Series
text: Kind: captions Language: en do you know the value of your life insurance policy a new public company is helping millions of people look at life insurance as an asset let's dive in today we are excited to have Jay Jackson the CEO of advocus life with us at Market beat thank you so much for taking the time to talk with us today Jay absolutely excited to be here well we're excited to hear your company's story in really a unique space share a little bit about what Abacus life does sure Abacus life is an alternative asset manager a global alternative asset manager that focuses primarily on purchasing assets that are predictable and consistent that might be traditionally uncorrelated through the market using our Actuarial data and our lifespan data to help set the value and that makes us a really unique business that investors today are really looking for how can they invest in assets that don't have the types of correlation that you see related to interest rate sensitivity and Market volatility and we're the company that originates those assets we're the market maker in those assets and we're also the asset manager in those assets you had a lot of big financial terms there so breaking it down to what what Amicus life provides it's really about life insurance talk about who your customers are and kind of your target group sure so what's really interesting is that in our name you see it's Abacus life which we thought we were being clever early on in the sense that Abacus being the first cou calculator and really the Life part was the idea of calculating your life knowing the value of your life and so we purchase life insurance policies we don't issue them and that is a really unique kind of twist because what happens is is that life insurance is used for a purpose a specific amount of time but then very rarely actually passed on to the airs and what I mean by that is life insurance is about a 13 trillion industry of the 13 trillion which by the way is two and a half times the US residential real estate market of that 90% of those policies or N9 out of 10 never pay a claim to the beneficiaries and it's not because the life insurance company has done something wrong it's because we don't treat it like an actual asset the Supreme Court ruled life insurance as personal property but we don't treat it like personal property we don't treat it like our home instead we just stop making payments on it because we think oh it's it served its purpose and what we do is educate all of our policy holders and clients to say hold on a minute you have an actual value just like your home and you have a choice to recognize what that value is in today's dollar and we're licensed all across the state it's very regulated and provide this service to those millions of policy holders that bought a life insurance policy and didn't know they had a liquidity on it yeah it's been around for a long time your company I believe 19 years old how has it grown and developed over that time and gained success in that time too it's done very very well so you know although many time for many people this is a newer idea or concept to them however we've been in in business for nearly well actually over 20 years now we've purchased over5 billion dollars of life insurance policies over that time period and here's what's really interesting we went public about 18 months ago that introduced us to a whole another set of not just investors but asset managers and lots of different investors who would look at this asset today much differently than they would have then and that's really broadened the audience to hear what's what's really happening in the underlying asset again you said your goal is educating people and you do that a lot through commercials if you watch CNBC or any other large Network out there you've probably seen an aboca's life commercial what's the goal of all of those commercials you're running right now Jay sure and you've probably seen me on them um and so we run we even ran on Monday Night Football um a few times last week and the goal is very simple we designed and built an easy to use calculator that somebody can quickly assess the value of that life insurance policy without having to speak to anyone they can just simply put in the size of their policy their age and gender and the policy type and and literally in just a few seconds it helps assess for them what the actual value of that policy might be based upon how they assess their own health that alone has driven tens of thousands of policy holders to us just searching for information and that then provides them a baseline to get an idea that says wow maybe I shouldn't laugh policy maybe I should keep it enforced for a little while longer because it might be worth 100,000 or 400,000 or even half a million dollars where they were just going to stop paying on it and think it was worth nothing and now with just 30 seconds they can actually find out so we've had a huge success with those with those commercials and and the response has been tremendous so part of your company is educating consumers out there about the value of their actual life insurance policies but there's another aspect to your company that's very interesting to people and that's how your calcul relating lifespan talk about that so we aggregate data related to lifespan and here's how we do it and and the reason why we do it is for someone to know what the current value of their life insurance policy is they need to know first how much longer you might continue to pay on it and and so what we do is help people solve and understand what's the today value if you're 75 years old and ideally you want to you know you're probably going to live to let's say to age 90 in 15 years if you have a million dollar life insurance policy assuming you keep paying on it then it will be worth to your estate a million dollars but what's it worth today and you have to deduct out those insurance premiums and you have to understand well okay what's my probability of living for the next 15 years what is my lifespan and the first thing we do with clients is that we get their updated medical files we reer write them in today's terms and help them have a better understanding of what their probabilistic lifespan is on a go forward basis that data is really really valuable and in in addition to just their life insurance policy we are also applying that data to their financial and estate plan so many times people are worried about gosh I'm going to run out of money in retirement we can help solve that by having people understand first and foremost how long are you going to be in retirement I think that should be the first question anyone asks themselves before they do a retirement or estate plan is okay well how long do I think I'm going to be here and we can provide that accurate data I think that's an concept A lot of our retail investors are interested in for themselves but I think they also want to hear about a lot of your company financials too before making an investment in a new stock our our viewers really care about the financials of your company so let's talk about kind of this steady Revenue growth that you've seen especially since going public it's interesting again we've been doing this for 20 years and these numbers have been relatively consistent um it's just that the investment public is just learning about us as a company that that so when they start to look at this analysis they're like wow where Where Have You Been there's three key things and we trade on the NASDAQ and we we ran this statistic and what we looked for were saying how many other companies have mid- teen year-over-year growth rates top and bottom line that have return on Equity greater than 18% and have an eida margin or profitability margin a profit margin of greater than 50% and I'll pause just so your your your audience can try to think about how many companies would meet that criteria consider all the companies that trade on the mag NASDAQ which include Microsoft it's just us we're the only company on all of NASDAQ that can state that so here you have a business that's been in existence for 20 years that is highly profitable with great margins and has been doing it consistently for the last two decades that's what's rare about our business and so so many times people today are looking for Investments or individual stocks that they invest in and they're concerned about oh hey is this just a gross stock or is this is do they actually make money should be the first and foremost question particularly you ask in today's kind of volatile Market absolutely and it sounds like you've got a good answer with your company for that question um let's move on to talking a little bit about growth where is your company going as far as expanding maybe adding additional assets or programs to what Amicus life provides what we're really starting to capitalize and monetize on is all of the data that we've aggregated over the last 20 years keep in mind understanding um lifespan and it's a very important and kind of a Hot Topic right several of the last New York Times Best Sellers are based on longevity lifespan and health span we have the data and we're actually providing that data starting to work with government agencies as well as informing title: NVIDIA Earnings: Can Blackwell Propel the Stock to $200+ in 2025?
text: Kind: captions Language: en no surprise it's been a very high volume week for NVIDIA as earnings came out on Wednesday to talk about where the stock is now and where it's headed is Market beat analyst Thomas Hughes Thomas there's been a lot of movement on Nvidia ever since that report came out yeah it's been a pretty volatile reaction I would say the Market's having a hard time deciding if it's a good or a bad report I think it was a very very good report given the growth and the cash flow and the outlook for sales so right now we're down a little bit from uh the highs on Wednesday when they reported earnings still above critical support levels that's the previous all-time highs the volume is rising on a day-to-day basis and for the last few weeks um we are still also below a critical resistance point so we might see a little bit more sidewinding over the next few weeks but um the Outlook is positive the analyst trend is positive so I would expect to see all-time highs again pretty soon yeah I know you said before that this is the best report you've seen in two years from Nvidia and that if there is a dip which is kind what we're seeing right now at least sideways movement um it would be pretty short-lived why do you think this is going to be such a short-lived pullback the last few years have shown that nvidia's um position and technology has changed it's not just a stock for video games anymore it is now Central to the technology infrastructure because technology is now based on AI and when it comes to AI Nvidia is the first mover it's the the industry leader uh not only with its chips but with its Cuda infrastructure structure because without Cuda you can't really use those chips to do anything and now with Blackwell coming out those gpus are really being made to be AI specific so it's really going to improve the technology I expect to see more improvements over the next few years there's going to be really big major advances coming fairly regularly I would believe and Nvidia is Central to all of that absolutely the big part of this report is talking about how much demand there is for Blackwell and that Blackwell will be actually hitting the market in 2025 so let's talk about what that means for this stock moving forward and why Blackwell is in such high demand so Blackwell is in demand because it's better it's better than the previous iterations and it's better than a lot of the competition so it provides improved performance for AI specifically with training and inference now inference is critical because that's the leap from just reading data to making decisions that's where the AI really comes into play and you mentioned some features about black well that are so much better again this next generation is something people are excited for what are some features that have companies already investing in upgrading their AI Tech well a lot of it centered on the high bandwidth memory it's a new architecture for memory where um Micron Technology is a leader but what it does is allow for faster Computing um higher performance Computing while also helping to control temperatures temperatures are really important because of the power usage and the cost for the data centers to operate them and it seems like every Big AI giant out there is investing in those data centers right now let's talk about customers who are some of the biggest customers for these Blackwell chips all right so there's a number of customers that kind of fit into two or three different categories the number one are the cloud hyperscalers you've got Microsoft AWS and Google including Oracle to a lesser degree who command 95% of the cloud Market all of these companies already have Blackwell in use and the word on the street is that they're using them to build their most advanced super clusters met is using them to build a super Advanced cluster and Oracle is using it to build the oci super cluster which is going to be the first Zeta scale super cluster it's going to use 130,000 gpus in one cluster that's a large amount of gpus and quite a bit of revenue for NVIDIA especially considering over the next few years the upgrade cycle that's going to come about with the next iterations of these chips so that's a lot of positive outlook for NVIDIA but let's talk about any potential risks for this stock so there is some concern that the revenue will contract or compress in in the future we're not sure when that's going to happen but eventually there'll be some market normalization right now there's a rush to kind of get ahead of the curve once the industry normalizes Revenue might pull back a little bit but even so we're going to be looking at a company that's 8 n 10 times bigger than it was before the AI Revolution kicked off so the big question right now though is the cash this company is generating so much cash it's ridiculous its cash balance doubled over the last year it's net cash versus total liability it's in such a strong position to provide Capital Returns the only question is when so right now what I'm thinking is that this company is probably going to ride its momentum on its Revenue momentum until the stock price really begins to top out and then I would expect to see some pretty aggressive Capital returns including special dividend dividend increases and aggressive share repurchases what are analysts saying about the returns the stock could have just in the next year right so the analyst response to the news was pretty good I mean there's a lot of Market pundits kind of poo pooing it and calling it a bad report and kind of uh clouding the the future but the analysts are across the board raising their price targets they're leading to the high-end range of their target range which puts the stock at 200 or higher which is a $50 or about a 35% increase over the next 12 months based on the business Trends I would expect the analyst Trends to continue so that high-end will continue to rise over the next 12 months and a move to 200 may just be the tip of the next Iceberg so there's still plenty of room for this stock to grow but a lot of people are questioning when will nvidia's competitors start to catch up right so the competitors are working really hard right now and the closest competitor is AMD they're still the ways behind because Nvidia has so many years of of advanced work on their their infrastructure but AMD is really catching up now the opportunity right now is that demand for NVIDIA chips outpaces their ability to produce them so if AMD is able to get their production going there's an opportunity for them to start selling chips to people that just can't wait long enough to get the Nvidia chips all right Thomas thank you so much for this in-depth analysis marot Chris this feels like a week for the record books for paler I know you've been a fan of the stock for a while what's going on right now well the stock really just shot higher on on news that um the company's not going to be trading on the New York Stock Exchange as of Friday it'll be trading on the NASDAQ but what really got the stock moving was the company believes it's going to be able to fulfill the listing requirements to be a part of the NASDAQ 100 index and if that happens um it means that funds such as the investco QQQ which are Benchmark to the NASDAQ 100 index are going to start to have to add paler stock that's why that was the reason for the movement up in the stock yeah let's talk about just how far the stock moved up let's pull up the chart here 5 day is really crazy to see how much the stock went up and then come Monday it went down almost just as much as it went up the week before absolutely so it bounced up um and then it came all the way back down here to about where it started the week and then this this was the price action late week and it got all the way up to over $65 a share when it closed on uh Friday night so that was a 10% gain from you know from the start of the week to here was about a 10% gain lost that this isn't was in pre-market on on Monday morning it lost that and you'll notice though that where it bottomed here is about the same as where it started so that's kind of telling me that paler is forming a fairly good base of support right there around that $ 5859 level so you're looking at support around $5 5859 but I feel like just a couple of months ago you and I were on here doing a video about will paler reach $50 so this stock has seen quite a bit of movement that now $58 is that support level and not a will it reach that level right and so if we can just take a look here Bridget we can see that three months ago and we were doing the we were doing the video for could paler hit 50 when the stock was trading down around here and that's you know right around the $35 level and since then look at all the gains that it's made so clearly palente answered that question and then even if you look here I mean it's bounced off that level of what looked like support at around you know $40 and it's just been shooting higher so yeah this has been a this has been a big winner for the year and it just keeps on setting new levels of support as it goes higher I think that's so right it's been a big winner for the year and is that why there's so many Traders getting in on this stock right now kind of moving those 10% swings into each Direction paler is a fairly heavily shorted stock but that hasn't necessarily worked out really well if you're a short seller because there's a lot of retail investors that are still committed to holding the stock for the long term they're not selling their shares and so when you see a price movement like that it there's really not a lot of opportunity now some of the price action that you saw on Monday morning that may have been just people taking profits on the stock and if that's the case that's fine the stock is overvalued by any fundamental measure right let's get into that value what are analysts predicting and how often are those price targets changing because the stock is growing and moving so quickly price targets haven't changed a whole bunch since their last earnings report um Goldman Sachs came out and they raised it to like $41 they were at like $31 so analysts are still believing that paler is overvalued and I'm not going to sit here and argue with anybody by any objective measure paler stock is is overvalued the question is if you're a long investor you're long and so you would probably love to see paler pull back even more than it's pulled back right now and you could continue to accumulate shares at a much lower price but but that as we're showing in the chart that doesn't look like it's really likely to happen so really the question you just have to ask yourself is are you going to get in are you not going to get in options trading actually I put in my article options trading might have been a really good strategy but now the Stock's already dipped on Monday morning I don't know if you know there's there's probably an option trade in there somewhere but I'd have to go back and look at the charts to see you know where I would want to be putting my putting my price targets for that AB absolutely now this is such an interesting stock we've done a lot of different stories about what paler is what this company provides it's one big player in Ai and we'll get to that in a minute but first I want to talk about a premium report you can only find here on Market beep that outlines the 10 best AI stocks to own in 2024 click the link and see if paler makes that list there are so many AI stocks like this one that are really gaining tremendous success so where exactly does paler fit in on the the AI story here's the thing about AI is I was just hearing last week something that's really interesting is that there's as the earning season has gone through there's some analysts that are becoming a little bit how should we say a little bit skeptical about Ai and that's because companies are reporting that they're making this investment in AI but they're not necessarily seeing the return on that investment in what AI is delivering for them that's the key thing with paler and their ontology what paler is being able to provide their customers with is usable data that the companies have never been able to figure out how to make any use of it before and palente delivering meaningful insights to those customers and that's the difference is peners being able to show the customers a return on their investment with meaningful insights using Ai and that's where paler has a significant lead and it's which is why it paler not just a one of many but right now it's the one of one yeah you can find a lot of Chris's other videos where he's talked about paler and why this company is so unique part of the reason we're seeing so much movement in their stock right now oh Chris thank you so much for breaking down what's been going on with paler this week we will stay tuned to all the moves in this stock and many others in the AI space thanks for joining us here on Market beat and as always happy investing [Music]

title: Rocket Lab Stock Explodes HigherWhats Next for This Space Pioneer?

Market beat analyst Chris marot Chris really some exciting news about some big launches for this company in their earnings report they said that they had a record number of launches of their electron Rockets during the last quarter and I believe they said it was over 1 billion in backlogs in terms of launches for the company so very good news for the long-term shareholders uh sets very well for the company as far as the path to profitability which is important going forward I think there was also some earnings beat uh excitement in the report that or the earnings report that came out too you know the company is um they're not profitable yet but they're getting closer you can see the path to profitability and the revenue just keeps getting higher year-over-year that's what investors like to see let's talk about all of the trading interest in this stock there is a lot of people looking at Rocket lab right now yeah and some of them are not looking at it in terms of going long and investing for the future some are looking to short it this is a fairly High short interest stock yeah Chris a lot of Traders are really interested in this stock right now there's some pretty high short interest numbers right now in addition to having investors who are looking to buy the stock and hold it for the long term you've also got a lot of Traders looking to short the stock it short interest in rocket lab right now is up about 19% I think you and I were looking at that before we came on so it's down a little bit in the last month but it's still 19% short interest is still considered very high for a stock if you are new to trading in these high short interest stocks Market bead has a free report that anyone can click on right now in the link below or in the corner of your screen you can also scan the QR code it's a guide to high short interest stocks and how you can profit off of those as you are new to your investment Journey we've talked about short interest for Rocket lab let's talk about the price and what analysts are expecting right now this stock is trading way higher than what anyone really thought if you go on the market beat page for the analyst forecast the consensus price has it at about $14.72 so that's almost $5 higher than where the stocks trading right now but since I wrote my article um both caner Fitzgerald and Bank of America raised their price targets significantly for Rocket lab stock Bank of America went from $10 all the way up to $30 caner Fitz gerro went from $7 all the way up to $24 so you you're starting to see sentiment where analysts are raising their price targets above where the price is now which then suggests that the stock could go higher and getting back to that short interest point we were just talking about that means this may not be a good time to be shorting the stock because you could get caught in a squeeze absolutely with it being this high already do we see a risk of it coming down or are some of those new analyst predictions maybe something to look towards could this go even higher yet it could go higher it wouldn't surprise me if there was a little bit of a pullback when a stock goes up this high this fast uh it's right for people that are for shortterm Traders who are looking to just take some profit get some money off the table so it wouldn't surprise me if it goes down and keep in mind those price targets are probably you know for 12 months out so it wouldn't be surprising to see the stock come down a little bit then see a lot of institutional interest in buying the stock at a little bit lower price and then see it go back up again and of course if you're long on the stock you're just you're long and you just believe that the price is going to go up and so you're going to probably stay the course and you might even want to see a little bit of a dip now we've talked about rocket lab a few times on this channel and the people who are investing in this company are excited about the space race and everything that rocket lab take brings to the the table for that talk about some exciting advancements happening in this industry and specifically for this company we're in the middle of I guess a new space race is what I would call it and instead of it being I think in the' 60s it was the United States and the Soviet Union this is more of the United States and China in terms of we're trying to get that next lunar Landing with human beings on the moon and then ultimately to get to Mars rocket lab's a part of that but right now that's in the future right now the next step for Rocket lab is their Neutron Rockets which which have the ability to take on a slightly larger payload than their electron Rockets and the good news that came out of the company's report is that they are still on schedule to have those launches execute starting in 2025 that's just again more revenue for the company pushes it closer to the path of profitability and that's good news that's what investors want to see the company is about more than just launches but right now launches is where they're generating a tremendous amount of their business oh let's talk about the the current econ and kind of some different factors that might impact the investment into the Space Race moving forward I think the space sector is going to be okay um obviously you know we're just not really sure how all of the government efficiency efforts that the Trump Administration is going to undertake is going to affect that where are some of the cuts going to come where are they not going to be I think we're going to be okay here as long as you don't see the economy jump into a massive recession which doesn't look like it's going to happen let's talk about those people who might be new to Rocket lab just hearing about the stock because of this big takeoff is now a time to buy um when it's taken off this much and let's back up a little bit and just talk about how unique a runup this fast and or this big this fast is for stocks like this you always have to be careful um when you look at Price action like this when you have short interest that's as high as Rocket Labs because you have to wonder is this new money coming in on the Sidelines or is this money short investors who are now covering their short positions now that the stocks gone higher that's going to take a little bit of time to play out um if I were interested in buying the stock I I think the question you have to ask yourself is are you looking at this as a short-term trade or as a longer term investment I think the answer might be a little bit of the same which is if you're investing in it as a Trader I think you're going to want to wait to see it try to come back a little bit and then you try to get in if you're a investor that's interested in taking a longer position on the stock and you believe that the Stock's going to have a lot of growth coming in the next five 10 15 years I think it's okay to get in now and just you don't maybe have to go all in but maybe take a smaller position and then just add to that position over time some good information Chris thank you so much for your time today talking about this stock that has really caught a lot of people's attention right now if you want to learn more about rocket lab we've got several other videos we've done on this company check out those on our Channel and as always thank you for watching and happy investing [Music]
