high this fast uh it's right for people that are for shortterm Traders who are looking to just take some profit get some money off the table so it wouldn't surprise me if it goes down and keep in mind those price targets are probably you know for 12 months out so it wouldn't be surprising to see the stock come down a little bit then see a lot of institutional interest in buying the stock at a little bit lower price and then see it go back up again and of course if you're long on the stock you're just you're long and you just believe that the price is going to go up and so you're going to probably stay the course and you might even want to see a little bit of a dip now we've talked about rocket lab a few times on this channel and the people who are investing in this company are excited about the space race and everything that rocket lab take brings to the the table for that talk about some exciting advancements happening in this industry and specifically for this company we're in the middle of I guess a new space race is what I would call it and instead of it being I think in the' 60s it was the United States and the Soviet Union this is more of the United States and China in terms of we're trying to get that next lunar Landing with human beings on the moon and then ultimately to get to Mars rocket lab's a part of that but right now that's in the future right now the next step for Rocket lab is their Neutron Rockets which which have the ability to take on a slightly larger payload than their electron Rockets and the good news that came out of the company's report is that they are still on schedule to have those launches execute starting in 2025 that's just again more revenue for the company pushes it closer to the path of profitability and that's good news that's what investors want to see the company is about more than just launches but right now launches is where they're generating a tremendous amount of their business oh let's talk about the the current econ and kind of some different factors that might impact the investment into the Space Race moving forward I think the space sector is going to be okay um obviously you know we're just not really sure how all of the government efficiency efforts that the Trump Administration is going to undertake is going to affect that where are some of the cuts going to come where are they not going to be I think we're going to be okay here as long as you don't see the economy jump into a massive recession which doesn't look like it's going to happen let's talk about those people who might be new to Rocket lab just hearing about the stock because of this big takeoff is now a time to buy um when it's taken off this much and let's back up a little bit and just talk about how unique a runup this fast and or this big this fast is for stocks like this you always have to be careful um when you look at Price action like this when you have short interest that's as high as Rocket Labs because you have to wonder is this new money coming in on the Sidelines or is this money short investors who are now covering their short positions now that the stocks gone higher that's going to take a little bit of time to play out um if I were interested in buying the stock I I think the question you have to ask yourself is are you looking at this as a short-term trade or as a longer term investment I think the answer might be a little bit of the same which is if you're investing in it as a Trader I think you're going to want to wait to see it try to come back a little bit and then you try to get in if you're a investor that's interested in taking a longer position on the stock and you believe that the Stock's going to have a lot of growth coming in the next five 10 15 years I think it's okay to get in now and just you don't maybe have to go all in but maybe take a smaller position and then just add to that position over time some good information Chris thank you so much for your time today talking about this stock that has really caught a lot of people's attention right now if you want to learn more about rocket lab we've got several other videos we've done on this company check out those on our Channel and as always thank you for watching and happy investing [Music]

title: Why Whitestone REIT is Outperforming in 2024: 35% Growth & Monthly Dividends
text: Kind: captions Language: en a real estate investment trust up 35% this year what's driving their success let's dive in today we're excited to have Dave hullman joining us Dave is the CEO of Whit Stone reads Dave thank you so much for the time today well it's it's a pleasure to be with you and look forward to to speaking let's start off the conversation today with what sets Whit Stone Reed apart from other commercial real estate companies across the country so we are a a community centered Real Estate Investment Trust we value very much the the neighborhood so we we put our properties in in great neighborhoods and we're a Reit so we're a vehicle that allows investors to invest in real estate without having to go through all the trouble of of of buying and financing and and operating the properties we're located uh in the Sun Belt so 100% of our properties are in the Sun Belt in Texas and Arizona and we're in the the fastest growing markets in those States we're in Dallas Houston San Antonio Austin and then we're also in the the Phoenix Market our centers tend to be more convenience focused so we have really leaned into the driver of convenience being a large factor in consumer buying and then we specialize in in higher demand smaller spaces uh from a company perspective we're we're traded on the NYSC our ticker is wsr about a $750 million market cap company uh we we are one of the few public companies that pays a monthly dividend so we pay investors a monthly dividend uh allowing them the opportunity obviously to have income and participate in our growth and then very proud of our our performance if you look at Whit Stone over the last year uh our shareholder return is over 35% and then really since I stepped into the CEO role back in January of 22 uh We've produced a shareholder return of over 60% and that compares to the the sector return of about 15% very impressive growth story we'll get back to some of the stock numbers in a little bit I want to talk a little bit more about some of your properties and the history of your company how long has Whit Stone been around and are you developing some of these properties new yourself or are you taking over existing properties already yeah sure sure to glad to to share a little bit about our history I joined the company back in 2006 and was the Chief Financial Officer for a number of years uh at that time it was a very small uh company that owned assets largely in Houston uh and really had uh all retail shareholders and no institutional ownership at that time we internalized our management team uh and we adopted a strategy that really you know take took a look at the changing retail environment obviously e-commerce was uh was was growing uh there was a lot of thought about retail bricks and mortar being dead and we really leaned into the the the space of of services and convenience and the kinds of things that you couldn't buy on the internet over the next know 10 years we bought great properties in growing markets we expanded our Geographic footprint uh as I mentioned some of our markets were're in and then we've also strengthened our investor base uh 2020 which seems like a bunch of years ago obviously was the the pandemic and was a a big kind of rocked the world for all of us but uh we're the strength of Whit Stone's portfolio uh stood out during that time as we had you know some of the best performance in the sector and then recently our history with u as I mentioned I stepped into the CEO role in early 2022 so we've really been Laker laser focused on uh really strong corporate governance uh operational and financial performance you know for us it's a matter of of of doing what we say we're going to do and we've been focused on that and then discipline Capital allocation uh We've also spent a lot of time making sure we have the right team members in place we have goals and accountability and then uh tenant selection we'll uh we'll talk about what we do a little bit but but really understanding the consumer I think is incredibly important and no matter what business you're in and so we focused on making sure that we understand the neighborhoods have the right uh businesses in place and really support the community we're not a groundup developer we historically buy properties uh where we can find a property that we can come in and apply our operational and strategy to and add value so with that we do uh we do some amount of development uh in the existing properties but we're not a groundup developer we look for for assets and great markets that we can add value to one thing that you say sets your company apart too is working directly with your tenants what does that look like from you know the real estate owner and tenant partnership very fundamental to everything we do uh I mentioned our performance in the pandemic and I credit a lot of that to our close strong deep relationships with our tenants uh we're a little smaller than some of the other big public reats and I think with that we take a more Hands-On approach uh we're very very active in using technology to understand the community what the the buying needs are what the void analysis is and we we really lean into that and and spend time with tenants uh we have a a a team that regularly interacts with tenants uh meets with them regularly understands you know who their customers are what can we as a landlord do to help their businesses who are complimentary businesses that would help Drive their business so for us being uh very involved with our our tenants is crucial and we structure we actually structure that Arrangement a little differently than some of the others we have shorter lease terms which we like because it keeps us uh in front of the tenants more often it's important to have fresh centers with uh with businesses that are performing well and so we consider uh the strong tenant relationships one of the things that really sets White Stone AP par and your stock price is definitely showing the results of that strategy um doing very very well as you said up about 35% this year what do you expect for growth in the future yeah so so growth is something that we we focus on every day for us it has a lot of different different legs right you think about uh the existing portfolio we have today uh if you look at our same store growth in our properties it's among the best in the sector and we credit that to the you know the operational expertise of the team and our strategy we've also got growth opportunities I mentioned in some development and Redevelopment of our existing centers so uh for us we buy properties that sometimes have a little extra land where we can add a a very valuable pad site uh and we do that driven you know 100% by by demand and then uh growth also for us will be uh Acquisitions if you look at over the last couple years we've bought about hundred million in properties we've financed that with with doing some sales of properties but we think there's going to be great opportunities for us in the markets we're in and similar markets to really expand our asset base over the coming years yeah how does the current state of the economy uh discussions around interest rates impact your business going forward yeah it's it's the the current environment is as strong as I've ever seen it in our sector uh obviously the the macro I'm not an economist so I won't get too far over my skis but uh what we're seeing is we continue to see a healthy consumer the data that's coming out supports that and then more importantly on the ground we see our businesses doing well uh in our sector in the retail world real estate is is very different right and Retail real estate is very different I mentioned neighborhood centers uh we focus on the neighborhood centers which have seen the the best performance in the Retail Group uh but we're seeing a super strong Supply environment uh if you look back really from 2000 to 2009 uh there was really very little new Supply delivered into the markets for for strip centers and Retail centers you know for the last decade we've seen very little Supply so we're in a we're in an environmental time right now where we have strong demand we're in we're in markets that have great migration I mentioned Texas and Arizona leading the country and in new job growth and and new migration and then we also benefit from a a supply environment that that is uh super positive as well and then interest rates I think uh all of us have learned to operate with different interest rate levels for us as a real estate operator it's just it's matching uh we have shorter leases so we have the ability to to grow those lease rates in good times and and to to move them as interest rates change uh we have a capital structure that uh has uh you know extended maturities we lad our maturities we have lots of of financial Partners so so interest rates are something that I think we can we can uh work well with we've worked well with the the rising rates and I think we all think there's going to be you know it may take a little longer but there's going to be an environment with a little lower interest rates coming I believe for our retail investors out there you've already mentioned a little bit about being really proud of the balance sheet and how your company is run that's what a lot of our investors are interested in what are some of the the things about how your company operates that you're most proud of that you think investors would be interested to hear about one of the things we we focused on is making sure that we have the kind of transparency that allows investors to to see exactly what the drivers are in our business we have with that we've strengthened some of our governance we recently brought on a couple new extremely experienced strong board members that'll oversee uh the company so I think that's that's a great benefit for all investors and then from a balance sheet perspective I mentioned our capital structure uh we don't have complexity we have uh largely unsecured debt we have it well laded uh and then we'll continue to look for for ways to to fix those rates about 90% of our debt is at fixed rates and very little matur is coming over the the next several years so from a balance sheet perspective uh since I've stepped into the CEO role we've also focused on strengthening the balance sheet uh we received a an investment grade credit rating in late 22 and we've continued to to have a lower debt leverage on our balance sheet which I think shows the the strength of our portfolio I think a lot of investors are happy to hear about the improvements and the focus on your balance sheet how about the focus on the future anything else just to wrap up our conversation today that you're just excited about for the momentum for Whit Stone yeah I think uh momentum is a word that I think I would use to describe where we are today we have very positive momentum if you look at uh we talked a little bit about growth ultimately you know we we we judge ourselves on growth are we growing our shareholder value our shareholders uh earnings and are there is their stock worth more than it was before if you look at Whit Stone's earnings growth for 2014 we expect it to be about 11% on a per share basis which is is very good and I think the runway going forward is is great our organic growth is is super strong our team is good and we're positioned in a a great place in the in the market wonderful well Dave thank you so much for sharing more about Whit stone RE with our investors today you can find more about this company and many others right on marketbeat.com and stay on our channel for more information about other Investments That might benefit your portfolio thanks for joining us and as always happy investing [Music]

title: Why SoundHound Stock Dip Could Mean Big Gains for 2025 Investors
text: Kind: captions Language: en SoundHound is starting Wednesday down 15% after its earnings report but what could the future hold Market beat analyst Thomas Hughes joins us now with a look at the stock that's seen some explosive growth this year but not so great news this morning Thomas yeah this morning the stock is down but it's really just a reaction to uh news that didn't make the market quite happy enough uh the bar for this company has been set very high analysts have been raising the bar very high it's still outperformed the bar and raised its guidance but the whisper Figures were even higher so it's just a response to to not meeting up to these really high expectations but you got to remember that the company is still growing by nearly 90% growth is accelerating it's in the very very earliest stages of um an industry that's expected to more than to grow more than 500% in the next six years that 28% CGR so this is a big big story this pullback is absolutely a time to buy the stock this pull back is something we've seen in a lot of these rapidly growing AI companies Nvidia being one of them after earnings reports there's such high expectations but I think it's hard for investors to figure out how to play Such rapid growth this stock at the beginning of this year was trading under $2 and now we're up above seven almost $9 with more growth to come how do you keep as an investor on top of a stock that's seen such rapid growth well you have to keep it in perspective okay okay cuz SoundHound is still a a very tiny micro cap its Revenue this quarter was just $25 million that is a very very small amount of money so it's only begun to monetize its product but its industry is AI voice assistance and AI voice assistance is seen as U some have called it the the killer app for AI for generative AI it is what AI is supposed to be doing talking to you and helping you get through navigate through some processes including like um customer engagement so this compy focus is on helping Brands connect with their customers you think about call centers and all those voice AI products this is the leading voed AI product that's able to hold a conversation with people it's improving daily they're expanding into new verticals they're uh increasing they're improving the breadth of their product offerings so there's just a lot of things going for this company right now it's growing at a hyper growth Pace above 80% growth is accelerating it's continuously persistently raising its guidance it's raised guidance three times this year while outperforming so this is like a quadruple win for the business it's outperforming it's hyper growing it's raising guidance and it's persistently raising guidance we have to assume that guidance in the coming quarter will be raised and the guidance for next year which is calling for another acceleration and revenue to also be cautious so we're looking at a persistent cycle of improved guidance that should also be seen in the anal sentiment we should start seeing those guys start raising their estimates pretty soon and help um add lift to the stock price yeah so despite the the dip that SoundHound is seing this morning you just released an article saying you expect a big 2025 ahead for this company uh talk about some of those reasons you just mentioned a lot of them I think the the number of new contracts and other businesses that are jumping on top of SoundHound products is another good sign for strong future growth in 2025 right it's expanding the number of businesses and also the number of industries that it's serving so it's improving its client base one of the important metrics for this quarter is that its concentration and diversification were greatly improved last year at this time 70% of its Revenue came from a single client this year that same client only produced 12% of the revenue and there was an expansion into um other other segments other industries that just provides a much firmer base of support for the company's business all right with so much volatility in a stock in such a short time period what's the trading play for SoundHound yeah the 6 50 level looks like a pretty good trigger point for buying the stock fell hard after after the release it's down around that level right now but the early indications are that the market is buying this dip I would expect to see that this level or near to it hold as Firm support for the market to rebuild its base of support and to begin moving higher if not by the end of this year and early in two early in 2025 that sounds like a good entry point for Traders but a lot of Traders are also taking advantage of options especially for stocks like like this one if you are new to options Market bead has a premium report really explaining how options trading can really benefit your portfolio check out the link below or scan the QR code to get this premium report you're only going to find on Market beat all about options trading now Thomas what are some good options that people could consider for Sound Hound well SoundHound is probably a pretty good play for options Traders because of the volatility it's producing some pretty big moves it's also got some pretty clear technical levels for support targets where it's trading at now so I think this would be a fine a fine candidate for short-term and long-term options plays trying to capture the near-term volatility as well as the long-term price movements yeah there's been so much movement in this stock of course the short interest is also seeing a big increase uh any thoughts about that and how it impacts how you would play the stock well the short interest is certainly going to provide some headwinds for the market But ultimately I think the shorts are going to provide fuel for higher prices because as the company can continues to grow and op form it its estimates they're going to be forced to cover their trades and provide fuel for a short covering rally if not for a short squeeze uh the higher the short interest goes um the greater the chances for a short squeeze yeah how far are analysts expecting the stock to go in just the next year right so if you look on Market Beach you can see there's about eight analysts covering the stock their sentiment has been firming this year lifting the sentiment up to a moderate buy verging on buy and they've been raising their price targets right now their price targets are only expecting a low double- digit advance but again I expect the results and the forward results to lead to an analyst upgrade cycle that will provide lift to the market and Lead this stock to new highs so it sounds like you are a SoundHound fan and you would get on right now during this dip oh yeah I think this is a good stock to get into it's certainly a speculative play but it's got a lot going for it I think a smart position uh will perform very well for investors thanks for the time today Thomas and walking us through SoundHound you can read his full article on marketbeat.com and thank you for joining us here on marketbeat media let us know what you think about SoundHound is this a play that you're getting in on we'd love to hear from you thanks again for joining us and as always happy investing [Music]

title: Nintendo Stock: Buy Before the 2025 Switch Platform Hits!
text: Kind: captions Language: en well this next company also uh an OTC stock but definitely a company many people have heard of before yeah this is actually one I've been watching for about a year now uh it's Nintendo and so many investors are familiar with it because they are consumers as well and many are Gamers as well and so you know Nintendo for the Nintendo Universe the fun characters Super Mario Zelda all that so here's the thesis for owning the stock right now Nintendo introduced the switch about 7 years ago I think it was 2018 2019 in that time frame they're due to uh launch a new version of the platform the company has said that's going to start in March of 2025 so if you're thinking like an investor you want to say you want to get in on the stock before that gets launched because that's when the biggest gains in the stock are already going to be gone so if you believe that the company's going to hit that deadline now would be a great time to be invested in the stock it's got a current price of about $13 the analysts are saying it could go as high as $63 so this is a strong by stock because people are believing that once that switch platform is released you're going to start seeing a lot of these people start upgrading the plat the original switch platform that they have yeah and one more thing about Nintendo that I didn't that I put my article I didn't want to forget to say here is it's it's kind of interesting cuz they're kind of doing what Marvel's doing they're taking their characters and they're moving them into the Cinematic Universe so you already saw Super Mario's movie there's going to be a sequel to that and there's also going to be other plans to do movies for other of the Nintendo characters yeah my kids love that movie I've seen it many times and then they want all of the characters that come with it they want to dress up as Bowser for Halloween so yeah I see the profitability in that plan for sure um let's let talk a little bit more about other stocks maybe some case studies that we've seen when there's so many companies that are dependent on a product launch people get excited for it they want to try it out do we ever see product launches flop and maybe not do quite as well as investors or analysts might be expecting you see them I I can't think of one just right off the top of my head but yes that's always the risk in stocks like this the risk for Nintendo I think is not so much that the switch plat form is not going to be accepted by consumers I think the risk might be that the launch gets delayed I believe it's already been delayed uh by about three months I think their original plan was to have it out for the holiday season this year and they had to push that back so there's always that risk that comes with it but I think in the case of Nintendo I don't think analysts have to be that or investors have to be that worried about the platform not being accepted by consumers the from what I've been hearing the Gaming Community is very very interested in in the new Switch platform coming out well and getting in on this stock at around that $13 mark it sounds like a pretty good entry point for sure [Music]

title: How to Profit from NVIDIAs Earnings: Short-Term Trading Guide
text: Kind: captions Language: en Nvidia soarses to new highs just ahead of earnings. Just how high could it go in the next week? Here to break it all down for us is Marketbeat analyst Thomas Hughes. Thomas, let's start with just how high Nvidia's stock went just last week. Well, uh, last week it broke above a critical resistance target. That was the previous all-time high right around 141. And then it continued to move higher. So, it gained about 6 or 7% by the end of the week. Uh, but the critical detail is that it broke above a trading range. It broke above a previous high as a significant resistance point which indicates that the trend is still up. I would expect to see the stock continue to rise over the next week going into the earnings report. The earnings report very well could be a strong catalyst for bigger gains over the next two to three quarters. Yeah, there's a lot of movement and a lot of talk around Nvidia that happens every time their earnings report comes up. Now, one thing I want to point out is last time we were talking about Nvidia's earnings report, the everyone was waiting for that report to come and then the stock price fell immediately after earnings report. Are we expecting or anticipating anything like that surrounding this earnings? I think it would be safe bet to assume that there will be a price pullback after that. There's a lot of sentiment and um euphoria driven or embedded in the Nvidia price. So, even with a good report, there's probably going to be some profit taking. Uh, but any dip that forms would be a likely buying or entry point for new money, for new investors, both for short-term trades and for long-term investments. So, let's talk about getting in for those traders who are looking to make a profit off of some of the swings that are going to be happening with Nvidia this week and next week. Uh, where is a good entry point? Well, right now the 141 level looks like a pretty solid entry point. That is our resistance target, the previous high that was broken last week. Uh the market is moving up from that level. But uh technical theory says that the market is likely to pull back and retest for support. It could pull back as far as that 141 level. If it were to touch to that level, I would expect to see a pretty strong confirmation from the market that that is a a buying opportunity as far as wanting to get out and make that short-term profit. What price target would you be looking for in the near term? a 10 to 20% gain would be pretty easy. That aligns with um the general trend of analyst revisions. But over the long term, I would say there's a good 30% upside from that previous high because of the revision trends and because I would expect to see the revision trend continue to be positive over the coming quarters. Now, if you're looking to stay in Nvidia or to get in on more Nvidia, maybe when it has one of those dips coming up in the stock, what are some indicators and some talk right now about positive signs for long-term NVIDIA growth? There's been a lot of discussion around Blackwell and just on their really solid revenue happening right now. Well, right now it's coming down to the uh the hyperscalers. Microsoft, Amazon, and Google are all investing big dollars into their into their data center infrastructure, and most of that money is flowing to Nvidia. Um, we can see some of that flow going through Taiwan Semiconductors, who posted a pretty significant revenue increase. They make the bulk of Nvidia chips. So, right now, this is a systemic issue that we're watching. Um, the system is focused on Nvidia's chips, but it's being driven by all of the big major mega tech companies. Even uh Meta, Oracle, all the big guys that are building their data centers are all relying real heavily on Nvidia chips. So, what's the longer term target for Nvidia's stock price moving forward? Well, right now we have the analyst and the technical indicators um kind of confirming or agreeing together uh for the 190 to 200 range. So that that's right in line with the 30 to 35% gain I was talking about before. So a good long-term future, but in the short term, it feels like there could be some risk with that earnings report still coming out. What's the risk for people looking at this as as a short-term trade right now? Well, the risk is that the report will be underwhelming. So there is a lot of expectation baked into the report. Analysts have been raising their estimates. The bar has been set pretty high. Um, but with such demand, there's possible that the pipeline of chips isn't able to support how much demand there is. So, the report really could be underwhelming and that is a big risk for the stock price. That's definitely what we saw at last earnings report. We'll see if this one could be any different. Thomas, thank you so much for your analysis today. You can find more Nvidia news coverage right here on MarketBeat Media. Check out our other Nvidia videos right here on our channel. Thanks for watching and as always, happy investing. [Music]

title: Revolutionizing Logistics: Dot Ai Corporation CEO Ed Nabrotzky Talks IPO and Innovations
text: Kind: captions Language: en using AI to help companies keep track of their things let's dive into this new company about to go public today we are excited to have Ed NE brosky the CEO ofai Corporation with us to share more about his company Ed thank you so much for your time today thanks for inviting us we're excited to tell our story let's start out with what isai we started about three years ago and we developed a new way of collecting data at the edge of the enterprise we um we kind of invented that in the basement as most startups do and we started working on that actually in the autonomous vehicle Market we were looking at ways of using Cooperative markers to interact with um traffic signs Urban canyons and cities and things like that but the technology we developed there really became more applicable to uh Logistics and Manufacturing and and um asset tracking type technology and so we started transition into that space um the software we were veloping at the time also we realized the advantage of AI was much more powerful in these kind of multi-layered complex systems and so about two years ago we migrated the company much more towards Logistics and asset management and and that's really where we found a home and found great traction so uh that's what we are today wonderful so let's start with who are your customers who who uses your product well that's the problem with assets uh we all have things right I like to talk about the the internet of things but let's talk about the things customers are everything from consumers who have things all the way up to large Enterprises that have things we all want to know where our things are how many things we have are our things getting to the right place at the right time so anyone that has that kind of concern is one of our customers now we target Enterprise class customers that have multiple locations that are really concerned about their things and so uh large customers that are in the retail sector uh manufacturing is one of our biggest sectors that are moving a lot of things a lot of times through processes uh Logistics uh shipping companies the military has been a big deal for us they have a lot of things moving all the time um anyone who's got to manage their things is is our customer it sounds like that would take a team of software developers who are some of the people you have working for your team and and talk a little bit about where you are located around the world oh yeah we've uh We've assembled an amazing team I've done a number of startups in the past but I'm really proud of the team that we have our CTO is VJ nambiar he came to us from Verizon we recruited him specifically he was leading their 5G team to veling 5G routers in fact if you're using a Verizon 5G router that was probably vian's work when he was there at at Verizon um so he's an expert in that area uh V Jan has got our embedded team here in Shirley Massachusetts that's where I'm broadcasting from today I'm here in the lab with our launch party getting our our dfm group ready to launch our new product here for the fourth quarter we've got a brand new revolutionary patent pending bridge that we're launching and that's I'm here doing so Shirley Massachusetts just outs side of Boston is our technical headquarters where the R&D really happens um a lot of our software is programmed here from the embedded and device driver side but then we also have our web services and Cloud operations over in India in Bangalore and we have a large team there uh the hardware that we design for our Edge systems is actually manufactured in Puerto Rico we have our own Hardware manufacturing facility there just outside of San Juan and actually the Puerto Rican team is up here with me this week as we prepare for this launch uh so that's a fantastic facility I work mostly out of the Bethesda office we have a Washington DC Administrative Office office that's where all of our accounting and legal and uh compliance work happens um the sales department would call that the overhead group and then of course we have our our headquarters over in Las Vegas in our headquarters we're actually co-located with one of our large Distributors and we call it our Western experience Center that's where our customers can come and see our technology working in a warehouse environment where we move things around where we we change things um we use that as our training center for all of our distribution partners and channel Partners as well as our salespeople so our go to market headquarters is collocated there with our admin Center in Vegas where it's very easy to get people to fly to Vegas and come for training that's a big wide footprint kind of all over the place let's talk about the growth that you're experiencing as a company right now and the recent announcement that just came out too yes so we're we're taking our company public which is really exciting um we'll be on the NASDAQ we hope by the end of the year we're working our way through that we've been going through the various filings and compliance uh but we're on schedule for you know an endof year transition to that public company we need that cash to really Finance the growth that we're seeing we've already started with some Lighthouse customers that are very large multinational billion dollar corporations multi-billion dollar corporations that want to base their systems on our technology and so we've done initial Pilots we've started working through initial sites but uh this explosive growth needs to be funded as we go International uh we'll be founding more locations in Europe in particular as well as southeast Asia and um we'll be advancing a lot of our Channel programs through that that funding the technology we do needs a lot of work as well I mean we've got our base system working but there's so much to be done with AI and with uh image processing that we're working with some of our chip developments we've done with our patented passive microwave technology that this go public move is a chance to give us the rocket fuel we need to really take the system into a new generation of of performance as well as support uh for our customers around the world there's so much conversation around the world about Ai and so many new companies like yours popping up because of the new developments in AI let's talk about competition in this field a little bit are there other competitors out there who are doing something similar to what you're doing or are you really unique in this space well everyone's going to tell you they think they're unique but I've got a a long history I've worked for decades in the RFID and Auto ID business um and so I understand the systems that are there now and I guess I can boil this downbridge into two problems so applying AI to Logistics is relatively easy because AI engines are now available and the technology become more and more refined but the difficulty in applying I Logistics is the data isn't there it's very difficult and expensive to get data from all these things that move today we hire a lot of operators do barcode scanning where you put very expensive portals or infrastructured antennas up and that doesn't give us the richness of data you really need to drive an intelligent AI implementation what's unique about us is that we're not just an RFID company supplying the RFID we're we're marrying it with the vision systems and the AI backend that allows that data to be useful in the workflow so the combination of having the AI software as well as a really Unique Edge data collection system is what lets us develop value or deliver value that other companies really can't we find a lot of our competitors are kind of one trick ponies that are focused either on the software or on the data collection system but they struggle to get the both married together into a way that adds the value and maybe I can elaborate on one part of that so when you think about Edge collection uh Edge data collection um we think often about either a manual process like barcode scanning or we think about a very expensive of infrastructure like portals you know antennas that are scanning through pinch points um what we've developed is is something that you could think of like an Apple Air tag where an iPhone that's traveling through an Enterprise can pick up your air tag and report its location we've developed mobile readers that are battery powered that can go on your pallets on your forklifts on your totes and as it goes through your Enterprise it picks up these other tags and these other items um very seamlessly very inexpensively without having an engineer on site that has to put that together that's what's kind of unique about our data collection system uh and then on the software side having people that are experienced in this industry I've spent a career in this industry um many of my my sea- Lev team are from that side we've done an implementation I think that is really unique in the AI uh using not just the RF uh data capture capability but also the the vision systems that we overlay with it so um it's really kind of a an exciting and unique way that we've created a way to dynamically gather this data and then make it meaningful to an operator to get my things to the right place the right time I think that's what investors want to hear is what kind of demand is out there and what kind of success are you seeing with your clients clearly you're seeing some growth already but what's the benefit to the customers that you're serving and what kind of demand are you seeing from that pool of customers I've never had a company like this that has such a u a high hit rate normally in trouble but so many people are looking for a way to do this better and that's a combination of two things one is they they understand the inefficiencies in their process they're losing things they're having unreliability in the things but I think the other part is they're being driven by fear that the big retailers like Amazon Walmart have shown that tying their demand triggers from the front end to their backend operation is tremendously efficient and delivers value that we've never believed before I mean I I don't you're not as old as I am but I I would never have thought that I could order something online and have it show up on my doorstep the next day right that's like a miracle but we now expect that but so many Enterprises in the world today they have two we lead times to fulfill an order within their own internal operations their Logistics programs are still Antiquated and they and they don't have a way to upgrade them to that kind of modern expectation so the cios I talk to the CEOs I talk to at our customers are desperate to get those demand triggers in real time to the edge and get data from The Edge to to their customers of where their things are and how they're going to be delivered and they just haven't found a good solution that rolls in a cost- effective way that has the intelligence that they want that we're seeing in the commercial world and so we hope to be the one to bring it to them uh we know there's others of course trying to get there but we think we have a unique ability to get there first another important thing for our investors is always about the financials and how the company is run to um are you finding success already at this early stage of your company I believe you said you're about three years into development yes that's right so that the financials are always difficult I mean we are basically pre-revenue as a SAS company so although we've had some Revenue uh we've had a lot of seed funding um having gathered more than $7 million in seed as we've gone them to the stage and then also gone off of um various grants and research programs we've done that's been the primary source of our funding but um as we build our our SAS model and we're a bit of a hybrid where we have SAS and and Hardware what's wonderful coming to this stage is we have a backlog for our Hardware orders coming in from our transactional side and on the SAS side we have a base of Lighthouse customers that are now growing exponentially as they add more sites and add more applications and so the foundation for growth is there and the customer pickup is there uh but our funding so far has been more pre-revenue type activities that you'd see in a typical Tech startup well and you do have a new partnership with shoulder up tell us what that means for your company yeah shoulder up is our sponsor as we work through this go public uh exercise uh shoulder up is a fantastic uh group that we've enjoyed working with they have deep ties in the military um I probably should have explained earlier that in our our initial start some of our early customers were military uh projects we uh were awarded several SB programs we up the people we' started to attract it's been wonderful to build a team and and that's always the Great Joy but the second part that we're seeing the adoption we are um I think we've hit the timing to be applied um it's a complex field no one person can manage a multi-layered supply chain and get everything to the right place at the right time uh AI is a tremendous aid for that and and I think title: Revolutionizing Logistics: Dot Ai Corporation CEO Ed Nabrotzky Talks IPO and Innovations
text: Kind: captions Language: en using AI to help companies keep track of their things let's dive into this new company about to go public today we are excited to have Ed NE brosky the CEO ofai Corporation with us to share more about his company Ed thank you so much for your time today thanks for inviting us we're excited to tell our story let's start out with what isai we started about three years ago and we developed a new way of collecting data at the edge of the enterprise we um we kind of invented that in the basement as most startups do and we started working on that actually in the autonomous vehicle Market we were looking at ways of using Cooperative markers to interact with um traffic signs Urban canyons and cities and things like that but the technology we developed there really became more applicable to uh Logistics and Manufacturing and and um asset tracking type technology and so we started transition into that space um the software we were veloping at the time also we realized the advantage of AI was much more powerful in these kind of multi-layered complex systems and so about two years ago we migrated the company much more towards Logistics and asset management and and that's really where we found a home and found great traction so uh that's what we are today wonderful so let's start with who are your customers who who uses your product well that's the problem with assets uh we all have things right I like to talk about the the internet of things but let's talk about the things customers are everything from consumers who have things all the way up to large Enterprises that have things we all want to know where our things are how many things we have are our things getting to the right place at the right time so anyone that has that kind of concern is one of our customers now we target Enterprise class customers that have multiple locations that are really concerned about their things and so uh large customers that are in the retail sector uh manufacturing is one of our biggest sectors that are moving a lot of things a lot of times through processes uh Logistics uh shipping companies the military has been a big deal for us they have a lot of things moving all the time um anyone who's got to manage their things is is our customer it sounds like that would take a team of software developers who are some of the people you have working for your team and and talk a little bit about where you are located around the world oh yeah we've uh We've assembled an amazing team I've done a number of startups in the past but I'm really proud of the team that we have our CTO is VJ nambiar he came to us from Verizon we recruited him specifically he was leading their 5G team to veling 5G routers in fact if you're using a Verizon 5G router that was probably vian's work when he was there at at Verizon um so he's an expert in that area uh V Jan has got our embedded team here in Shirley Massachusetts that's where I'm broadcasting from today I'm here in the lab with our launch party getting our our dfm group ready to launch our new product here for the fourth quarter we've got a brand new revolutionary patent pending bridge that we're launching and that's I'm here doing so Shirley Massachusetts just outs side of Boston is our technical headquarters where the R&D really happens um a lot of our software is programmed here from the embedded and device driver side but then we also have our web services and Cloud operations over in India in Bangalore and we have a large team there uh the hardware that we design for our Edge systems is actually manufactured in Puerto Rico we have our own Hardware manufacturing facility there just outside of San Juan and actually the Puerto Rican team is up here with me this week as we prepare for this launch uh so that's a fantastic facility I work mostly out of the Bethesda office we have a Washington DC Administrative Office office that's where all of our accounting and legal and uh compliance work happens um the sales department would call that the overhead group and then of course we have our our headquarters over in Las Vegas in our headquarters we're actually co-located with one of our large Distributors and we call it our Western experience Center that's where our customers can come and see our technology working in a warehouse environment where we move things around where we we change things um we use that as our training center for all of our distribution partners and channel Partners as well as our salespeople so our go to market headquarters is collocated there with our admin Center in Vegas where it's very easy to get people to fly to Vegas and come for training that's a big wide footprint kind of all over the place let's talk about the growth that you're experiencing as a company right now and the recent announcement that just came out too yes so we're we're taking our company public which is really exciting um we'll be on the NASDAQ we hope by the end of the year we're working our way through that we've been going through the various filings and compliance uh but we're on schedule for you know an endof year transition to that public company we need that cash to really Finance the growth that we're seeing we've already started with some Lighthouse customers that are very large multinational billion dollar corporations multi-billion dollar corporations that want to base their systems on our technology and so we've done initial Pilots we've started working through initial sites but uh this explosive growth needs to be funded as we go International uh we'll be founding more locations in Europe in particular as well as southeast Asia and um we'll be advancing a lot of our Channel programs through that that funding the technology we do needs a lot of work as well I mean we've got our base system working but there's so much to be done with AI and with uh image processing that we're working with some of our chip developments we've done with our patented passive microwave technology that this go public move is a chance to give us the rocket fuel we need to really take the system into a new generation of of performance as well as support uh for our customers around the world there's so much conversation around the world about Ai and so many new companies like yours popping up because of the new developments in AI let's talk about competition in this field a little bit are there other competitors out there who are doing something similar to what you're doing or are you really unique in this space well everyone's going to tell you they think they're unique but I've got a a long history I've worked for decades in the RFID and Auto ID business um and so I understand the systems that are there now and I guess I can boil this downbridge into two problems so applying AI to Logistics is relatively easy because AI engines are now available and the technology become more and more refined but the difficulty in applying I Logistics is the data isn't there it's very difficult and expensive to get data from all these things that move today we hire a lot of operators do barcode scanning where you put very expensive portals or infrastructured antennas up and that doesn't give us the richness of data you really need to drive an intelligent AI implementation what's unique about us is that we're not just an RFID company supplying the RFID we're we're marrying it with the vision systems and the AI backend that allows that data to be useful in the workflow so the combination of having the AI software as well as a really Unique Edge data collection system is what lets us develop value or deliver value that other companies really can't we find a lot of our competitors are kind of one trick ponies that are focused either on the software or on the data collection system but they struggle to get the both married together into a way that adds the value and maybe I can elaborate on one part of that so when you think about Edge collection uh Edge data collection um we think often about either a manual process like barcode scanning or we think about a very expensive of infrastructure like portals you know antennas that are scanning through pinch points um what we've developed is is something that you could think of like an Apple Air tag where an iPhone that's traveling through an Enterprise can pick up your air tag and report its location we've developed mobile readers that are battery powered that can go on your pallets on your forklifts on your totes and as it goes through your Enterprise it picks up these other tags and these other items um very seamlessly very inexpensively without having an engineer on site that has to put that together that's what's kind of unique about our data collection system uh and then on the software side having people that are experienced in this industry I've spent a career in this industry um many of my my sea- uh you should know that our current name we're listed under is CID Inc that's uh we we're transitioning the corporation as part of this uh company transition so if you search on the the SEC we're working with our sponsors with through institutionalsales will be funneled into that group so you would contact me or my CFO Charlie Maddox and we would uh bring you into our our institutional pipeline Group Well thank you so much for your time today is there anything else about your company that you'd like to share you've said a few different times um about what makes you so excited about up the people we' started to attract it's been wonderful to build a team and and that's always the Great Joy but the second part that we're seeing the adoption we are um I think we've hit the timing really really well uh it's a time where AI is is emerging and it needs to be applied to more use cases we're seeing it being applied in our our normal lives but Logistics and supply chain and and asset management generally is pretty old school there's a lot of paper and clipboard out there still there's a lot of manual barcode scanning and labeling and um it's a rich field for this technology to be applied um it's a complex field no one person can manage a multi-layered supply chain and get everything to the right place at the right time uh AI is a tremendous aid for that and and I think everyone's seeing that because they're more comfortable with AI in their private life so it's a combination of the timing our technology hitting the market at the right time it's solving a real title: Revolutionizing Logistics: Dot Ai Corporation CEO Ed Nabrotzky Talks IPO and Innovations
text: Kind: captions Language: en using AI to help companies keep track of their things let's dive into this new company about to go public today we are excited to have Ed NE brosky the CEO ofai Corporation with us to share more about his company Ed thank you so much for your time today thanks for inviting us we're excited to tell our story let's start out with what isai we started about three years ago and we developed a new way of collecting data at the edge of the enterprise we um we kind of invented that in the basement as most startups do and we started working on that actually in the autonomous vehicle Market we were looking at ways of using Cooperative markers to interact with um traffic signs Urban canyons and cities and things like that but the technology we developed there really became more applicable to uh Logistics and Manufacturing and and um asset tracking type technology and so we started transition into that space um the software we were veloping at the time also we realized the advantage of AI was much more powerful in these kind of multi-layered complex systems and so about two years ago we migrated the company much more towards Logistics and asset management and and that's really where we found a home and found great traction so uh that's what we are today wonderful so let's start with who are your customers who who uses your product well that's the problem with assets uh we all have things right I like to talk about the the internet of things but let's talk about the things customers are everything from consumers who have things all the way up to large Enterprises that have things we all want to know where our things are how many things we have are our things getting to the right place at the right time so anyone that has that kind of concern is one of our customers now we target Enterprise class customers that have multiple locations that are really concerned about their things and so uh large customers that are in the retail sector uh manufacturing is one of our biggest sectors that are moving a lot of things a lot of times through processes uh Logistics uh shipping companies the military has been a big deal for us they have a lot of things moving all the time um anyone who's got to manage their things is is our customer it sounds like that would take a team of software developers who are some of the people you have working for your team and and talk a little bit about where you are located around the world oh yeah we've uh We've assembled an amazing team I've done a number of startups in the past but I'm really proud of the team that we have our CTO is VJ nambiar he came to us from Verizon we recruited him specifically he was leading their 5G team to veling 5G routers in fact if you're using a Verizon 5G router that was probably vian's work when he was there at at Verizon um so he's an expert in that area uh V Jan has got our embedded team here in Shirley Massachusetts that's where I'm broadcasting from today I'm here in the lab with our launch party getting our our dfm group ready to launch our new product here for the fourth quarter we've got a brand new revolutionary patent pending bridge that we're launching and that's I'm here doing so Shirley Massachusetts just outs side of Boston is our technical headquarters where the R&D really happens um a lot of our software is programmed here from the embedded and device driver side but then we also have our web services and Cloud operations over in India in Bangalore and we have a large team there uh the hardware that we design for our Edge systems is actually manufactured in Puerto Rico we have our own Hardware manufacturing facility there just outside of San Juan and actually the Puerto Rican team is up here with me this week as we prepare for this launch uh so that's a fantastic facility I work mostly out of the Bethesda office we have a Washington DC Administrative Office office that's where all of our accounting and legal and uh compliance work happens um the sales department would call that the overhead group and then of course we have our our headquarters over in Las Vegas in our headquarters we're actually co-located with one of our large Distributors and we call it our Western experience Center that's where our customers can come and see our technology working in a warehouse environment where we move things around where we we change things um we use that as our training center for all of our distribution partners and channel Partners as well as our salespeople so our go to market headquarters is collocated there with our admin Center in Vegas where it's very easy to get people to fly to Vegas and come for training that's a big wide footprint kind of all over the place let's talk about the growth that you're experiencing as a company right now and the recent announcement that just came out too yes so we're we're taking our company public which is really exciting um we'll be on the NASDAQ we hope by the end of the year we're working our way through that we've been going through the various filings and compliance uh but we're on schedule for you know an endof year transition to that public company we need that cash to really Finance the growth that we're seeing we've already started with some Lighthouse customers that are very large multinational billion dollar corporations multi-billion dollar corporations that want to base their systems on our technology and so we've done initial Pilots we've started working through initial sites but uh this explosive growth needs to be funded as we go International uh we'll be founding more locations in Europe in particular as well as southeast Asia and um we'll be advancing a lot of our Channel programs through that that funding the technology we do needs a lot of work as well I mean we've got our base system working but there's so much to be done with AI and with uh image processing that we're working with some of our chip developments we've done with our patented passive microwave technology that this go public move is a chance to give us the rocket fuel we need to really take the system into a new generation of of performance as well as support uh for our customers around the world there's so much conversation around the world about Ai and so many new companies like yours popping up because of the new developments in AI let's talk about competition in this field a little bit are there other competitors out there who are doing something similar to what you're doing or are you really unique in this space well everyone's going to tell you they think they're unique but I've got a a long history I've worked for decades in the RFID and Auto ID business um and so I understand the systems that are there now and I guess I can boil this downbridge into two problems so applying AI to Logistics is relatively easy because AI engines are now available and the technology become more and more refined but the difficulty in applying I Logistics is the data isn't there it's very difficult and expensive to get data from all these things that move today we hire a lot of operators do barcode scanning where you put very expensive portals or infrastructured antennas up and that doesn't give us the richness of data you really need to drive an intelligent AI implementation what's unique about us is that we're not just an RFID company supplying the RFID we're we're marrying it with the vision systems and the AI backend that allows that data to be useful in the workflow so the combination of having the AI software as well as a really Unique Edge data collection system is what lets us develop value or deliver value that other companies really can't we find a lot of our competitors are kind of one trick ponies that are focused either on the software or on the data collection system but they struggle to get the both married together into a way that adds the value and maybe I can elaborate on one part of that so when you think about Edge collection uh Edge data collection um we think often about either a manual process like barcode scanning or we think about a very expensive of infrastructure like portals you know antennas that are scanning through pinch points um what we've developed is is something that you could think of like an Apple Air tag where an iPhone that's traveling through an Enterprise can pick up your air tag and report its location we've developed mobile readers that are battery powered that can go on your pallets on your forklifts on your totes and as it goes through your Enterprise it picks up these other tags and these other items um very seamlessly very inexpensively without having an engineer on site that has to put that together that's what's kind of unique about our data collection system uh and then on the software side having people that are experienced in this industry I've spent a career in this industry um many of my my sea- Lev team are from that side we've done an implementation I think that is really unique in the AI uh using not just the RF uh data capture capability but also the the vision systems that we overlay with it so um it's really kind of a an exciting and unique way that we've created a way to dynamically gather this data and then make it meaningful to an operator to get my things to the right place the right time I think that's what investors want to hear is what kind of demand is out there and what kind of success are you seeing with your clients clearly you're seeing some growth already but what's the benefit to the customers that you're serving and what kind of demand are you seeing from that pool of customers I've never had a company like this that has such a u a high hit rate normally when you're calling out you're in single-digit percentages about demand generation activities and number of contacts we've been ping in the percentages and I I don't want to over quote it here and get in trouble but so many people are looking for a way to do this better and that's a combination of two things one is they they understand the inefficiencies in their process they're losing things they're having unreliability in the things but I think the other part is they're being driven by fear that the big retailers like Amazon Walmart have shown that tying their demand triggers from the front end to their backend operation is tremendously efficient and delivers value that we've never believed before I mean I I don't you're not as old as I am but I I would never have thought that I could order something online and have it show up on my doorstep the next day right that's like a miracle but we now expect that but so many Enterprises in the world today they have two we lead times to fulfill an order within their own internal operations their Logistics programs are still Antiquated and they and they don't have a way to upgrade them to that kind of modern expectation so the cios I talk to the CEOs I talk to at our customers are desperate to get those demand triggers in real time to the edge and get data from The Edge to to their customers of where their things are and how they're going to be delivered and they just haven't found a good solution that rolls in a cost- effective way that has the intelligence that they want that we're seeing in the commercial world and so we hope to be the one to bring it to them uh we know there's others of course trying to get there but we think we have a unique ability to get there first another important thing for our investors is always about the financials and how the company is run to um are you finding success already at this early stage of your company I believe you said you're about three years into development yes that's right so that the financials are always difficult I mean we are basically pre-revenue as a SAS company so although we've had some Revenue uh we've had a lot of seed funding um having gathered more than $7 million in seed as we've gone them to the stage and then also gone off of um various grants and research programs we've done that's been the primary source of our funding but um as we build our our SAS model and we're a bit of a hybrid where we have SAS and and Hardware what's wonderful coming to this stage is we have a backlog for our Hardware orders coming in from our transactional side and on the SAS side we have a base of Lighthouse customers that are now growing exponentially as they add more sites and add more applications and so the foundation for growth is there and the customer pickup is there uh but our funding so far has been more pre-revenue type activities that you'd see in a typical Tech startup well and you do have a new partnership with shoulder up tell us what that means for your company yeah shoulder up is our sponsor as we work through this go public uh exercise uh shoulder up is a fantastic uh group that we've enjoyed working with they have deep ties in the military um I probably should have explained earlier that in our our initial start some of our early customers were military uh projects we uh were awarded several SB programs we
