three years ago and we developed a new way of collecting data at the edge of the enterprise we um we kind of invented that in the basement as most startups do and we started working on that actually in the autonomous vehicle Market we were looking at ways of using Cooperative markers to interact with um traffic signs Urban canyons and cities and things like that but the technology we developed there really became more applicable to uh Logistics and Manufacturing and and um asset tracking type technology and so we started transition into that space um the software we were veloping at the time also we realized the advantage of AI was much more powerful in these kind of multi-layered complex systems and so about two years ago we migrated the company much more towards Logistics and asset management and and that's really where we found a home and found great traction so uh that's what we are today wonderful so let's start with who are your customers who who uses your product well that's the problem with assets uh we all have things right I like to talk about the the internet of things but let's talk about the things customers are everything from consumers who have things all the way up to large Enterprises that have things we all want to know where our things are how many things we have are our things getting to the right place at the right time so anyone that has that kind of concern is one of our customers now we target Enterprise class customers that have multiple locations that are really concerned about their things and so uh large customers that are in the retail sector uh manufacturing is one of our biggest sectors that are moving a lot of things a lot of times through processes uh Logistics uh shipping companies the military has been a big deal for us they have a lot of things moving all the time um anyone who's got to manage their things is is our customer it sounds like that would take a team of software developers who are some of the people you have working for your team and and talk a little bit about where you are located around the world oh yeah we've uh We've assembled an amazing team I've done a number of startups in the past but I'm really proud of the team that we have our CTO is VJ nambiar he came to us from Verizon we recruited him specifically he was leading their 5G team to veling 5G routers in fact if you're using a Verizon 5G router that was probably vian's work when he was there at at Verizon um so he's an expert in that area uh V Jan has got our embedded team here in Shirley Massachusetts that's where I'm broadcasting from today I'm here in the lab with our launch party getting our our dfm group ready to launch our new product here for the fourth quarter we've got a brand new revolutionary patent pending bridge that we're launching and that's I'm here doing so Shirley Massachusetts just outs side of Boston is our technical headquarters where the R&D really happens um a lot of our software is programmed here from the embedded and device driver side but then we also have our web services and Cloud operations over in India in Bangalore and we have a large team there uh the hardware that we design for our Edge systems is actually manufactured in Puerto Rico we have our own Hardware manufacturing facility there just outside of San Juan and actually the Puerto Rican team is up here with me this week as we prepare for this launch uh so that's a fantastic facility I work mostly out of the Bethesda office we have a Washington DC Administrative Office office that's where all of our accounting and legal and uh compliance work happens um the sales department would call that the overhead group and then of course we have our our headquarters over in Las Vegas in our headquarters we're actually co-located with one of our large Distributors and we call it our Western experience Center that's where our customers can come and see our technology working in a warehouse environment where we move things around where we we change things um we use that as our training center for all of our distribution partners and channel Partners as well as our salespeople so our go to market headquarters is collocated there with our admin Center in Vegas where it's very easy to get people to fly to Vegas and come for training that's a big wide footprint kind of all over the place let's talk about the growth that you're experiencing as a company right now and the recent announcement that just came out too yes so we're we're taking our company public which is really exciting um we'll be on the NASDAQ we hope by the end of the year we're working our way through that we've been going through the various filings and compliance uh but we're on schedule for you know an endof year transition to that public company we need that cash to really Finance the growth that we're seeing we've already started with some Lighthouse customers that are very large multinational billion dollar corporations multi-billion dollar corporations that want to base their systems on our technology and so we've done initial Pilots we've started working through initial sites but uh this explosive growth needs to be funded as we go International uh we'll be founding more locations in Europe in particular as well as southeast Asia and um we'll be advancing a lot of our Channel programs through that that funding the technology we do needs a lot of work as well I mean we've got our base system working but there's so much to be done with AI and with uh image processing that we're working with some of our chip developments we've done with our patented passive microwave technology that this go public move is a chance to give us the rocket fuel we need to really take the system into a new generation of of performance as well as support uh for our customers around the world there's so much conversation around the world about Ai and so many new companies like yours popping up because of the new developments in AI let's talk about competition in this field a little bit are there other competitors out there who are doing something similar to what you're doing or are you really unique in this space well everyone's going to tell you they think they're unique but I've got a a long history I've worked for decades in the RFID and Auto ID business um and so I understand the systems that are there now and I guess I can boil this downbridge into two problems so applying AI to Logistics is relatively easy because AI engines are now available and the technology become more and more refined but the difficulty in applying I Logistics is the data isn't there it's very difficult and expensive to get data from all these things that move today we hire a lot of operators do barcode scanning where you put very expensive portals or infrastructured antennas up and that doesn't give us the richness of data you really need to drive an intelligent AI implementation what's unique about us is that we're not just an RFID company supplying the RFID we're we're marrying it with the vision systems and the AI backend that allows that data to be useful in the workflow so the combination of having the AI software as well as a really Unique Edge data collection system is what lets us develop value or deliver value that other companies really can't we find a lot of our competitors are kind of one trick ponies that are focused either on the software or on the data collection system but they struggle to get the both married together into a way that adds the value and maybe I can elaborate on one part of that so when you think about Edge collection uh Edge data collection um we think often about either a manual process like barcode scanning or we think about a very expensive of infrastructure like portals you know antennas that are scanning through pinch points um what we've developed is is something that you could think of like an Apple Air tag where an iPhone that's traveling through an Enterprise can pick up your air tag and report its location we've developed mobile readers that are battery powered that can go on your pallets on your forklifts on your totes and as it goes through your Enterprise it picks up these other tags and these other items um very seamlessly very inexpensively without having an engineer on site that has to put that together that's what's kind of unique about our data collection system uh and then on the software side having people that are experienced in this industry I've spent a career in this industry um many of my my sea- Lev team are from that side we've done an implementation I think that is really unique in the AI uh using not just the RF uh data capture capability but also the the vision systems that we overlay with it so um it's really kind of a an exciting and unique way that we've created a way to dynamically gather this data and then make it meaningful to an operator to get my things to the right place the right time I think that's what investors want to hear is what kind of demand is out there and what kind of success are you seeing with your clients clearly you're seeing some growth already but what's the benefit to the customers that you're serving and what kind of demand are you seeing from that pool of customers I've never had a company like this that has such a u a high hit rate normally when you're calling out you're in single-digit percentages about demand generation activities and number of contacts we've been ping in the percentages and I I don't want to over quote it here and get in trouble but so many people are looking for a way to do this better and that's a combination of two things one is they they understand the inefficiencies in their process they're losing things they're having unreliability in the things but I think the other part is they're being driven by fear that the big retailers like Amazon Walmart have shown that tying their demand triggers from the front end to their backend operation is tremendously efficient and delivers value that we've never believed before I mean I I don't you're not as old as I am but I I would never have thought that I could order something online and have it show up on my doorstep the next day right that's like a miracle but we now expect that but so many Enterprises in the world today they have two we lead times to fulfill an order within their own internal operations their Logistics programs are still Antiquated and they and they don't have a way to upgrade them to that kind of modern expectation so the cios I talk to the CEOs I talk to at our customers are desperate to get those demand triggers in real time to the edge and get data from The Edge to to their customers of where their things are and how they're going to be delivered and they just haven't found a good solution that rolls in a cost- effective way that has the intelligence that they want that we're seeing in the commercial world and so we hope to be the one to bring it to them uh we know there's others of course trying to get there but we think we have a unique ability to get there first another important thing for our investors is always about the financials and how the company is run to um are you finding success already at this early stage of your company I believe you said you're about three years into development yes that's right so that the financials are always difficult I mean we are basically pre-revenue as a SAS company so although we've had some Revenue uh we've had a lot of seed funding um having gathered more than $7 million in seed as we've gone them to the stage and then also gone off of um various grants and research programs we've done that's been the primary source of our funding but um as we build our our SAS model and we're a bit of a hybrid where we have SAS and and Hardware what's wonderful coming to this stage is we have a backlog for our Hardware orders coming in from our transactional side and on the SAS side we have a base of Lighthouse customers that are now growing exponentially as they add more sites and add more applications and so the foundation for growth is there and the customer pickup is there uh but our funding so far has been more pre-revenue type activities that you'd see in a typical Tech startup well and you do have a new partnership with shoulder up tell us what that means for your company yeah shoulder up is our sponsor as we work through this go public uh exercise uh shoulder up is a fantastic uh group that we've enjoyed working with they have deep ties in the military um I probably should have explained earlier that in our our initial start some of our early customers were military uh projects we uh were awarded several SB programs we demonstrated Logistics applications within military and they continue to be an important sector um so schrop has really helped us open more doors there and there's a huge part of our business that's that's focused there um our Factory in Puerto Rico allows us to do made in America development of our Hardware in a way that most of our competitors are sourcing from China and from countries that are not going to allow them to be in those government areas so shoulder up helps us uh open that important door shoulder up is already a a spack company that can help us also take us public and that's been helpful um so U they're not just a transactional partner they're a partner go forward that's going to help us develop our markets that we're targeting they have really good contacts in the areas that we're we're moving forward on so if it's a retail investor who's watching this right now you can't quite find your company right now to invest in but when and how will they be able to find you if they're interest in being an early investor all right so the first thing I would say is look for us on our public disclosures we have filed our initial S4s and those are available if you search for us uh you should know that our current name we're listed under is CID Inc that's uh we we're transitioning the corporation as part of this uh company transition so if you search on the the SEC disclosures under CID Inc you'll see our current S4 which is all of our financial filings as well as the company um go forward plans in terms of being a investor um as we're in this stage um we're we're working with our sponsors with through institutionalsales will be funneled into that group so you would contact me or my CFO Charlie Maddox and we would uh bring you into our our institutional pipeline Group Well thank you so much for your time today is there anything else about your company that you'd like to share you've said a few different times um about what makes you so excited about this company compared to others you've been at and that's a question I love to ask is just Why as the CEO of this company are you excited about what you are offering atai oh goodness there's so many reasons um it always starts with the people I have an exceptional management team and it's been such a joy to work with them and to have them so confident in each of their areas the Departments we set up the people we' started to attract it's been wonderful to build a team and and that's always the Great Joy but the second part that we're seeing the adoption we are um I think we've hit the timing really really well uh it's a time where AI is is emerging and it needs to be applied to more use cases we're seeing it being applied in our our normal lives but Logistics and supply chain and and asset management generally is pretty old school there's a lot of paper and clipboard out there still there's a lot of manual barcode scanning and labeling and um it's a rich field for this technology to be applied um it's a complex field no one person can manage a multi-layered supply chain and get everything to the right place at the right time uh AI is a tremendous aid for that and and I think everyone's seeing that because they're more comfortable with AI in their private life so it's a combination of the timing our technology hitting the market at the right time it's solving a real problem that's a multi-trillion dollar problem and I've got the best team I've ever had in a in a company to tackle it so I'm excited about that that is something to be excited about thank you again Ed so much for your time today and for sharing a little bit more about your company with our investors you can check out the article we have on marketbeat.com with more details about this company and many others as always thank you for joining us here on marketbeat media and happy investing [Music]

NASDAQ we hope by the end of the year we're working our way through that we've been going through the various filings and compliance uh but we're on schedule for you know an endof year transition to that public company we need that cash to really Finance the growth that we're seeing we've already started with some Lighthouse customers that are very large multinational billion dollar corporations multi-billion dollar corporations that want to base their systems on our technology and so we've done initial Pilots we've started working through initial sites but uh this explosive growth needs to be funded as we go International uh we'll be founding more locations in Europe in particular as well as southeast Asia and um we'll be advancing a lot of our Channel programs through that that funding the technology we do needs a lot of work as well I mean we've got our base system working but there's so much to be done with AI and with uh image processing that we're working with some of our chip developments we've done with our patented passive microwave technology that this go public move is a chance to give us the rocket fuel we need to really take the system into a new generation of of performance as well as support uh for our customers around the world there's so much conversation around the world about Ai and so many new companies like yours popping up because of the new developments in AI let's talk about competition in this field a little bit are there other competitors out there who are doing something similar to what you're doing or are you really unique in this space well everyone's going to tell you they think they're unique but I've got a a long history I've worked for decades in the RFID and Auto ID business um and so I understand the systems that are there now and I guess I can boil this downbridge into two problems so applying AI to Logistics is relatively easy because AI engines are now available and the technology become more and more refined but the difficulty in applying I Logistics is the data isn't there it's very difficult and expensive to get data from all these things that move today we hire a lot of operators do barcode scanning where you put very expensive portals or infrastructured antennas up and that doesn't give us the richness of data you really need to drive an intelligent AI implementation what's unique about us is that we're not just an RFID company supplying the RFID we're we're marrying it with the vision systems and the AI backend that allows that data to be useful in the workflow so the combination of having the AI software as well as a really Unique Edge data collection system is what lets us develop value or deliver value that other companies really can't we find a lot of our competitors are kind of one trick ponies that are focused either on the software or on the data collection system but they struggle to get the both married together into a way that adds the value and maybe I can elaborate on one part of that so when you think about Edge collection uh Edge data collection um we think often about either a manual process like barcode scanning or we think about a very expensive of infrastructure like portals you know antennas that are scanning through pinch points um what we've developed is is something that you could think of like an Apple Air tag where an iPhone that's traveling through an Enterprise can pick up your air tag and report its location we've developed mobile readers that are battery powered that can go on your pallets on your forklifts on your totes and as it goes through your Enterprise it picks up these other tags and these other items um very seamlessly very inexpensively without having an engineer on site that has to put that together that's what's kind of unique about our data collection system uh and then on the software side having people that are experienced in this industry I've spent a career in this industry um many of my my sea- Lev team are from that side we've done an implementation I think that is really unique in the AI uh using not just the RF uh data capture capability but also the the vision systems that we overlay with it so um it's really kind of a an exciting and unique way that we've created a way to dynamically gather this data and then make it meaningful to an operator to get my things to the right place they're having unreliability in the things but I think the other part is they're being driven by fear that the big retailers like Amazon Walmart have shown that tying their demand triggers from the front end to their backend operation is tremendously efficient and delivers value that we've never believed before I mean I I don't you're not as old as I am but I I would never have thought that I could order something online and have it show up on my doorstep the next day right that's like a miracle but we now expect that but so many Enterprises in the world today they have two we lead times to fulfill an order within their own internal operations their Logistics programs are still Antiquated and they and they don't have a way to upgrade them to that kind of modern expectation so the cios I talk to the CEOs I talk to at our customers are desperate to get those demand triggers in real time to the edge and get data from The Edge to to their customers of where their things are and how they're going to be delivered and they just haven't found a good solution that rolls in a cost- effective way that has the intelligence that they want that we're seeing in the commercial world and so we hope to be the one to bring it to them uh we know there's others of course trying to get there but we think we have a unique ability to get there first another important thing for our investors is always about the financials and how the company is run to um are you finding success already at this early stage of your company I believe you said you're about three years into development yes that's right so that the financials are always difficult I mean we are basically pre-revenue as a SAS company so although we've had some Revenue uh we've had a lot of seed funding um having gathered more than $7 million in seed as we've gone them to the stage and then also gone off of um various grants and research programs we've done that's been the primary source of our funding but um as we build our our SAS model and we're a bit of a hybrid where we have SAS and and Hardware what's wonderful coming to this stage is we have a backlog for our Hardware orders coming in from our transactional side and on the SAS side we have a base of Lighthouse customers that are now growing exponentially as they add more sites and add more applications and so the foundation for growth is there and the customer pickup is there uh but our funding so far has been more pre-revenue type activities that you'd see in a typical Tech startup well and you do have a new partnership with shoulder up tell us what that means for your company yeah shoulder up is our sponsor as we work through this go public uh exercise uh shoulder up is a fantastic uh group that we've enjoyed working with they have deep ties in the military um I probably should have explained earlier that in our our initial start some of our early customers were military uh projects we uh were awarded several SB programs we demonstrated Logistics applications within military and they continue to be an important sector um so schrop has really helped us open more doors there and there's a huge part of our business that's that's focused there um our Factory in Puerto Rico allows us to do made in America development of our Hardware in a way that most of our competitors are sourcing from China and from countries that are not going to allow them to be in those government areas so shoulder up helps us uh open that important door shoulder up is already a a spack company that can help us also take us public and that's been helpful um so U they're not just a transactional partner they're a partner go forward that's going to help us develop our markets that we're targeting they have really good contacts in the areas that we're we're moving forward on so if it's a retail investor who's watching this right now you can't quite find your company right now to invest in but when and how will they be able to find you if they're interest in being an early investor all right so the first thing I would say is look for us on our public disclosures we have filed our initial S4s and those are available if you search for us uh you should know that our current name we're listed under is CID Inc that's uh we we're transitioning the corporation as part of this uh company transition so if you search on the the SEC disclosures under CID Inc you'll see our current S4 which is all of our financial filings as well as the company um go forward plans in terms of being a investor um as we're in this stage um we're we're working with our sponsors with through institutionalsales will be funneled into that group so you would contact me or my CFO Charlie Maddox and we would uh bring you into our our institutional pipeline Group Well thank you so much for your time today is there anything else about your company that you'd like to share you've said a few different times um about what makes you so excited about this company compared to others you've been at and that's a question I love to ask is just Why as the CEO of this company are you excited about what you are offering atai oh goodness there's so many reasons um it always starts with the people I have an exceptional management team and it's been such a joy to work with them and to have them so confident in each of their areas the Departments we set up the people we' started to attract it's been wonderful to build a team and and that's always the Great Joy but the second part that we're seeing the adoption we are um I think we've hit the timing really really well uh it's a time where AI is is emerging and it needs to be applied to more use cases we're seeing it being applied in our our normal lives but Logistics and supply chain and and asset management generally is pretty old school there's a lot of paper and clipboard out there still there's a lot of manual barcode scanning and labeling and um it's a rich field for this technology to be applied um it's a complex field no one person can manage a multi-layered supply chain and get everything to the right place at the right time uh AI is a tremendous aid for that and and I think everyone's seeing that because they're more comfortable with AI in their private life so it's a combination of the timing our technology hitting the market at the right time it's solving a real problem that's a multi-trillion dollar problem and I've got the best team I've ever had in a in a company to tackle it so I'm excited about that that is something to be excited about thank you again Ed so much for your time today and for sharing a little bit more about your company with our investors you can check out the article we have on marketbeat.com with more details about this company and many others as always thank you for joining us here on marketbeat media and happy investing [Music]

title: Massive Market Moves Following Trump Win: Tesla, JP Morgan, & Bitcoin Soar
text: Kind: captions Language: en the Market's reacting to a trump victory in a big way today here to break down some of the biggest moves of the market is Market beat analyst Thomas Hughes Thomas we saw quite a few swings today start with the biggest one that everyone's talking about well I think Tesla might have been the biggest move of the of the market today but I really think that's just a knee-jerk reaction because of Elon musk's association with Trump you know Trump is supposed to bring a lot of Tailwinds into the market potentially easing some other head wins and generally be good for the stock market and businesses but not so much for EVS EVS had headwinds to begin with so I don't really see Trump as a fundamental mover for Tesla and that plays into that last article I wrote that last video we did about you know buying the dips and selling the rips Tesla certainly ripped and I would not expect it to keep going much higher after this yeah did it was it up about 14% today even more than that yeah it closed the day up about 15 % that's pretty good siiz move absolutely and that was one of many moves that we saw in the market today another big move was JP Morgan why is that stock moving so much today right JP Morgan also made a big double digit move and that's just because of uh the regulatory Outlook I mean generally speaking Trump is going to be good for regulations ranging from the financial sector through consumers which is generally good for the entire economy we seeing some definite Tailwinds in regards to that help sustain JP Morgan's growth um certainly help in in invigorate the merger and acquisition Market you know so we'll see some more some more m&a and possibly some more IPOs coming up pretty soon too all right we'll move to another sector you like to talk about quite a bit and that's the Russell 2000 uh that saw quite a bit of movement today too right yeah Russell 2K stocks are jumping because of the business-friendly environment Trump is known to be a business-friendly president uh the Russell 2K also has some potential Tailwinds next year because of falling interest rates add in a business-friendly president and we should really see the the rally and stocks broaden to include a lot of these small cap names yeah do you expect the bump today is just the beginning of kind of the Boost in the Russell 2000 I think it's just the beginning I think that we're looking at a a multi-year run in stocks ahead of us all right and now let's talk about some currency out there the US dollar we've been talking about gold a lot and Bitcoin all three saw some moves today how much movement did they see well Bitcoin was another double digit mover um it's up on uh the regulatory Outlook you know it's uh been gaining traction with mainstream uh some Republicans have been very vocal about supporting Bitcoin we've got a Wyoming Senator trying to make Wyoming be a Haven for Bitcoin so Trump's win and what looks to be a pretty clean red sweep of all the both sides of the house or both both sides of Congress and the and the White House is very positive for for Bitcoin as far as gold goes it made a pretty big decline but that's looking at a stronger US economy and a stronger dollar Dollar's up because of an outlook for strengthening US economic Trends under Trump now you wrote an article today on market.com kind of talking about what a presidency under Donald Trump could look like in the stock market give us some of the highlights of what your article shares well right first just looking back on his first Administration as a kind of a benchmark of what's to come from the week of the election in 2015 through 2016 through the election through the election 2020 the stock market Rose 20 or 70% and that was driven by deregulation lower taxes and a strong labor market which was invigorated by business strength caused by reduced regulation and reduced taxes well that's his previous presidency but another Factor coming into play this year especially is the fed and inflation what do you think a trump Victory could mean for that going forward well it looks like uh Trump is going to be invigorating the economy and that will help sustain inflation as we move forward uh one offsetting factor is oil he's going to want us to be drilling for oil so lower oil prices could help contain inflation the risk really right now is that inflation won't fall as quickly as the FED is hoping and so instead of cutting rates quite as quickly as they've been forecasting the FED May pause and wait to see what happens with Trump over the next few quarters before it really gets aggressive with cutting rates any sectors you might be concerned about that might be seen more of a dip with a trump presidency some stocks you might want to take note of were healthc Care stocks um as far as the market goes most sectors and stocks were up following the election but the health care sector was notably down many of those stocks were in the red so just keep Ane out for those all right some great information Thomas and a lot to talk about today I'm sure going to be plenty of Market moves to talk about over the next few weeks and months too thank you for your time today Thomas and thank you for joining us stay tuned to Market beat for more coverage of this Market move and many more to come as always thanks for watching and happy investing [Music]

and then even higher into 2025 and there's reasons for that I don't want to get into all of them right now but basically we're getting into the idea of as long as Government continues to spend there's familiar with it because they are consumers as well and many are Gamers as well and so you know Nintendo for the Nintendo Universe the fun characters Super Mario Zelda all that so here's the thesis for owning the stock right now Nintendo introduced the switch about seven years ago I think it was 2018 2019 in that time frame they're due to uh launch a new version of the platform the company has quite as well as investors or analysts might be expecting you see them I I can't think of one just right off the top of my head but yes that's always the risk in stocks like this the risk for Nintendo I think is not so much that the switch platform is not going to be accepted by consumers I think the risk might be that the launch gets delayed I believe it's already been delayed uh uh by about three months I think their original plan was to have it out for the holiday season this year and they had to push that back so there's always that risk that comes with it but I think in the case of Nintendo I don't think analysts have to be that or investors have to be that worried about the platform not being accepted by consumers the from what I've been hearing the Gaming Community is very very interested in in the new Switch platform coming out well and getting in on this stock at around that $13 mark it sounds like a pretty good entry point for sure let's move on to your final pick in the series and this is a topic that everyone's been talking about recently and that's gold it seems like you can't even turn on any financial news anymore without hearing about gold and in many cases it's about gold making new highs almost every day it's I think over 2700 it's near a record high as we're talking today A lot of people are forecasting that it's going to go to 3,000 by the end of the year and then even higher into 2025 and there's reasons for that I don't want to get into all of them right now but basically we're getting into the idea of as long as Government continues to spend there's going to be inflationary pressures on the economy which makes gold more attractive to investors but a lot of investors don't want to invest in physical gold and there are reasons for that don't need to go into those here Barrett gold is my last pick and honestly it surprised me to see the stock was still trading under under $20 but it is it's just a shade under $20 and it's a really good investment for uh for investors who are looking to get exposure to gold gold miners tend to do well as the price of gold goes up because it makes it more profitable for them to mine that's what barra's discovering they have one of the world's oldest mines they have one of the world's most productive mines uh this is a company some sometimes you can get into mining companies that offer a lot of speculative risk you don't have any of that with baric they're a rock solid company very good financials what about the upside for this stock Chris just how high are analysts expecting this could go yeah analysts are forecasting a price target of uh a consensus price of 2467 and that's already about a 29% increase over what the Stock's closing price is and of course there are some analysts that are projecting that stock could go even higher than that so now would be a really good time if you're thinking about getting in or you're thinking boy I really should have some exposure to Gold Barrack's a good way of doing that any risk with this stock when it's so dependent on the commodity price of gold will the price of gold and whatever happens with that in the next year really impact success of baric yeah I think so and and obviously Bridget you're hitting on it there's the downside risk if gold prices were to drop especially if they were drop significantly then obviously the gold happy investing [Music]

title: Energy Vault Stock Soars 100%: CEO Shares Why in MarketBeat Exclusive
text: Kind: captions Language: en today we are excited to launch a brand new CEO series where we're talking to the heads of some companies you may not have heard of but could add some big momentum for your portfolio let's dive in today we are very excited to have Robert Picone the CEO of energy Vault with us to talk about their exciting innovation in the renewable energy field and like most companies Robert your company really started off by kind of solving a problem the industry was facing and that's storage share a little bit more about what energy Vault does sure thank you virgin pleasure to make some time here and pleasure to meet you we focus on energy storage and we're founded with a mission around broadly decarbonization but very specific to solving a problem around the intermittency of wind and solar uh and enabling essentially what's intermittent power resources uh solar when the Sun shining wind when the wind is blowing and storing that energy um to be discharged uh at times when there's high demand so we look at providing uh economic and sustainable energy storage solutions uh and we can provide them uh in a mechanism and through a software platform to integrate various terms of Technology uh because there is no let's say Silver Bullet there's different applications and use cases and different technologies have different econ e omic profiles to solve those so we um utilize a very sophisticated energy management system and software platform to be able to deliver our own proprietary energy storage solutions as well as integrate other energy storage Solutions in the market yeah you are a company that's also built on AI or at least utilizing it talk about what sets energy vaults Storage Solutions apart from maybe some other competitors in this field I think one thing that's very unique about us versus any other provider is is we do support multiple durations and multiple Technologies so most energy storage companies will focus on for example lithium ion and the short duration Market of two to four hours others uh have developed long duration Technologies like like we have that's focused on eight hours to 12 hours um and even others are looking at developing much longer term even 100h hour batteries for example for longer or Ultra long duration so what's unique about energy vault is that we um develop solutions to serve all of those markets through the development of our Innovative software platform so um that's something that is unique to us and and something that also allows us to be a stronger partner of various customer sets whether that be Public Utilities uh that can be independent power providers or even um can be large industrial energy users um because we can sit with them understand what problem they're trying to solve and match the appropriate technology to it and deliver it and deliver that uh availability of power and we guarantee that through our software platform um so I'd say that's a primary differentiator um and I I think another secondary differentiator for us is we've been in the market now across many regions of the world in in deploying projects so in the US market in the China Market with our gravity solution which is long duration we've gotten started in Australia and just announced a full gigawatt Hour project for example uh just uh one week ago it's a very interesting for us because we have a definitely a global view on what's Happening and have even announced um licensed deals with our long duration gravity technology in 16 uh states in South Africa um for example uh and just to complete the circle we just announced with petross in Brazil at our last earnings a first gravity system for long duration there so I think this second area of both being Global um and and actually implementing projects and delivering projects as a young company is uh also sets us apart absolutely definitely finding success across the globe that announcement with Australia partnership last week help to boost your stock price a little bit but I think our investors are definitely interested in hearing about the long-term commercialization plans what is it going to take to get these products in more countries what's your plan as a company for that it's it's the right question question Bridget especially for investors uh because we uh in our first year of Revenue at 148 million so delivered pretty much right on what we said in our plan we had a a a nice second year where we more than double that growth um so we did almost almost 4 170 million in our first two years and have guided this next two years meaning this year and the next year at 500 to 700 million another large growth but I think investors really want to see that backlog fill up of projects hence to your point of the one gwatt hour in Australia which we bounced at $350 million us plus uh as a as a single project um I think investors want to see that show up in the backlog formally now as we progress so they can get visibility into just the execution of those projects which will generate that revenue and also deliver on what we've also formally guided we did this at our first analyst and investor day uh in May earlier this year but we also guided on being ful year cash flow neida positive uh in what would be our third full calendar year having revenue and and as a public company so that's a a nice growth profile I think for us to have and and to get and Achieve that uh here in our third um third year which will be next year in 2025 uh and and just seeing these announcements now come is what's driving some of that recent uptick in the in the stock because there's that confidence now that uh investors to enter when it becomes now just a matter of just execution of projects and that's one thing we've been very good at and and also done them very quickly and with quality across the board we delivered over a gigawatt hour in in 2023 and have um more projects now that we'll be delivering and uh and those have gone very well yeah you're just a couple weeks ahead of your next earnings reports will there be more project announcements coming or anything you can give a sneak peek to some of our investors yeah we're in a blackout period right now here before our earnings which which are coming up on uh on the 12th of November it's about a week later this year due to the due to the election but you know generally we'll be giving updates on uh on projects as well as on our guidance for the remaining part of the year now that we're going to be approaching almost mid November so we've got pretty good visibility into where we're going to be and um and we'll see also what we're going to be saying about the next year typically we do our Q4 earnings in February later later in February where we would then give our formal guidance on a on an annual basis uh but uh I think we'll be able to talk about what these recent deals that we're announcing um will mean in terms of our plan for next year so we're looking looking forward to that let's go a little broader and talk about your industry as a whole what kind of growth opportunities and demand are we seeing in the energy storage industry yeah well it's it's large just and uh and large because of the the new Renewables that are becoming more and more part of the grid and therefore the need to complement that with storage it's large because some countries like the United States have put in place incentives to be able to apply not only as historically to wind and solar on projects but now to storage via investment tax credits but also other incentives that was put in place under the inflation reduction Act that um sought to incent localized or domestic content as well as incenting uh investment in communities where the uh the the employment may be lower than other communities and therefore around job creation so I think that's another um uh impetus that we're seeing and and other countries have followed suit to that and then generally the third thing I'd mention here which is very topical now especially in the US and and now becoming topical in other parts the world I I I met with the the minister uh in Victoria the minister of energy there in Australia about this uh topic of the hyperscalers and the demand on Power and what's happening not only with generative AI I know that's getting a lot of the focus for the data center growth but actually a lot of that growth in need is coming from a lot of the applications now being developed natively for the cloud so you combine those factors and and you know the US specifically it's it's a very difficult lineup power uh now and you've seen some of the headlines so I think this this third area of growth is just around um also the need for storage to complement renewable as a power source um that's going to be serving this tremendous growth and power demand from the hyperscalers yeah getting more energy to the grid is a constant topic we cover here because it affects so many companies and especially the growth in many many profitable companies out there right now let's talk about a little bit more just about the risks that are in this industry we're hearing a lot about nuclear power and some of those big data centers partnering and turning towards nuclear are there any other factors like that that could impact the future of renewable energy and storage that you provide yeah sure certainly uh I think given that power demand a lot of the the larger companies the the so-called Magna companies so ma Microsoft Apple um you know Google or alphabet and and the larger groups and hyperscalers um they are looking at clean ways to meet that demand and having the large balance sheets they have to invest um you know interestingly what Microsoft did my Island um you know these are things I think two years ago we would just have never foreseen I'd say even a year ago they were um you know we we just recently I I think this year have seen this this massive uptick in in power demand so I think all of those things will have an impact on our ability to meet the Power demand and uh what I can share is that from from our perspective I think meeting that with clean energy is fundamental um uh there is um this push in just securing any power including you know a lot of the natural gas because it is abundant in the country and uh of course that's fossil driven so I think there's a a balance here that um is going to have to be struck uh here so we don't start heating the planet up at a at a very steep rate again and that's going to be solved through a combination of Technology some we see today by the way bridgid and some are coming uh getting some of the carbon capture Technologies deployed for example the advancements in energy transmission meaning to reduce the the loss of that over over long distances uh and having certain parts of the world where there's abundant solar be able to serve through this distribution other parts of the world where there's that demand a lot of things you know evolving here it's a very evolving industry for sure now Rob I wanted to ask this question you've been a part of a lot of Fortune 5 or Fortune 100 companies out there what makes you excited specifically about helping to lead energy vault in this season where there's all kinds of developments in the world of energy yeah well I think anytime you work and have worked for a larger company uh by n just by definition of its size typically they're Global uh so I would say say uh you know that experience that I had in working early on in my career which I started actually in oil and gas and then in the later 90s uh as this little thing called the internet took off got into networking and and software and security and in various companies along the way and seeing how that technology how it evolved and the impact it had in um how businesses were run and how fundamental economics were achieved and how efficiencies were gained and to see that manifest itself in different regions of the world that that absolutely those experiences have supported what we're doing here at energy Vault from the very beginning and this has been a this has been such a um you know such an amazing experience for me having started being one of a few people to start this company is a Founder uh with Bill gross from IDE lab so out of Pasadena based IDE lab and then to build it through the rounds of funding and taking it public and just the Dynamics of the last you know three to four years having something like Co that that sort of brought the world to its knees at one point uh and then coming out of that with a a focus again on on Renewables and and getting those deployed and and the Dynamics we have today it's uh been a fascinating experience but for sure I'm I'm most excited about the potential impact that we can have as a company uh on on the world and the global Dynamics and around renewable storage um and supporting um you know supporting sustainable ways to make the clean energy transition good I think there's plenty of investors out there who care about the renewable energy sources and want to invest in that now we do have other investors who are all about the dollars and the numbers and that balance sheet um what are some facts about the company and the way it's being run financially that you're proud of that you think investors would be interested to hear yeah I think right off the bat I I'd say that we've um managed our investors cash well meaning uh we've built the company and have taken actions to also have a very efficient cost structure proactively um we've not put any debt on the company so we're debt-free uh which makes it um you know uh I think from a management perspective you can uh have that cash to plan for growth as we've been and that's shown up in the fact that we're investing in projects and owning them so we aren't building things and then just flipping them um to to have a some immediate payback which is um you know might be a little smaller from a pure percentage or or margin perspective we're holding attractive assets on our balance sheet investing in them because the returns are much higher over the long term and investors will like that because we're going to have predictable much more predictable cash flows and streams uh versus relying on um a Project based business that can be sort of lumpy quarter to quarter so typically especially is a public company um you know that that lumpiness and those Dynamics quarter to quarter can be difficult for some investors um you know predictability reliability of those cash fls becomes very important so I say the fact that we've managed the cash well uh no debt in the company have not done any dilutive financings um so a lot of companies were sort of forced to do that given just the capital Dynamics uh and um and these are all things I think as we've evolved the company that that investors um app appreciate and will appreciate uh and finally just the aspect of we've able to develop a solution that can adapt to the changes in the market very quickly with software meaning uh if we would have developed just a single product for example and the market shifts like in long duration things moved out a little bit um if we didn't have a platform that could adapt and allow us to deliver what customers wanted in short duration um you know we had a we would have had a much different type of growth path so I think that that Innovation and flexibility and what we've built into our software um means there's more diversification for investors that invest in our company because of our unique ability to meet different technology and durations in energy storage that flexibility and Innovation is already capturing attention of some big companies including that big $350 million deal you got in Australia we saw lots of news coverage of that this October what does that mean and for your future as energy belt yeah I just spent a great week there and was in Melbourne um where they had their all energy conference which is their largest one there and what a amazing opportunity there is there and amazing Investments being there and supported by the local governments um given that the demand and the renewable buildout that's taking place so uh we were very excited to participate not only in the conference but we met with our local teams and brought a lot of our Global Executives there to look at um all the growth that that we see and we just announced our first project last May in Australia a 400 megawatt hour with a um a group called Ain uh and then just announced this second project a full gigawatt hour and just you know so much opportunity there and working in that case with a an earlier stage developer and you get those insights into a set of assets and and platform builds uh and to get involved early gives you that insight and ability to I think plan and and meet those customer needs and and make the announcements like we did so we see a tremendous opportunity there and we'll be um spending more time in building and and growing are actually going to be tripling the size of our team there um over the next 12 months given all the opportunity so so very excited about um participating in that market which is going to be um our most important Market in particular in terms of growth over the next few years well aome very exciting things to be watching in the future and we will continue to watch it right here at Market beat thank you so much for joining us today Rob we really appreciate you sharing more about energy Vault and a little bit about the company's future with our investors and thank you viewers for tuning in to watch the conversation today you can find many more videos with similar content featuring different companies and stocks you may not have heard of right here on our Channel marketbeat media thanks again for joining us and as always happy investing [Music]

companies Robert your company really started off by kind of solving a problem the industry was facing and that's storage share a little bit more about what energy Vault does sure thank you virgin pleasure to make some time here and pleasure to meet you we focus on energy storage and we're founded with a mission around broadly decarbonization but very specific to solving a problem around the intermittency of wind and solar uh and enabling essentially what's intermittent power resources uh solar when the Sun shining wind when the wind is blowing and storing that energy um to be discharged uh at times when there's high demand so we look at providing uh economic and sustainable energy storage solutions uh and we can provide them uh in a mechanism and through a software platform to integrate various terms of Technology uh because there is no let's say Silver Bullet there's different applications and use cases and different technologies have different econ e omic profiles to solve those so we um utilize a very sophisticated energy management system and software platform to be able to deliver our own proprietary energy storage solutions as well as integrate other energy storage Solutions in the market yeah you are a company that's also built on AI or at least utilizing it talk about what sets energy vaults Storage Solutions apart from maybe some other competitors in this field I think one thing that's very unique about us versus any other provider is is we do support multiple durations and multiple Technologies so most energy storage companies will focus on for example lithium ion and the short duration Market of two to four hours others uh have developed long duration Technologies like like we have that's focused on eight hours to 12 hours um and even others are looking at developing much longer term even 100h hour batteries for example for longer or Ultra long duration so what's unique about energy vault is that we um develop solutions to serve all of those markets through the development of our Innovative software platform so um that's something that is unique to us and and something that also allows us to be a stronger partner of various customer sets whether that be Public Utilities uh that can be independent power providers or even um can be large industrial energy users um because we can sit with them understand what problem they're trying to solve and match the appropriate technology to it and deliver it and deliver that uh availability of power and we guarantee that through our software platform um so I'd say that's a primary differentiator um and I I think another secondary differentiator for us is we've been in the market now across many regions of the world in in deploying projects so in the US market in the China Market with our gravity solution which is long duration we've gotten started in Australia and just announced a full gigawatt Hour project for example uh just uh one week ago it's a very interesting for us because we have a definitely a global view on what's Happening and have even announced um licensed deals with our long duration gravity technology in 16 uh states in South Africa um for example uh and just to complete the circle we just announced with petross in Brazil at our last earnings a first gravity system for long duration there so I think this second area of both being Global um and and actually implementing projects and delivering projects as a young company is uh also sets us apart absolutely definitely finding success across the globe that announcement with Australia partnership last week help to boost your stock price a little bit but I think our investors are definitely interested in hearing about the long-term commercialization plans what is it going to take to get these products in more countries what's your plan as a company for that it's it's the right question question Bridget especially for investors uh because we uh in our first year of Revenue at 148 million so delivered pretty much right on what we said in our plan we had a a a nice second year where we more than double that growth um so we did almost almost 4 170 million in our first two years and have guided this next two years meaning this year and the next year at 500 to 700 million another large growth but I think investors really want to see that backlog fill up of projects hence to your point of the one gwatt hour in Australia which we bounced at $350 million us plus uh as a as a single project um I think investors want to see that show up in the backlog formally now as we progress so they can get visibility into just the execution of those projects which will generate that revenue and also deliver on what we've also formally guided we did this at our first analyst and investor day uh in May earlier this year but we also guided on being ful year cash flow neida positive uh in what would be our third full calendar year having revenue and and as a public company so that's a a nice growth profile I think for us to have and and to get and Achieve that uh here in our third um third year which will be next year in 2025 uh and and just seeing these announcements now come is what's driving some of that recent uptick in the in the stock because there's that confidence now that uh investors to enter when it becomes now just a matter of just execution of projects and that's one thing we've been very good at and and also done them very quickly and with quality across the board we delivered over a gigawatt hour in in 2023 and have um more projects now that we'll be delivering and uh and those have gone very well yeah you're just a couple weeks ahead of your next earnings reports will there be more project announcements coming or anything you can give a sneak peek to some of our investors yeah we're in a blackout period right now here before our earnings which which are coming up on uh on the 12th of November it's about a week later this year due to the due to the election but you know generally we'll be giving updates on uh on projects as well as on our guidance for the remaining part of the year now that we're going to be approaching almost mid November so we've got pretty good visibility into where we're going to be and um and we'll see also what we're going to be saying about the next year typically we do our Q4 earnings in February later later in February where we would then give our formal guidance on a on an annual basis uh but uh I think we'll be able to talk about what these recent deals that we're announcing um will mean in terms of our plan for next year so we're looking looking forward to that let's go a little broader and talk about your industry as a whole what kind of growth opportunities and demand are we seeing in the energy storage industry yeah well it's it's large just and uh and large because of the the new Renewables that are becoming more and more part of the grid and therefore the need to complement that with storage it's large because some countries like the United States have put in place incentives to be able to apply not only as historically to wind and solar on projects but now to storage via investment tax credits but also other incentives that was put in place under the inflation reduction Act that um sought to incent localized or domestic content as well as incenting uh investment in communities where the uh the the employment may be lower than other communities and therefore around job creation so I think that's another um uh impetus that we're seeing and and other countries have followed suit to that and then generally the third thing I'd mention here which is very topical now especially in the US and and now becoming topical in other parts the world I I I met with the the minister uh in Victoria the minister of energy there in Australia about this uh topic of the hyperscalers and the demand on Power and what's happening not only with generative AI I know that's getting a lot of the focus for the data center growth but actually a lot of that growth in need is coming from a lot of the applications now being developed natively for the cloud so you combine those factors and and you know the US specifically it's it's a very difficult lineup power uh now and you've seen some of the headlines so I think this this third area of growth is just around um also the need for storage to complement renewable as a power source um that's going to be serving this tremendous growth and power demand from the hyperscalers yeah getting more energy to the grid is a constant topic we cover here because it affects so many companies and especially the growth in many many profitable companies out there right now let's talk about a little bit more just about the risks that are in this industry we're hearing a lot about nuclear power and some of those big data centers partnering and turning towards nuclear are there any other factors like that that could impact the future of renewable energy and storage that you provide yeah sure certainly uh I think given that power demand a lot of the the larger companies the the so-called Magna companies so ma Microsoft Apple um you know Google or alphabet and and the larger groups and hyperscalers um they are looking at clean ways to meet that demand and having the large balance sheets they have to invest um you know interestingly what Microsoft did my Island um you know these are things I think two years ago we would just have never foreseen I'd say even a year ago they were um you know we we just recently I I think this year have seen this this massive uptick in in power demand so I think all of those things will have an impact on our ability to meet the Power demand and uh what I can share is that from from our perspective I think meeting that with clean energy is fundamental um uh there is um this push in just securing any power including you know a lot of the natural gas because it is abundant in the country and uh of course that's fossil driven so I think there's a a balance here that um is going to have to be struck uh here so we don't start heating the planet up at a at a very steep rate again and that's going to be solved through a combination of Technology some we see today by the way bridgid and some are coming uh getting some of the carbon capture Technologies deployed for example the advancements in energy transmission meaning to reduce the the loss of that over over long distances uh and having certain parts of the world where there's abundant solar be able to serve through this distribution other parts of the world where there's that demand a lot of things you know evolving here it's a very evolving industry for sure now Rob I wanted to ask this question you've been a part of a lot of Fortune 5 or Fortune 100 companies out there what makes you excited specifically about helping to lead energy vault in this season where there's all kinds of developments in the world of energy yeah well I think anytime you work and have worked for a larger company uh by n just by definition of its size typically they're Global uh so I would say say uh you know that experience that I had in working early on in my career which I started actually in oil and gas and then in the later 90s uh as this little thing called the internet took off got into networking and and software and security and in various companies along the way and seeing how that technology how it evolved and the impact it had in um how businesses were run and how fundamental economics were achieved and how efficiencies were gained and to see that manifest itself in different regions of the world that that absolutely those experiences have supported what we're doing here at energy Vault from the very beginning and this has been a this has been such a um you know such an amazing experience for me having started being one of a few people to start this company is a Founder uh with Bill gross from IDE lab so out of Pasadena based IDE lab and then to build it through the rounds of funding and taking it public and just the Dynamics of the last you know three to four years having something like Co that that sort of brought the world to its knees at one point uh and then coming out of that with a a focus again on on Renewables and and getting those deployed and and the Dynamics we have today it's uh been a fascinating experience but for sure I'm I'm most excited about the potential impact that we can have as a company uh on on the world and the global Dynamics and around renewable storage um and supporting um you know supporting sustainable ways to make the clean energy transition good I think there's plenty of investors out there who care about the renewable energy sources and want to invest in that now we do have other investors who are all about the dollars and the numbers and that balance sheet um what are some facts about the company and the way it's being run financially that you're proud of that you think investors would be interested to hear yeah I think right off the bat I I'd say that we've um managed our investors cash well meaning uh we've built the company and have taken actions to also have a very efficient cost structure proactively um we've not put any debt on the company so we're debt-free uh which makes it um you know uh I think from a management perspective you can uh have that cash to plan for growth as we've been and that's shown up in the fact that we're investing in projects and owning them so we aren't building things and then just flipping them um to to have a some immediate payback which is um you know might be a little smaller from a pure percentage or or margin perspective we're holding attractive assets on our balance sheet investing in them because the returns are much higher over the long term and investors will like that because we're going to have predictable much more predictable cash flows and streams uh versus relying on um a Project based business that can be sort of lumpy quarter to quarter so typically especially is a public company um you know that that lumpiness and those Dynamics quarter to quarter can be difficult for some investors um you know predictability reliability of those cash fls becomes very important so I say the fact that we've managed the cash well uh no debt in the company have not done any dilutive financings um so a lot of companies were sort of forced to do that given just the capital Dynamics uh and um and these are all things I think as we've evolved the company that that investors um app appreciate and will appreciate uh and finally just the aspect of we've able to develop a solution that can adapt to the changes in the market very quickly with software meaning uh if we would have developed just a single product for example and the market shifts like in long duration things moved out a little bit um if we didn't have a platform that could adapt and allow us to deliver what customers wanted in short duration um you know we had a we would have had a much different type of growth path so I think that that Innovation and flexibility and what we've built into our software um means there's more diversification for investors that invest in our company because of our unique ability to meet different technology and durations in energy storage that flexibility and Innovation is already capturing attention of some big companies including that big $350 million deal you got in Australia we saw lots of news coverage of that this October what does that mean and for your future as energy belt yeah I just spent a great week there and was in Melbourne um where they had their all energy conference which is their largest one there and what a amazing opportunity there is there and amazing Investments being there and supported by the local governments um given that the demand and the renewable buildout that's taking place so uh we were very excited to participate not only in the conference but we met with our local teams and brought a lot of our Global Executives there to look at um all the growth that that we see and we just announced our first project last May in Australia a 400 megawatt hour with a um a group called Ain uh and then just announced this second project a full gigawatt hour and just you know so much opportunity there and working in that case with a an earlier stage developer and you get those insights into a set of assets and and platform builds uh and to get involved early gives you that insight and ability to I think plan and and meet those customer needs and and make the announcements like we did so we see a tremendous opportunity there and we'll be um spending more time in building and and growing are actually going to be tripling the size of our team there um over the next 12 months given all the opportunity so so very excited about um participating in that market which is going to be um our most important Market in particular in terms of growth over the next few years well aome very exciting things to be watching in the future and we will continue to watch it right here at Market beat thank you so much for joining us today Rob we really appreciate you sharing more about energy Vault and a little bit about the company's future with our investors and thank you viewers for tuning in to watch the conversation today you can find many more videos with similar content featuring different companies and stocks you may not have heard of right here on our Channel marketbeat media thanks again for joining us and as always happy investing [Music]
