title: Market Shifts After Election: What Stocks Could Benefit Most?
text: Kind: captions Language: en we've heard a lot about sector rotation in the second half of 2024 but even more rotation could be underway after next week's election let's dive in today we have Jeffrey Beerman here to help walk investors through how to navigate potential rotations that could still be coming yet this year Jeffrey is a finance professor at lyola University Chicago and the chief Market technician at theot trade Jeff we are so excited to have you here at Market be media today I'm just as excited to be here I've heard a lot of good things about Market beat so oh good we know you have plenty of knowledge to share with our viewers here today too we're going to share some of your picks and where you think sector rotation could be headed no matter who wins the election we'll share your stock picks in just a little bit but first let's start out with the basics what exactly is sector rotation the just behind it is just is just this is that there are 11 different sectors in the economy or 11 different sectors that drive the S&P 500 Index some carry more weight than the others nevertheless the 11 sectors represent areas of the economy in the economic cycle so for instance you've got the economic cycle will Peak it will trough on the way up growth sectors tend to take off so stocks like you know Financial stocks will take off housing stocks will take off uh caterpillar deer cyclical stocks will take off but as the economy starts to moderate money will then shift from one sector to another sector based upon where you stand in the economy so the idea is the sector rotation is a leading indicator that moves about one step ahead or three months ahead of the actual economy so if you actually watch the market Bridget and you see money moving from let's say technology and you're like oh it's going to oil it's a signal that we're moving from one phase of the economy to another phase of the economy but here's the thing they don't always move in Step the same time they used to do historically there's been kind of a hiccup in between where some sectors will correlate and all of a sudden it's like they're not supposed to correlate and they do and then they break apart but sector rotation has primarily driven the market since about July yeah did we see any kind of sector rotation come into play with the Fed rate cuts that we saw earlier this fall too we actually did that fed Ray cut Juiced the small caps like the Russell went nuts and it should go nuts because higher interest rates are not good for small caps large caps can tolerate higher interest rates small caps can't because of the discounting mechanism and the borrowing mechanism so the small caps got their juice but somehow Bridget they've kind of like they've kind of like hit a wall and just in the last month alone like November uh uh pardon me September's like the FED comes in and says we're going to cut rates we get the rat cut markets Off to the Races the problem is it's been rescinded the 50 basis point Cuts already been taken away and then some right now the long Bond the 30-year has gone from a 3 37 handle up to a 45 that means three separate 25 basis point hikes have been reins stilled by the bond market now careful on not the fed the bond market and the FED can start to make its move if it wants to but the bond market trumps the fed and those Rising rates okay are putting a kabash on the S&P in other words if the rates weren't to go up we could see the S&P above 6,000 but the S&P has hit 58 5900 Bridget eight straight days and can't break it because that interest rate is a prohibitive level and it's inflationary and if you don't believe me the housing stocks got ding this week hard yesterday it was Dr Horton the day before was KB Holmes these home builders why are these stocks falling because mortgage rates are going up and the invest and home buyers are getting off the fence and backing away saying we can't afford this right now and that's the sign of an inflationary economy that's not going to necessarily top it won't topple the market but it will put a a cap on it that's what the Market's telling you this is so interesting because a month ago maybe two months ago right after those Fed rate Cuts came in people were talking invest in housing it's going to Boom once these rate Cuts come come down um and this is kind of exactly the opposite of what many people were predicting expecting to see in the market right now um what do you say to investors who were planning one way and now we're facing something very different well I I would take it like this um you don't have to be Allin you don't have to sit there and tell me I Own 100% stocks or I'm all on the S&P it's an all or none game you don't have to do that you can take risk off the table and say hey look I'm just going to put onethird of money away you know it's okay to be wrong everybody's wrong I'm wrong every day it's just that's the nature of it it's not being wrong that matters it's how you manage your risk that matters okay so the idea here for me is if you're thinking like well interest rates are going to go back down they might just very well go back down and the FED might instigate a rate cut but you always have to approach the market as if you could be wrong think risk first reward second the rest will take care of itself I always put risk above reward only because if you manage risk you can survive forever if you can't manage risk you cannot survive forever it's like the lifeblood of how the business runs so if you if you're wrong on the way housing starts are don't fret a lot of people were a lot of the analysts are wrong my attitude is do some hedging in other words do some cross cross asset you know tactical asset allocations move a little bit of money to bonds bonds have backed off they become cheaper the yields are higher they're very competitive at 4 and a half% with the 2% on the S&P 500 dividend yield um move a little little bit of money to Gold even though Gold's at a high because gold may stay there for a while with uncertainty or if at worst case scenario rotate your money and say listen I have most of my money in Tech and financials and I've made a killing that's fine but maybe you move your money to some more defensive sectors like healthcare so there's just different ways of approaching sector rotation and sector rotation from an asset allocation perspective as well I just heard you mention planning for uncertainty and risk but we have a big shot of both of those things coming next week with the election so I want to know how could sector rotation come into play no matter who wins the election next week well if Trump wins you know one thing he's going to kick in the spending so think about this he's going to go after to build a wall down by Texas construction Home Depot Lowe's caterpillar deer heavy machinery cyclicals in that sector you're you're going to start to see a lot of contractual work be hired there's Jacobs engineering there's all kinds of like you know construction service companies large cap Mega caps that's one area you should investigate if Trump wins because he's going to spend and you know he's going to spend the second is he's going to spend like crazy on defense he is not going to let this war go run a muck the Biden Administration has cut back defense spending he's going to ramp it up so you might start looking at rathon General Dynamics lock heat Martin any one of these three stocks Mega caps defense stocks uh even cyberware malware stocks this is the place you'd want to be if Trump's going to win because he's going to pour money into those two those sectors at the same time if he does at some point not win and Cala takes that re rain and winds you have to think about what she's trying to accomplish and what she wants effectively what she wants is you know she'll say okay we have to figure out new situations for immigrants well if more immigrants are coming in more help need for health care that could be a surge in human Cardinal Health could be a surge in MC could be a surge in Lily all these companies that provide some sort of medical or service health plan to meet the needs of people who need it already and those new immigrants or people who migrate here into this country that's an area that she is probably it is probably going to get a bump from you might also get a bump from REITs and you're like well why Real Estate Investment Trust remember REITs believe it or not are the highest paying yielding asset class not not AT&T not Dominion not next era energy not the utilities it's actually reats that pay the highest and if there is a fact that you know she wants to make for hous affording for everybody what does that do it sets reat on fire because people are going to go after the home builders they're going to go after being family homes renting if they can't own and that abets the robotic um surgical devices they're experiencing some Market leading growth um in the placement of their machines but also in increased um increased um procedures and that's got a real Tailwind globally with increased approvals for procedures and its existing jurisdictions and new jurisdictions so it's just got a lot of Tailwinds going for it right now yeah Healthcare in general very popular industry and investors are taking notice especially after the earnings report that just came out this week kind of talk about what happened with the stock after that report well so the report was really good and it spurred um a 7% increase in the share price but what's really significant is that that movement confirms a larger technical signal the Stock's been rattling pretty strongly since earlier in the year um it was flying a bullish flag pattern which is just a signal of the market saying hey look at me we're getting ready to rally and then this earnings report confirmed that Outlook the stock price surged to a new high and now we're looking at probably a 20 to 30% upside from these levels that's a very bright future ahead for this stock but it's really been a great fall for this company even before the earnings report came out kind of walk us back through when they started to really go up well this stock has been in an uptrend for quite some time uh periodic rests and pauses and corrections but basically an uptrend for quite a few years driven on its growth it is a market leading um medical device company it's got um the industry leading surgical device robotic surgical device it is an AI play for AI assisted surgeries remote surgeries and it's got a lot of Tailwinds in the expanding global population deepening penetration of healthc care services and then its own placement of devices it's broadening its base it's also increasing procedure volumes so it's really building and has been building leverage for itself for quite some time what else about its Q3 title: Oracles Cloud Shift Pays Off: Will Momentum Continue?
text: Kind: captions Language: en now let's move on to your final pick of a stock that you see having a lot of momentum this winter right the last pick is Oracle oracle's only fifth on the list of most upgraded stocks but that's from being like in 25th or 35th Place earlier in the year it's certainly seen a huge boost in sentiment and that is completely tied to it shift to cloud-based Services Oracle was a legacy software provider now it's emerging as a cloud hyperscaler and critical to AI infrastructure the last report came out only a month or so ago but it was better than expected and included a new deal with AWS and that deal is critical because it means it's now got a deal with Microsoft Amazon and Google to embed its products in their Cloud which makes its products available to like 95 or 98% of all Cloud users that is a huge Tailwind for the business and certainly is an affirmation of position as an AI services and and infrastructure provider those sound like three great stock picks for some momentum ahead this winter season thanks for sharing some details on those Thomas you can find lots of videos just like this one right here on our Channel Market beat media we cover all kinds of stocks that maybe you haven't heard of or some you have heard of but could have a big upside potential still ahead check out some of our videos stay on the channel for more stock market news and as always happy investing [Music]

title: Tesla Stock Rockets 15% Post-Earnings
text: Kind: captions Language: en Tesla fans are celebrating a big boost in the stock after yesterday's earnings report here to dive into the details is Market beat analyst Thomas Hughes Thomas that stock really went up yesterday after this report yeah it it did shoot up quite remarkably I think about 15% that was uh pretty unexpected but I think the move is a lot of optimism and enthusiasm um over the margin which is you know was really good but I think that ultimately the gains will be capped for 2024 at the top of a trading range so uh investors should really be careful about chasing this Market higher yeah this is a a big reaction obviously coming out after this report let's dive into some of the things that investors are reacting to what has them excited let's start there well I think what has them excited more than anything else is the margin uh the company was able to widen its margin significantly um on lower cost and cost controls but also on a boom in selling tax credits um and in strengthen their other businesses they're growing by double digits but they're about 15% of the total so they're not going to be a significant growth driver over the next year The Core Business only grew by 2% that's like 80% slower than the rest of the industry so this is a sign of loss of market share and a serious headwind for the business that will continue to blow over the next year while it might be a while before it comes investors seem to be really excited about a couple of products specifically that Tesla has plans for coming out in the next two years right so they're expecting to launch the uh the code name model 2 the lower price models um early next year and then the Cyber cab is supposed to be real viable uh by early 2026 uh but it is questionable that either of those things will happen according to the timeline and that's just a factor that will help support the price over time but also make cap gains um in the near term as we wait to see what happens let's talk a little bit more about the Cyber cab and kind of the company's move towards automation it seemed like investors were excited to hear about that too uh hoping to kind of broaden their potential for Revenue growth in the future well right uh so in the words of Elon Musk himself this automation the Cyber cab is the company's future the Market's been expecting a model to come out in the $25,000 range and he says that's going to be unlikely because the Cyber cab is expected to cost $25,000 he doubl down saying that automation is the company's future growth trajectory So eventually once um the FSD technology becomes real viable um he expects all cars to be automated and in that World um only cyber cabs will exist because we won't need to have our own cars we can just say hey Cybercat come pick me up and they'll be one ready for you well investors who might be excited about that kind of future might be behind some of this big runup in the stock right now um let's talk about what's currently happening with Tesla and that's not the Cyber cab that's the Cyber Truck starting to see more of these all over the place talk about the profitability of that line well it's improving uh but it's it's still one of the drags on the margin but ultimately the margin news was real good they achieved their lowest cost per vehicle on on record so across the system they're doing a very good job to reduce their cost and that is really critical for the long-term uh trajectory of the stock price and the company's profitability let's get into how long you think this runup might stick around all of the the things about the company we just talked about do you think this 15% run up is sustainable is it going to go higher or are we going to see a little pullback coming soon well I think that it could go a little bit higher but the stock is trading within a well-established range it probably has about another 10% to go to hit the top of the range but I would expect to see the gains capped there um the analysts I mean they're pretty optimistic about the news they're looking towards the future as well and they have been increasing their price Target since the news was released but they didn't upgrade the stock it's still pegged at a hold and the price Target increase were pretty minimal uh they're still um within a pretty tight range and the consensus is still below the critical resistance point so I think that that is another factor that will limit the upside potential this year yeah do you think in a couple of years we might see some more swings this stock as they do move to making that more automation a reality I think that there'll be some pretty big uh price wings in Tesla but uh the thing with this company they're very successful they're on a good trajectory trory the only question is timing so I would uh I would be prepared to buy it when it dips and to sell it when it rips all right well thank you very much Thomas for coming on to talk about this stock that everyone is talking about right now this week we have more on Tesla on this channel we've covered this company lots of times so go ahead and dig into some of those other videos that we've done talking about Tesla and as always thanks for watching here at marketbeat media happy investing [Music]

finally aate to some degree yeah what exactly do the markets say about this election well there's there's actually quite a bit they say I mean there's a few aspects I would look at one of them is obviously volatility so volatility coming down just says all right the nature of the election has less uncertainty because as volatility comes down you know markets are just you know a little bit more certain about who and what the outcome could actually be now to get really specific in terms of like what the market is saying I would look a lot at the US dollar and the US dollar over the last three weeks is exploding to the upside I mean there's been like one down day uh some phenomenal moves right now though inside of that dollar market so along with the American dollar going up there's another field and that's gold that's really getting new highs right now you know what's incredible about that is it's a little bit of a cat22 usually when you see the dollar going up that's actually going to hurt some of the Commodities because they're priced in dollars gold to me it's it's rally right now it's unfortunately one of the scariest trades that I'm seeing it's inflationary there's just no question because uh the dollar the US dollar going up as dramatically as it is it should put pressure into gold meaning gold actually seeing some sell-side activity on the contrary we're actually seeing gold rally with that uh now there's constant you know the drum beat of the US debt and the uh the interest on that debt is getting louder and louder and we're seeing gold rally uh rally with it um you know frankly look the situation might not necessarily be coming to a head like you know tomorrow or a week from now but the debt situation in the United States the situation is actually coming to a head and uh it's evidence there's going to have to be something done about it but you know what is gold going to hit 3,000 before anybody starts to listen quite plausibly it's so interesting to see the dollar and gold going up at the same time very interesting combination um let's talk about another area you're talking about debt but interest rates in general we saw the First Fed rate cut in years uh what has the market done since then you know it's ironic that you mentioned that as well because it also relates back to the election if you uh if you listen to some of the uh the election the campaigns are like and interest rates are going down uh on the contrary interest rates specifically the five year the 10 year the 30- Year have actually soared higher since the FED has cut I'll mortgage even a 15year mortgage those are actually based off the 10year and uh the rates are actually soaring on them um uncomfortably so uh the speed to which it's going up and you know we haven't seen a too dramatic of an impact to a home builders yet but that's actually a trade opportunity that could be there where you know the home builders could start to actually come down but so you've got uh asset classes that don't typically trade in these correlations we're all over the place right now gold up the Dollar's up interest rates are up S&P are almost at all-time highs and elections coming up um it's not the most comfortable Marketplace it's probably one of the reasons volatility has been higher she not one of the more comfortable marketplaces that I've been in in the last you know 25 plus years all of the things you just mentioned are why a lot of investors are looking for some guidance how to you manage your own portfolios your own investments in the middle of this uncertainty so in in two very definitive sides of me so I have an investment side and then I've got a little bit more of the trader side the trader in me if I'm going to get bullish or bearish I'm going to use spreads I'm going to use spreads I because I want to mitigate the total exposure spread basically says like look if I go out and take a trade inside of Apple I know exactly what my risk is going to be you know it's it's a150 getting in here or it's a dollar getting in there I know exactly what that's going to be so I'm going to take measured just you know pokes at the marketplace looking okay for specific upside opportunities Andor downside opportunities now that would be the trader in me the investor look investment right now with snps at all-time high makes me nervous but the S&P have been continuously hitting all-time highs I am really okay avidly into what we term long short okay there are areas that for instance I own you know uh a few of the tech companies right now but I'm also heavily short for example the financials there's nothing wrong with creating short positions when I say short that means in the financials uh I use the XLF and I may actually substantiate a position okay where I'm actually short shares or okay using a deep in the money option uh to simulate a short share it's what we call a synthetic that would be for somebody like that traded inside of an IRA but in no uncertain terms like I'm just not comfortable in these markets just saying like Okay I'm going to buy the S&P 500 and uh buy and prey is is not going to be a good strategy for the foreseeable future and we've actually heard uh some of the largest banking institutions in the world just in the last 24 hours talk specifically about that that future returns for like the next decade are going to be largely mitigated due to higher volatility higher interest rates okay debt issues um this going to be a challenging time this is going to be a time where you're going to have to learn more than just throw money at the market and uh and pre that's unfortunate but that's you know what what firms like theot trade do is re-educate uh specifically around those Logics absolutely I think we've heard that from our analysts here too at Market beat that this is just the start of volatility a lot of people in the market a lot of analysts are expecting this volatility to continue um and no volatility means you can't predict it right Anything could happen and that's why we're in this uncertainty but if you were to give Traders some advice here on the next two weeks we've got an election coming up when do you see the markets reacting most when do you see the most volatile moves in the market surrounding the election you know uh ironically is I don't think we're going to hold out to the election I think we're uh you know days maybe even hours away from larger bursts of volatility coming out and uh that's specifically you know uh again once we the markets have kind of subsided like that election risk that fear starts to go away like look um there's a lot of areas that are going to get wild and wild in a hurry uh Tech being one of them I mean look there's uh you know situations where Tech may actually be in trouble in the very near term um with a republican nominee um and going back into the White House so that unto itself could actually create degrees of volatility uh moreover I mean look we have an explosive dollar right now that is going to be uh exporting inflation in a big way so um whether you you know believe what uh you know Republicans coming in there or not push that aside for a second the dollar rallying is exporting inflation so what the FED is also going to do right after the election is going to be fairly critical and they very well may not actually cut interest rates like that inflation again that that drum beat is also getting louder in this marketplace where inflation could come raging back in here and the markets could actually again come to the Assumption look if Republicans are actually nominated that clearly means inflation's actually coming back Let's uh let's actually see some sside activity to uh to markets but uh either way you want to put this this is not going to go quietly off into the night after the election like you mentioned we do have a Fed rate cut still or a Fed rate decision coming up after that too so there's more factors than just the election but do you see the volatility coming down at any point post election and when might that happen if so on the contrary I think we're actually seeing the low in volatility right now so we had a bit of a volatility Spike the last few trading sessions it backed off as we start to come closer to the election though I think it may take back off to the upside and uh after the uh in a postelection marketpl I think we're going to see considerably more volatility look um there's going to be a whole lot of chaos coming into this Marketplace the uncertainty okay of a nominee or even better than that maybe we don't have clear results for two to three weeks after the election which is even if we think we know who's going to win this okay clear and concise results okay are anything but a certainty of uh especially in today's day and age so that unto itself I mean everything that you want to look at like the deck is kind of stacked right now to see more volatility not only coming into the election but uh thereafter so let's speak more to those long-term investors as we close out today what can they do or should they be doing something to protect their Investments right now are there safer options they can do um to try and Escape some of this volatile time that we're going to have coming up in the next couple of weeks and months especially you know there's there's uh there's no shame in actually you know reducing some of the overall exposure you know the easiest hedge and hedge is risk reduction the easiest risk mitigation tactic is to actually pull like you know onethird of your Capital put it in cash for a period of time that's the great thing about being an individual investor is that you can do what you want when you want how you want um you know not like a mutual fund that has to stay fully vested okay you have the opportunity to to mitigate some of your exposure and with snps at all-time highs why not I mean what are you going to do oh if we do explode to the upside miss a little bit more put that Capital back to work a little later but there's no problem okay this business does not have to be all or none you don't have to be Allin or not you know cut your risk by oneir one half um be able to at least sleep at night because we are going to come into a bit of Chaos in this marketplace right here in the near term some very good advice no shame and being a little safer right now thank you so so much for your time today Don and you can find more of Don's And theot Trades information we'll put a link to their website right here are you working on anything special coming up soon Don absolutely actually we're uh we're definitely discussing uh volatility trading in more volatile markets this is uh does look like for foreseeable future that we're going to be in what we would term a Traders Market wonderful well thank you again and we've got that link right there for you you can find more stock market news right here on marketbeat media and as always thanks for joining us and happy investing [Music]

title: Meta Platforms Tops Most Upgraded Stocks ListHeres What to Expect
text: Kind: captions Language: en let's get to your three picks of stocks that have a lot of momentum for the Q4 of this year uh what's your first company well the first stock is meta platforms and I got these stocks off of Market beats list of most upgraded stocks and I don't call them good momentum trades simply because they're on this list but because the trends and analyst sentiment combined with the news cycle and the fundamental stories all tie in together and as far as the analysts go the analysts have been raising their estimates on meta platforms and the other stocks on this list and have lifted meta from lower down in the rankings to the number one spot so coming out of the the Q2 reporting cycle going into Q3 meta platforms is the most upgraded stock on the market uh which shows a high level of support from analysts and analyst support can be extrapolated to mean Market support because a lot of us Traders and investors are following what the analysts are doing right now they're leading meta to new all-time highs and they're still boosting their targets the earnings reporters do out end of the month are still boosting their targets um I would expect that Trend to continue meta story right now is that its year of of efficiency which started two years ago was compounded by AI improvements that have boosted user metrics and revenue metrics now we have the virtual reality story starting to come into a little bit more of a fruition with some new product releases and some technology advances I would expect the upcoming report to be very strong and to continue that momentum of analyst sentiment [Music]

title: Alphabet Gaining Momentum: Can It Reach $200 by December?
text: Kind: captions Language: en alphabet is in a year-end rally already up 10% since September but some analysts say this Tech Giant could gain another 30% by Christmas so let's start with a little bit of the elephant in the room and that is that yes this fall brought plenty of ups and downs for Google stock after reaching a new all-time high in July part of a 130% runup the stock has seen since October of 2022 alphabet then gave up more than 20% of those gains by early September now that dip was really the start of some Market rotation out of tech and AI That's when the entire magnificent 7 really saw similar pullbacks so from Trading above 191 in July to down around 148 in September many investors were starting to feel a little nervous about that Tech bubble maybe bursting but Circle back to today with a new earnings report now just a few days away analysts are buzzing about the company's potential growth and no it's not about getting more people to use Google search engine the real excitement around alphabet right now are the company's Innovations in Ai and cloud services and that's why analysts are expecting a robust Q3 and are raising their price targets accordingly the highest analyst price targets recently refreshed to $240 which would below this Stock's previous is all-time high out of the water the average analyst price Target coming in just over $200 would mean more of a mild upside but still plenty of growth potential for investors who might be looking to get into Google right now ahead of earnings in General market conditions are also playing a role in this recent runup Fresh Off The First Fed rate cut in years with another expected again in short order the entire S&P 500 is hitting new all-time highs investors in general are flocking back to growth names and companies with proven potential for significant gains alphabet absolutely fits that bill now while the Bulls point to a strong Q3 ahead the Bears do warn of some ongoing Anti-Trust investigations by the US Department of Justice alphabet CEO did acknowledge the legal challenges ahead he says the company does expect to appeal and that this legal process could take years he also stressed that much of the company's focus is on innovating technology for alphabet's future growth which he believes will make the company far more resilient in the long run that also leads to another round of headline making moves for alphabet this week Google announced a partnership with cairo's power that is part of their plan to use nuclear energy to help power the company's AI data centers it is a move other Tech Giants are also leaning towards right now as they search for sustainable sources to power all of these high consumption AI data centers but more than just these headline making moves there are also plenty of technical indicators that signal a strong upside for alphabet stock first the Stock's relative strength index is currently sitting at a 53 with a healthy reading coming in anywhere between 30 and 70 alphabet still has plenty of room to Rally it's why many investors are expecting the stock to reach new all-time highs around the $200 Mark by Christmas so what do you think I'd really be interested to hear your take it is really similar to what analysts have had to say about Nvidia stock also heading into the holiday season you can check out our most recent video for a dive into what analysts are saying about that Tech Giant too catch that video and much more right here on marketbeat media as always thanks so much for joining us and happy investing [Music]

highest analyst price targets recently refreshed to $240 which would below this Stock's previous is all-time high out of the water the average analyst price Target coming in just over $200 would mean more of a mild upside but still plenty of growth potential for investors who might be looking to get into Google right now ahead of earnings in General market conditions are also playing a role in this recent runup Fresh Off The First Fed rate cut in years with another expected again in short order the entire S&P 500 is hitting new all-time highs investors in general are flocking back to growth names and companies with proven potential for significant gains alphabet absolutely fits that bill now while the Bulls point to a strong Q3 ahead the Bears do warn of some ongoing Anti-Trust investigations by the US Department of Justice alphabet CEO did acknowledge the legal challenges ahead he says the company does expect to appeal and that this legal process could take years he also stressed that much of the company's focus is on innovating technology for alphabet's future growth which he believes will make the company far more resilient in the long run that also leads to another round of headline making moves for alphabet this week Google announced a partnership with cairo's power that is part of their plan to use nuclear energy to help power the company's AI data centers it is a move other Tech Giants are also leaning towards right now as they search for sustainable sources to power all of these high consumption AI data centers but more than just these headline making moves there are also plenty of technical indicators that signal a strong upside for alphabet stock first the Stock's relative strength index is currently sitting at a 53 with a healthy reading coming in anywhere between 30 and 70 alphabet still has plenty of room to Rally it's why many investors are expecting the stock to reach new all-time highs around the $200 Mark by Christmas so what do you think I'd really be interested to hear your take it is really similar to what analysts have had to say about Nvidia stock also heading into the holiday season you can check out our most recent video for a dive into what analysts are saying about that Tech Giant too catch that video and much more right here on marketbeat media as always thanks so much for joining us and happy investing [Music]

title: Billionaires Bet Big on Cavco and Champion Homes
text: Kind: captions Language: en the Champions at the top of the list are there others stocks or companies like Champion out there that are also getting on that more affordable housing market absolutely another one is cavco Industries symbol AS cvco and this is also one of the largest makers of manufactured homes this includes single family homes they also do RVs vacation cabins they've been doing it for 60 years again this is a story where you have home sales volume up 20% backlog up 21% but that's not yet priced into the stock which is why billionaire investors like Paul tutor Jones Ray doio and Joel greenblat have been buying the heck out of this stock those are some pretty big names you mentioned that are buying up this stock but how recently have those investors been buying up Capco Industries that's a great question I mean this is the most recent SEC filings we see that Paul tutor Ray Delio Jo Joel greenblat either owned positions and started upgrading theirs or just came in now and started massive buying of these stocks so this is all live and it's all very current within the past few months and the stock has not moved much since they started buying so this is a great entry price for investors that are interested in this kind of uh supply problem with housing and the companies that are going to solve it we talk about upside for a minute just how much upside do you think in investors could get if they're getting in now on this company I believe cavco is selling for half you know 50% below what it's worth I also believe the same thing about Sky I actually believe this is a $200 stock I mean it's selling at $93 right now but you know given the right circumstances this stock can really really really take off [Music] a

title: 3 Momentum Stock Picks With Room to Run
text: Kind: captions Language: en are you looking for some momentum in your portfolio here's three stocks that could help joining us now is Market bead analyst Thomas Hughes he has three picks for us that we're going to get to in just a little bit of stocks that are really gaining some momentum in the fourth quarter of 2024 but first Thomas let's just give a quick overview of what momentum trades are all about I would say that momentum trading is the core trading anybody that's doing directional trades especially is using momentum to their advantage and even people that are doing non-directional trading using option strategies are still using momentum to some degree and in that case possibly a lack of it so momentum trading is really foundational to all trading strategies well let's get to your three picks of stocks that have a lot of momentum for the Q4 of this year uh what's your first company well the first stock is meta platforms and I got these stocks off of Market beats list of most upgraded stocks and I don't call them good momentum trades simply because they're on this list but because the trends and analyst sentiment combin with the news cycle and the fundamental stories all tie in together and as far as the analysts go the analysts have been raising their estimates on meta platforms and the other stocks on this list and have lifted meta from lower down in the rankings to the number one spot so coming out of the the Q2 reporting cycle going into Q3 meta platforms is the the most upgraded stock on the market uh which shows a high level of support from analyst and analyst support can be extrapolated to mean Market support because a lot of us Traders and investors are following what the analysts are doing right now they're leading meta to new all-time highs and they're still boosting their targets the earnings reporter is throughout end of the month they're still boosting their targets um I would expect that Trend to continue meta story right now is that its year of of efficiency which started two years ago with is compounded by AI improvements that have boosted user metrics and revenue metrics now we have the virtual reality story starting to come into a little bit more of a fruition with some new product releases and some technology advances I would expect the upcoming report to be very strong and to continue that momentum of analyst sentiment all right so meta is your first momentum pick what's the next pick you have for a stock that could see a lot of momentum this winter uh the next pick is poo Alto networks now poo Alto Networks is in a long-term uptrend driven by analysts earlier in the year their Camus took a bit of a dip when they announced a lean into platformization that lean in the platformization included offering some free and reduced price products which impacted the outlook for revenue and earnings thereby impacting the analyst sentiment the story now though is that paloalto networks is outperforming due to strength and the cyber security um industry as well as the effects of its own efforts at platformization the analyst sentiment has shifted back towards upward revisions and they're driving the stock price higher that company also releases earnings pretty soon and I would expect it to be another good solid report extending that trend of upward revisions this stock is one of those that's gaining a lot of attention from some pretty bigname investors right that's true um one of the stories this year is the interest by Congress Palo outo networks is one of the most bought Stocks by Congress and uh Nancy the biggest whaling Congress has made couple purchases this year I see that as being supportive for the market over time let's move on to your final pick of a stock that you see having a lot of momentum this winter right the last pick is Oracle oracle's only fifth on the list of most upgraded stocks but that's from being like in 25th or 35th Place earlier in the year it's certainly seen a huge boost and sentiment and that is completely tied to it shift to cloud-based Services Oracle was a legacy software provider now it's emerging as a cloud hyperscaler and critical to AI infrastructure the last report came out only a month or so ago but it was better than expected and included a new deal with AWS that deal is critical because it means it's now got to deal with Microsoft Amazon and Google to embed its products in their Cloud which makes its products available to like 95 or 98% of all Cloud users that is a huge Tailwind for the business and certainly is an affirmation of its position as an AI services and and infrastructure provider those sound like three great stock picks for some momentum ahead this winter season thanks for sharing some details on those Thomas you can find lots of videos just like this one right here on our Channel marketbeat media we cover all kinds of stocks that maybe you haven't heard of or some you have heard of but could have a big upside potential still ahead check out some of our videos stay on the channel for more stock market news and as always happy investing [Music]

title: Champion Homes 37% Sales Surge: Time to Invest?
text: Kind: captions Language: en home prices have doubled in the past 10 years since 2014 the average income's gone up 13.8% $73,000 a year so basically home prices could do anything they want in the short term but in the long term they're based on incomes I mean think about it a morgage companies Banks going to look at your income and say okay we're going to write you a loan based on a 30-year income so no matter what they have to approximate incomes in the long term so we have a two prong problem here two ited issue here one is that housing prices have to come down the other is as you mentioned we still have demand people still want houses so what we've come to find out is that we have a supply problem there just isn't enough houses on the market and Zillow estimates that we are about four and a half million houses short of total demand now because of the inflation that we've had in the past few years a lot of folks aren't going to be buying those big three four 5,000 you know square foot mcmansions anymore they can't afford them we're going to have to there so what kind of homes can they afford so we're actually starting to now look at uh what is what size home should people who make $74,000 you know afford and that's kind of brought us to to where we are today well that all sounds like an opportunity for a company out there and also opportunity for investors who might be looking to to get in on that kind of a market uh what do you have for us today well okay so there are a few small companies that manufacture you know they call them manufactured homes they used to call Modular Homes but you know basically one of them is Champion Homes symbol is Sky it's at 9315 now this is one of the largest Builders of manufactured homes I their home H sold jumped 37% in the past year it's backlog jumped 28% earnings of 991 cents beat estimates by 21% you know ear you know I mean it's just crushing it so you see this new you know demand for these smaller houses that people can afford instead of these 3,000 4,000 5,000 square foot houses you're seeing these companies that are manufacturing 800 1500 2,000 square foot houses go Bonkers Champions right at the top of the list okay so Champion Homes definitely getting these houses affordable houses out quicker and that's something that's been heard a lot on the campaign trail from lots of different people running for office right now it's a topic that across the country everyone cares about so how is that impacting the stock well it's a great point you bring up as a matter of fact both major political candidates have talked about expanding the supply of uh single family homes on the market so that's one of the reasons a great question that Champion Homes has really been just killing it this year just absolutely killing it and as the FED keeps lowering rates they should do very very well as either candidate gets in office is going to be pushing to alleviate this uh housing Supply crisis frankly [Music]

title: NVIDIA Nears All-Time Highs: How High Can This AI Leader Climb?
text: Kind: captions Language: en Nvidia is back to near alltime highs with some predicting a breakout that could go even higher let's dive in hello and thanks for joining us here at Market beat media I'm Bridget Bennett it's a stock you've heard us talk about lots of times here on this channel but we couldn't ignore another chance to talk about the tech giant with this recent rally after some volatility over the last two months Nvidia is back on the rise and remains a Top Choice for most investors we're going to get into why this stock is rallying right now and how far analysts think this Nvidia breakout could go but first here's a few things about this Innovative company that have led to its nearly 200% gain in just the last year so first Nvidia dominates the AI industry what really makes Nvidia stand out against competitors is it's Auda technology Auda allows developers to use nvidia's gpus for high volume Computing not just Graphics this capability is essential for AI and data intensive applications and that really gives Nvidia a Competitive Edge that others simply don't have and that's why they're no longer just a Semiconductor Company they're a key player in AI cloud computing and data centers now all of those advancements and Innovations are paying off in in nvidia's financials with Revenue growth topping 200% in late 2023 and in early 2024 now even though that pace has slowed to about 80% in late 24 the numbers are still incredibly strong and the outlook for 2025 well many analysts expect another 40% to even 50% growth though some believe they might be underestimating nvidia's potential Nvidia does have a record outperforming expectations beating consensus estimates in every quarter since 2022 they've also consistently rais their guidance Often by more than 500 basis points above what analysts were forecasting this trend of beating expectations is likely to continue supported by strong demand for their Ai and GPU products there are a few other things that have retail investors excited that are helping to fuel this climb nvidia's stock split made its shares more accessible to smaller investors which often helps to boost share prices another split may be on the horizon raising the possibility of Nvidia being included in the Dow Jones Industrial index if that happens demand for the stock could surge due to increased buying from index funds and ETFs now when it comes to dividends this is a growth opportunity for NVIDIA the company's dividend might be small now but it is steady and there's room for growth with strong cash flow the company could increase its dividend payouts and continue its share repurchase program which already reduced the share count by an average of 6% last quarter let's get into the stock and its potential for growth analysts are overwhelmingly bullish on Nvidia with 43 ratings at a consensus Buy price Target it suggests the stock could see another 10% upside with the highend of estimates reaching near $175 about 40% above its current level now if Nvidia breaks through the critical resistance level of $135 it could pave the way to even higher gains by the time Q3 results are released in November nvidia's role in Ai and its strong growth metrics have cemented its place as a favor among investors with analysts backing it up and the potential for more growth on the horizon it is easy to see why Nvidia remains at the top of many watch lists and it's a stock we talk about here on this channel all the time so let us know what you think of nvidia's run and if it will continue or if you're waiting to see how the market reacts to their next earnings report in November we have lots of Nvidia content on our Channel with some of our own analysts Wayne in here at marketbeat please stay on the channel check those out for more Nvidia coverage and a lot of other marketbeat news right here on marketbeat media as always happy investing [Music]
